campaign.story:
Click here to enter our educators raffle!


Actions
On their turn players can either take the Introduce Action or the Use Skill Action.

Taking the Introduce Action
Choose a species card from the Field to introduce into your ecosystem. You can choose any species in the Field but must pay for it by placing one of your synergy tokens on each card to its right. If you take a card that has synergy tokens on it you get to take those as well!
Next place the chosen species on any empty space on your player board. When placing a species card, gain 1 synergy token for each shared habitat on all adjacent cards. 
Taking the Use Skill Action
When using Skills, you can either choose a single active skill or all of the exhausted skills. 

If you choose an active skill, resolve the effect of any active skill, then flip it over to its exhausted side. 
If you choose the exhausted skills, resolve the effects of all exhausted skills, then flip all skills to their active side. Then advance the game timer token one space. 
Wild Cards
Once per turn, you may discard 10 synergy tokens to take a wild card and place it on any empty space on your player board. 

A wild card has a set habitat and season, but can be any number from 1-5 when scoring in the game! 
Scoring
At the end of the game players will score their player boards to see who built the most interconnected ecosystem! 

Ecosystems (Sequences)
An ecosystem is created when two or more cards with matching habitats have been arranged in ascending or descending consecutive numerical order. Gain 1 point for each card in an ecosystem.
Research Tokens
Gain 1 additional point for each research token on cards when scoring an ecosystem. 
Keystone Species 
If you have a keystone species (symbol) in an ecosystem, score that ecosystem again. Do this for each keystone species in that ecosystem!
Secret Objectives
Secret Objectives can lead to big points at the end of the game! To complete a secret objective, the species cards on your player board must match the pattern of season symbols on your secret objective card. 
Keystone: North America features an immersive solo experience through the Field Journal! Here are a few things players will find within its pages;
 Story driven campaign! Follow the journal entries of a Jr. Field Biologist as they work on assignments that will take them across North America.
 20 Unique Challenges! Every assignment contains a unique challenge that will allow players to experience the game in fun and exciting new ways. 
 Secret Envelopes! Certain assignments allow players to unlock new species that can be added to the game.  
 Journal pages feature beautiful colored art! Experience North America and its parks through beautiful and fun journal sketches. 
 Learn about the different conservation efforts happening across North America! Journal entries and assignments feature environmental issues currently impacting important North American animals and ecosystems.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is Rose Gauntlet's first Kickstarter but we are confident in our ability to deliver on time. Isaac has over 10 years of game development experience and Lindsey has managed over 12 successful tabletop Kickstarter projects for other companies. We have already put a lot of time and resources into Keystone: North America to ensure the smoothest project and quickest delivery possible. Please note the this project is still being refined and we reserve the right to make any changes necessary for the quality of the game. This means there may be changes in art and graphic design from what is shown on the project page. 

Since this is 2021 it is possible that COVID and circumstances beyond our control could alter our current timeline. We have done our best to build extra room into our timeline to compensate for this, but it is still a possibility. If such a circumstance were to occur we pledge to be honest and keep communicating with backers during the delay.

If we believe there is an issue with the game at any time, the quality of the final product will always take precedence over the timeline. Again, if this were to occur, we will be open, honest, and keep communicating. However this game has been fully playtested with over 650 playthroughs logged and we feel confident that we will deliver on time.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
What This Is
Polyhedral dice specifically designed and packaged for rolling damage in Dungeons and Dragons Fifth Edition. These unique dice supplement your standard polyhedral set with defined damage in each roll during battle. Available in Metal and Acrylic. Plus, uniquely functional and stylish dice for spells, saves, sneak attacks and class features.
Tins for the metal dice sets
Why We Want This
One thing was clear after the completion of our original Damage Dice campaign for magical damage types; folks wanted to get physical. With these dice you can roll a war hammer smite with a bludgeoning die and radiant die at once and know which damage is what. Different colorways for each design allow for rolling multi-attacks all at once and knowing which attack roll goes with which damage roll. Why should only casters get the fun of rolling big hand fulls of dice!  Mostly, this is about style. D&D is a game of color and theme after all, so it's nice to have a special set of metal piercing dice for your favorite rogue.
Metal?! Yes metal. We want our damage dice to embody each type to the fullest so  metal seemed the obvious choice. The material allows for each design to further represent slashing, piercing and bludgeoning. Additionally, we’ve created acrylic sets for a more accessible cost option (and we know metal isn’t for everyone).
 Damage Dice Sets are special: 
Just like our magic sets, these sets are specifically designed for damage rolls.
Sets include what you need for attacks with standard D&D weapons – 1d4, 2d6, 1d8, 1d10, 1d12 and a 1d20 (dice quantity doubled in acrylic sets). 
D10s are d10s, not half of a percentile set. You roll 1–10 damage, not 0–9 or 00–99.
Stylish custom molds with damage type in the design and edge
Tins for metal and embroidered bags for acrylic with the damage type.
What else?
Some of the stretch goals in our last campaign were dice that could have been their own campaigns, such as the bardic inspiration set. This time, we considered going a more traditional route; keeping the stretch goals to simple accessories … but seeing as a ultra-specific purpose-built, surprise dice sets are kind of our brand now, we figured why not! This is about bringing as many dice into the world as we can.
How We’re going to do this
We’re using everything we learned from our first project creating the magical damage types to make these even better. We’ve already created some prototype molds and we’ll need to make so many more molds. Each design requires a unique mold, and minimum order, so we need the community’s help to bring these dice into the world, and onto our tables.
Who is doing this?
Gyld is a small company in Ann Arbor, Michigan. Gordie, Al and James have pooled their free-time and free-cash into this and a few other projects in the name of creating items for table-top that we want to exist (and use).
Shipping Rates & VAT
Shipping and VAT costs are not included in your pledge. We’ll be using Pledge Manager after the campaign which will calculate shipping based on your location. Estimated shipping costs are below, and may change based on location, rates and whatever weird stuff happens between now and the ship date (2020, as you may remember, was a little bananas).
We have arranged for UK, EU and Australian distribution this time so VAT will be handled in Pledge Manager as well so you won’t have to worry about paying on delivery. NOTE: EU and UK are changing VAT rules for 2021 so we’ll update this section once we know specifics.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The designs and prototypes are complete for this campaign which reduces our risk further from the last campaign. However, as we learned in 2020, anything can happen. The delivery estimate here is what we were able to deliver within even with a global-pandemic shutdown so we’re very confident that we can make it happen, but then again – who knows.

One of the things we learned from the last campaign is that the best part of Kickstarter is working with the community to create something that doesn’t exist, and that we wouldn’t be able to make by ourselves, or at a big company. We can make weird, ultra-specific, dice that only work for one spell, like Chaos Bolt. We can take input from the community during the campaign and include it in the final designs – y’all really got behind matte finish so we pushed it up - and that’s what we love. So please remember that this is a pledge not a pre-order. We may change designs, finishes, ink colors or details based on the campaign and community input. We’d love to have you on board as a backer, to help us bring these dice to life and be part of the process.

Molds be moldin' colors be colorin'

updates.update_content:
"help me"
Bag prototypes
It feels like I definitely, 100%, for sure used that Bag Hutch reference before... but it's so good. While we're waiting for color-test samples, we have the bags ready for all acrylic and Mini sets. Yes! We're making bags for Portent, Death Saves, Wild Magic etc. as well. It wasn't the original plan but one of the top requests from the first campaign is So... here they are! (that wild-magic bag tho: hott).

Production Update
Happy spring lovely backers! It seems like it was just snowing on us in a video update, and now we're ramping up for outdoor D&D sessions. Okay, in Michigan both of those things can happen in the same day, but we're excited for the flowers. 
Production is on schedule so far, and much smoother than last spring (no surprise there). Molds have been approved and ordered for all designs, packaging is designed and proofed, bag fabrics and thread colors have been selected. We had color & material samples for the acrylics run on our magic damage dice molds to save some time; we'll have those to look at very soon. We'll do a full walk-through of each sample like last time and get input from y'all,

Pledge Manager is Live!
Backers should now have an invitation to your pledge manager where you'll be able to select which sets you would like, use any extra $ you added, add more stuff, and handle shipping and taxes (if applicable). Make sure to check the email address you have in Kickstarter (and your spam folder if you don't see it). We're using a 3rd party (not Kickstarter) pledge manager (called Pledge Manager), so reach out to us with any questions or issues. Email (gyldmaster@gylded.com) or send a message on Kickstarter and we'll to it pretty quick!
Production Schedule

You don't have to cast Eldritch Blast every turn
... but c'mon. Warlocks rejoice! You can now zap ancient and unknowable power on a whim with style and efficiency. Roll all at once. Your color coded dice let you know which zip goes with what zap. Some may say, "dice for only one class? How much are these actually gonna get used?" ... and those folks have never met a Warlock.

Good Sunday morning (Eastern US)!
We hope you've had a lovely weekend and have been able to get some table-time in. Friday night Gordie & Al took a break for a session of the original campaign that started many of us back into D&D after a long post-schooldays hiatus. The characters were the inspiration behind the original damage dice project, and now at level 14, we need stacks on stacks of damage dice. Love a good up-cast guiding bolt when dealing with foes from down below.

updates.update_content:
Stretch Updates
As always, our goal is moar dice. All of the sets we've ever made are those that we want to exist because we want to use them at our tables. To that end, we've been working over the past week to figure out how we can get as many of these sets made as humanly possible without putting us at risk of epic failure :).  We've been able to condense the remaining goals (and rearrange them a little according to perceived popularity in the comments section) to a place where I think we can get them all made with your help!

Sneak Attack is Unlocked!
The Sneak Attack set is now available for you to choose as an acrylic set option! We're extra excited about this one as the rogue is a great time; one of the original four. With all the new archetypes available there are a ton of creative ways to play a rogue; whether you're in combat or not. The beauty of Sneak attack is that the whole party can get in on the strategy and positioning to make sure the rogue always has the upper hand.

campaign.story:
Greetings adventurer! Leave the troubles of the road outside and have a seat by the fire. Welcome to a project that is certain to help you put the worries of the outside world at bay. Black Oak Workshop is proud to return to Kickstarter with our 2021 lineup of Advent-ure Calendars! The Holiday Tavern and the 2020 Calendars were well received and we have returned with new themes to ensure there is something for everyone. 2020 is GONE and we are excited to kick off 2021 with some polyhedral adventure!
Due to the positive response last year, we are returning with three all new calendars this year. The goal with three is to allow choices for our backers. Not everyone celebrates the Christmas holiday that is associated with traditional Advent calendars, so we present an additional holiday themed calendar (Halloween) as well as offering a calendar that is not specifically tied to any holiday. This allows everyone a way to countdown with cool dice.
We've got some wonderful surprises for everyone included in each calendar. There are some new, extra large dice and an altogether custom shape which is very exciting! Our costs were impacted as a result, but we only had to increase prices marginally over previous calendars. In addition to the cool new sizes and shapes you will discover this year, we're including a bonus, thematic item in each of the calendars designed to match the theme. Read on adventurers!
Advent-ure Calendars are filled with custom polyhedral dice that follow a theme. Our calendars are inspired by traditional advent calendars and they help you count down your holidays or any other event while celebrating a love of dice. Each day, a new chamber is opened and inside you will find custom polyhedral dice that feature all new, never before seen designs. You will never find old overstock dice or standard mass produced sets in our calendars!
Once again, we have commissioned the Fraim Bros to do our box art and we feel they really brought the magic to this project - the artwork is gorgeous!! Check out these beautiful calendars!
Advent-ure Calendar 5: The Dragon's Lair The dark and foreboding cave entrance warns of terrible dangers within! Do you have the courage to draw your sword and press onward to discover untold treasures? Beware the dragon that lies within! Count down to any special date with these cool dice!
Custom Polyhedral RPG Sets: 3
Custom Polyhedral Singles: 3
Total Dice: 24
Dimensions: 13.2 x 8.8 x 1.7 (in)
MSRP: $65
Advent-ure Calendar 6: The Deathgale Galleon Storm clouds foretell the coming of the haunted galleon! The crew is said to be cursed and will forever sail the seas in search of new prey. Do you dare board the ship and discover dark mysteries inside the barnacled hull? Count down to Halloween with these not-so-terrifying dice!
Custom Polyhedral RPG Sets: 4
Custom Polyhedral Singles: 3
Total Dice: 31
Dimensions: 15.5 x 11.2 x 1.75 (in)
MSRP: $75
Advent-ure Calendar 7: Santa's Workshop The dream destination of children all around the world is certain to hold a great many magical surprises! Come inside and see what Santa has been working on with his elves! Count down to Christmas with these holiday themed dice!
Custom Polyhedral RPG Sets: 3
Custom Polyhedral Singles: 3
Total Dice: 24
Dimensions: 13.2 x 8.8 x 1.7 (in)
MSRP: $65
 We hope you think these themes are as exciting as we do!
As with our previous Advent-ure Calendars, we are steadfastly choosing not to reveal images of the dice inside to preserve the magic and fun of opening a countdown style calendar. However, we can tell you the following:
 Big! All the dice are larger Black Oak sized dice - these are big and fun to roll!
 Bigger! We are introducing some special over-sized (even for Black Oak) dice in two of the calendars this year.
 Exclusive! All the dice feature entirely new custom designs and they are not available anywhere else - these dice are exclusive to this project!
 More Exclusive! We have an entirely new dice shape for one of our calendars this year! Hint: Have you been naughty or nice this year?
 Variety! Each of the dice are unique. Other than the possibility of set pairs, there are no duplicates of the dice inside. Also, you will never find our old stock in these calendars - we don't use them to thin out stuff that isn't selling well.
 Style! All the dice feature either solid, swirl, transparent or glitter styles. And maybe even glow-in-the-dark!
 Thematic! The packaging for each calendar embraces a unique theme and features beautiful artwork to help bring this theme to life. This theme carries over to the dice designs as well.
 Collectible! Except for a few of the dice outlined below (see Special Singles), none of these will be available outside of this project. This is it!
We always strive to provide a fantastic product to our backers while also putting a focus on value. We are offering the same exceptional quality as our previous calendars while including a few specialty dice this year (larger and new shapes). As a result, the pricing for the new calendars is slightly higher than last year. Additional calendars in the pledge manager and those available post project on our website will be sold at the MSRP rate.
While we are choosing not to reveal the dice in these calendars for obvious reasons, we can show you dice similar to what you will receive. Below are photos of some of the polyhedral sets from our earlier Advent-ure Calendars.
As you can see, the dice in a given calendar come in a mix of designs, but they follow a general theme. Our backers resoundingly loved these dice and we can promise you that the dice featured in the new calendars will be just as cool.
No project would be complete without something fun to look forward to. For this project, we are continuing with extras that match the themes we've selected. Please help us spread the word out there so these items can find their way into the world!
Below is a text only summary of the project goals:
 $40,000 Funded! **UNLOCKED** All three of the new Advent-ure Calendars are now unlocked. Additional calendars will be available for purchase in the pledge manager.
 $50,000 Dice Bags! **UNLOCKED** The three matching dice bags (one design matching each calendar) are unlocked. All backers will receive one of these dice bags of their choice per calendar backed for (LIMIT 3). These bags are made of the same quality materials as our standard dice bags and are 5.5" X 8.5" in size. Additional dice bags will be available for purchase in the pledge manager at a discounted rate.
 $60,000 Mystery Dice Level 1! **UNLOCKED** Each calendar will have an additional mystery die included somewhere inside the calendar itself. These dice will be matching in theme, size and quality and each features a unique design and/or color scheme from other dice in the calendar (these are not doubles).
 $69,000 Mystery Dice Level 2! **UNLOCKED** Each calendar will have a SECOND mystery die included somewhere inside the calendar itself. These dice will be matching in theme, size and quality and each features a unique design and/or color scheme from other dice in the calendar (these are not doubles).
 $78,000 Mystery Dice Level 3! **UNLOCKED** Each calendar will have a THIRD mystery die included somewhere inside the calendar itself. These dice will be matching in theme, size and quality and each features a unique design and/or color scheme from other dice in the calendar (these are not doubles).
 ??? Additional mysterious stretch goals are possible.
We will be releasing a few of the dice from the calendars as singles available for a purchase outside of the project. This is because we know they will make cool gifts and our backers may very well want a few extras to throw in their dice bags.
Out of the 79 dice included on the project, 7 will be available as add-on purchases. There are 2 dice from each calendar that we are revealing and an additional die from the Deathgale Galleon (total 3).
Below is a text only summary of the Special Singles:
 Sparky d4 (Dragon's Lair) Who doesn't love cute little dragons? You can use this one to roll or as a marker for your familiar! A tiny flying dragon means you've rolled a 4 on this purple swirl with silver ink d4.
 Dragonstone d20 (Dragon's Lair) The crown jewel of the Dragon's Hoard, this oversized crystal clear d20 (white ink) is a handful! Our standard d20s are scaled to match a 19mm d6, but these d20s are even chunkier. A crystal marks the 20 result.
 Rolling Bones pair of d6s (Deathgale Galleon) These two d6s are black with white ink and have an increasing number of bones to indicate the result with a cool skull as the 6 result. Pirates love them!
 Jib the Monkey d20 (Deathgale Galleon) He's a loyal companion, but you can bet he's looking forward to finding a new home on dry land! This beige swirl and brown ink d20 has a little monkey for the 20 result.
 Giant Christmas Tree d4 (Santa's Workshop) There is always a big Christmas tree standing in Santa's Workshop! This giant sized d4 is almost identical to our d4 in Advent-ure Calendar 1, but it's a LOT bigger!
 Naughty/Nice d2 (Santa's Workshop) This d2 comes in the shape of Santa's book of names. It is a beige swirl with brown ink and this shape is a first for us. Have you been naughty or nice this year?
In addition to the singles from the calendars, we have plenty of add-on items to choose from. You can see most of our available products on our website. Most products there as well as a few others will be available as part of the pledge manager process that will begin shortly after the campaign funding period ends.
Below is an overview list and general price breakdown of our products:
Additional Advent-ure Calendars 5-7 at MSRP
Special Singles Calendar Dice $4 (reduced for backers)
 Rolling Bones pair of d6's (Deathgale Galleon) $8 (reduced for backers)
 Dragonstone Oversized d20 (Dragon's Lair) $11 (reduced for backers)
Calendar Dice Bags (if unlocked) $10 (reduced for backers)
Black Oak Thematic Polyhedrals (singles) $5
Black Oak Thematic RPG Sets $15
Additional Dice Bags $12
Totally Geek Pins $8
You can choose to add additional funds to your pledge now to cover add-on items or simply add them post project during the pledge manager process.
For those of you who have not seen or rolled our dice, we are sure you will be pleasantly surprised. Below is a size comparison of a Black Oak d20 and a standard d20. All of our dice are scaled to match a 19mm (3/4") d6 instead of a standard 16mm d6. The result is that they have a better feel in your hand and look great when rolling. They are also much easier to read. Note that all of the calendars this year contain an even larger die than our standard size or a specialty shape we have not produced before.
We like to be creative and innovate! Last year we introduced a new take on the traditional d4 in some of our calendars. This allows additional design space for the theme while maintaining functionality. The Campfire d4 was one of these. We received an overwhelmingly positive response to this last year and are continuing with the concept this year on more of the d4s.
You can back our projects with confidence! Reviewing any of our past projects will reveal we go above and beyond to deliver a great experience to our backers who are the best backers on Kickstarter! We take our commitment to you seriously and you can trust us to deliver. We have shipped on time or early on virtually every one of our projects.
What you see is what you get on this and all of our projects. Black Oak Workshop always strives to show you photo samples of the actual product. We carry an upfront investment to do this so that you can feel safe in helping produce a great product. Below are images of the actual calendars - the product you will receive will be exactly like what you see here!
UPDATE: We will be shipping internationally for the project with the exception of the United Kingdom. All international shipping costs are to be determined and will be charged in the pledge manager post project.
All shipments will be processed through the United States Postal Service. Please note that 2021 shipping rate changes have impacted the shipping estimates. Domestic (USA) orders will ship utilizing Priority Mail. International orders will ship utilizing First-Class Package International Service. All rewards will be packed securely in an effort to minimize risk of damage during shipping. Tracking numbers are emailed to backers at the email address on file with Kickstarter upon printing of the respective shipping label.
All rewards will ship in the month of September 2021. Domestic USA orders should arrive by October 1, but we cannot guarantee that. We have seen some shipments take a few days or 2-3 weeks to reach the end destination due to staffing issues of the USPS. International orders are not guaranteed to arrive by any specific date.
NOTE: All shipping fees will be collected post the campaign as part of the BackerKit pledge manager process. Please see the shipping matrix below for cost estimates. For the THREE CALENDAR SET (triple pack) and RETAILER ONLY reward levels, we are only shipping to the USA.
COVID-19 NOTICE: The delivery timeline and above cost estimates are subject to change based on the COVID-19 pandemic. Currently, we feel confident in meeting the delivery schedule and staying close to these cost estimates. However, as the world learned in 2020, things can change quickly. We will always keep our backers updated as to any changes as they develop.
Are you a verifiable brick and mortar retailer? Would you like to carry the Advent-ure Calendars or any of our other products in your store? We'd love to earn your business! Sales for our retailers on our previous Advent-ure Calendar projects were fantastic and we only had one complaint: they wanted more to be available than we were able to provide! This will not be an issue on this project! Note that online based retailers are not permitted. 
Simply back at the 'Retailer Only' level and, if this is your first time backing a Black Oak project, contact us through the creator contact area of the Kickstart page or through our website here so we can verify you as a brick and mortar retail store. Your pledge will serve as a credit towards your selections in the pledge manager. Qualified retailers receive a wholesale rate on all our products and all products will be available in the pledge manager for you at wholesale rates. The suggested MSRP for the Advent-ure Calendars are $65 (24 chambers/custom dice) and $75 (31 chambers/custom dice). Note that if additional 'mystery dice' are unlocked, they will be incorporated into the calendars, though the MSRP will not change.
NOTE: Costs for shipping to retailers will be based on quantities ordered and will be determined at the time of shipment. Final shipping costs for retailers will not be handled in the pledge manager.
Thank you for checking out our latest project!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
If funded, our priority will be to meet or exceed backer expectations. We structure our Kickstart projects with a goal of minimizing risks and challenges in an effort to help build confidence in our backers:

* Straightforward design
* Visual representation of the final product
* Partner with an established production vendor
* Research and capture all costs
* Provide regular project status updates
* Communicate any issues as they arise

Given the successful fulfillment and positive backer feedback from our earlier projects, we are confident that we can and will meet our stated goals.

NOTE: Our highest risk on this project is the COVID-19 pandemic. We cannot accurately foresee the impact the virus may have on the project timeline.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

www.ConflictGames.com
Sometimes, it only takes one distinct characteristic for a monster to stick in our memories forever.
Sometimes, it’s the nuances in a battle that makes a strike so beautifully epic.
Sometimes, it's the monster’s crazed, desperate last moments that cause others to shudder.

MONSTER DESCRIPTION CARDS HELP YOU CRAFT UNFORGETTABLE MONSTERS AND THEIR EVENTS FROM START TO BITTER END! 
Monster Description Cards are extensive storytelling tools containing purposely unique flavor text to add realism or memorable characterization to creatures and their subsequent events. These cards provide keywords to spark your imagination and example phrases for their use. Written by novelists and organized by dungeon-masters, the cards are designed for quick on-the-fly use and inherently add randomization. The list of monster parts uniquely depicted include, but are not limited to, the following:
 Horns
   Teeth
   Claws
   Protrusions
   Bodily Forms (Hides, Ears, Eyes, etc.)
   Tails
   Wings
   Tentacles 
Between great heroes and great monsters lies the pinnacle of drama — Combat. The unrelenting tension that comes with knowing blood will be spilled, and life may be lost. Monster Description Cards will guide you while you detail these moments, providing keywords and examples for horns that PIERCE, claws that SLASH, tails that BLUDGEON, and more. Hundreds of new ways to describe monster strikes in these familiar categories: 
Slashing
Piercing
Blunt

What happens when a monster is cornered, heavily injured, or both? What if the creature is smart enough to be deceitful, spiteful, or vindictive in its last moments? How can you subtly share that your monster is on its last legs, but there is still a worrisome hint of malice in their eyes? These questions are all answered by the LAST STAND section of the cards. Where examples help illustrate the response of creatures facing overwhelming odds and perhaps displaying heroism, sacrifice, or wickedness of their own.


 “WRITERS OF ALL LEVELS LOVE THE IMPACTFUL NARRATIVE EXPERIENCES DESCRIPTION CARDS ADD TO THEIR WORKS” 
There are common composition principles that ask writers to "show and not tell ." That is, allow the reader to experience the story through actions, words, thoughts, senses, and feelings rather than through the author's summarization and cliches. The Monster Description Cards reinforces this principle by providing keywords to spark the imagination and elegant examples chock-full of distinctive story-building concepts.
"Cliche Busting Cards"
There are three cliche busting writer's tools within the Monster Description Cards.

 1. Above all else, the "core descriptions" provide brilliant creature concepts. They share unique ways to introduce or explain distinct physical features to an audience. These "core descriptions" allow writers to stay far away from monsters, terms, phrases, or even ideas that are now unoriginal and thoroughly overused.
   2. The second tool in the deck is the Combat Sections. These areas focus on drawing an audience into the sheer violence of monstrous combat, exploring unsettling concepts like great height and length, great strength, even preternatural abilities. They touch on the tension that lingers with the threat of a hero's death. These cards collect these concepts and inherently randomize them for writers to literally draw inspiration.
   3. The LAST STAND is a fresh and new idea for our card tools. Whether you write horror, sci-fi, or fantasy fiction, your creatures and oddities will need to be compelling and memorable, particularly in their last moments. The LAST STAND helps by offering depictions of your monstrosities on the verge of defeat while adding a bit of doubt in the reader's mind with one last defiant moment.
  AS A STORYTELLER, HAVING A MEMORABLE ANTAGONIST IS A KEY INGREDIENT TO SUCCESS. SO JOIN US! WE BELIEVE YOU WILL LOVE THESE CARDS.
For GameMasters (In-game Play)
The cards will melt right into your game, and your players will think you are brilliant. They will provide idea after idea on improving monster encounters. But more importantly, they will also drive you to new, full-blown campaign ideas. The type of campaign that players will reminisce about for years to come. The Monster Description Cards archive these feats by offering up concepts over statistical modeled stat-blocks. The cards narrate one-of-a-kind characteristics that you can easily add to existing monsters, creatures, or oddities. 

Introduce extraordinary creatures to your players, giving them clear signs of why they might be unique, even among their kin. 

Improve combat by focusing on the right adjectives associated with the body part landing the blow, such as claws, tails, or fangs. Not only are there specific narrations for specific body parts, but they are also broken down by blunt strikes, slashing strikes, and piercing strikes. With these multiple combinations, you can keep your combat fresh game after game. 

Lastly, there are always moments in the game where a GM would like to subtly provide hope to their players by indicating the monster is nearing defeat. These epic final moments are depicted in the LAST STAND sections of the Monster Description Cards.
Writing advice on worldbuilding typically leads towards lists of 'rules' and 'tips' which are either too general to be useful or downright wrong. The Monster Description Cards instead provide concepts and implementations of ideas capable of driving your imagination to discoveries about the world you want to create. Alongside the Magic Description Cards, the Monster Description Cards can immerse you in creative ideas and concepts that are anything but cliché.

IF YOU'RE A GM, THIS IS AN EASY BUY, BUY, BUY DECISION.

Familiars and Animal Companions: Your Familiars and Animal Companions are cool as hell. Let me make them sound cool as hell. Select a few cards that match the combat style of your familiar or animal companion and hand them to the Gamemaster to describe their attacks with style. Critical hits made by your Familiars or Animal Companion should be magnificent, and these cards provide that strike description that can be so satisfying. You can even have a LAST STAND card ready for your Familiars or Animal Companion just if things come down to that. Moreover, the cards' descriptions can be the basis of the unique features that make your Familiar or Animal Companion distinctively yours. So let’s build something special with these cards.

Shapeshifting: In tabletop RPGs, there are thousands of classes/powers/feats/spells that can shapeshift or grow body parts into lethal weapons. Thousands more transform hands to claws, teeth to fangs, arms to tentacles or growing tails, bony protrusions, even wings. Each of these wonderful transformations can benefit from the Monster Description Cards. The Cards will instantly make these transforms unique and unforgettable with clever depictions, separating your character's ability from the crowd of other characters with similar capabilities or sometimes the exact same class ability, power, feats, or spells.

Using the cards to depict transform spells: Using the Monster description cards to verbally illustrate the results of magical effects that modify a character's body is more than just a way to be unique; it's how you build a legacy. Stylize your character's abilities with these cards, so they are recognized by others, respected, or even feared.

Monster Journal Entries: Commemorate the monsters you've encountered by inserting Monster Description Cards in your monster journal. Flip through cards of unique descriptions to depict the memorable battles along your character's journey. Each card is your personal trophy, a memento of your battle-scars from the most challenging encounters. You can even use these cards to log essential information about certain monsters in your campaign, making every entry a result of your character's meticulous observations during battle. Sing the song better than any bard could with these encounter-defining descriptions. 
Build a strong visual library with the entire series of description cards from Conflict Games. The entire Description Cards line can be used as a database for ideas, concepts, events, environments, and fight scenes. Not only do these cards bring new ideas to concept art, but the combat styles and descriptions therein can help portray your creation in a way that works and sells a room on the idea.

During the Concept art process, Game Design, and Film writing, an artist and designer often craft creative assets like anomalies, monsters, characters, and fight scenes that heavily influence the final work. Our Descriptions Cards have been used during this process for great success. If the goal is to provide realistically visualize ideas for VFX teams, animators, and modelers, then the Magic, Combat, and now Monster Description Cards can be an innovative way to help and become key part of your process.
Unlike our previous description cards, these cards are double-sided and chock-full of goodness.
Backers will receive: 
200+ Descriptions and introductions of various monster components
  300+ Combat descriptions sorted by monster appendage
  100+ “Last Stand” descriptions, for portraying monsters that are heavily damaged vengeful, desperate, or relentless
  Printed on heavy card stock (350 gms)
  Large Format Card (tarot sized cards)
 
Size: 2.75'' x 4.75'' (70mm x 120mm)
  Over 100 total cards, including stretch goals
Each card is organized under the following general categories:
 Horns & Frills—Horns are hard permanent outgrowths, often curved and pointed and typically found in pairs. Frills are upward-curving bony plates typically extending behind the skull.

 Fangs & Maws —The Fangs category is considered the mouths, jaws, teeth, and maws of large, small, or odd creatures.
   Claws & Pincers—The claws category consists of pincers, paws, talons, and hooks. That is, any style of sharp, usually slender, and curved nail at the end of hands and feet.
   Protrusions & Osteoderms—This category consists of bony deposits that form knots above scales. Protrusions regularly produce sharp structures that can be used offensively, or widen scales and plates that add to the defenses of a monster.
 Bodily Forms—Creature hides, eyes, noses, ears, or other physical oddities that might distinguish a creature from its nightmarish kin are the focus of this group.
   Tails—The hindmost part of a monster, such as the flexible extension of the backbone in a vertebrate. Tails can be used to whip, constrict, or trip an opponent.
   Wings—This category focuses on wings of all shapes and sizes, functional or non-functional: Elliptical wings, high-speed wings, long soaring wings, and more. For the cards combat backside, wings will batter with winds, slice with sharp edges, and stab with spiked ends for a unique description style.
   Tentacles—The tentacles cards help depict any elongated, boneless, flexible organs, limbs, antenna, or barbels of famed monsters.
Potentially more to come with stretch goals, so please back and share this project.

One the backside of the cards are Combat Description for the associating Monster part. The cards are divided into three suits, which correspond to the three common attack types of Blunt, Slashing, and Piercing.
 

We understand that there are a multitude of genres, points-of-views, worlds, rulesets, and games that writers and tabletop gamers choose. That’s why our writing philosophy dictates the following rules which will ensure our content is system-agnosit, narrative Neutral and friendly to writers at all levels of expertise:
 We don’t describe the person perceiving the monster.
   We don’t give names to monsters.
   We don’t mention blood specifically, but generalizations like “fluid” are occasionally used .
   We don’t describe the surface the monster is on.
   Nothing cheesy, corny, or racy will be accepted.
   Both Heroes and Antagonists should be cool, so let’s make them sound cool!
  System Neutral: The card descriptions are not tied to any tabletop ruleset or Genre, meaning they can be used to describe monsters in any of your favorite tabletop-rpgs. If you run multiple games in multiple systems, these cards are great to use in any and all of your games.
The cards will help you answer question like these:
In a sea of zombies, what if you need one to stand out?
  In a world of dragons what makes this dragon different? Special? Memorable?
Anime is all about unique characters and ability, so why not use the cards to create singularity among a crowded field?

Risks and challenges
All projects carry some risk. Fortunately, this is our 5th Kickstarter under the Conflict Games LLC brand and we have consulted on over 20 others. The Monster Description Card Deck is a fairly straightforward product. However, the foreseen risks involved include shipping logistics and the unexpected cancellation of contracted artists, writers, editors or product manufacturers. In the case of contract cancellation, the contractor will need to be replaced. Which in turn, could delay the project's completion but shouldn’t prevent its completion. 

In regard to shipping, logistics could become burdensome. We are unable to control the fact that domestic and out-of-the-US shipping costs seem to be spiraling out of control. However with our target funding goal, we don't foresee this preventing the project from succeeding; although, it may impact delivery dates. 

The one guarantee we can make is that we will be transparent with issues and communicate them to our backers as quickly as we can. We strongly believe our target funding goal is sufficient to complete our vision for the product. 

If you're as excited about this card deck as we are, then help us exceed that goal - we have much more we wish to do for this card series. This is just the first step in an exciting journey so please JOIN US!

updates.update_userinfo: May Project Update: We are Content Complete!
updates.update_content:
Hey Backers,

CONTENT COMPLETE
Our writing team created over 3,000 different variations of monster descriptions, 880 of which we have approved with flying colors and therefore for production. However, some of the best descriptions are longer than others. This may be a problem for physical cards, but not for the digital products. Therefore, we will be doing another round of selection to ensure only the cream of the crop gets printed. At the same time, we did not want to shortchange you guys on the creative efforts because of trivial physical limitations. Therefore, we have also decided that all 880 descriptions will be published on the Digital products (i.e., API, app, and writer's grid). The physical cards are my favorite, but there is an advantage to digital. With the bulk of the writing work completed, we are now moving on to the project's subsequent two phases. Below is a quick breakdown of the timeline.

Hey Backer Family,
I wanted to provide an update on our schedule.  As you would imagine, there's good news and bad news. The bad news is the project is delayed by about three months. The reason why it is delayed is the good news. We are still writing and editing the Monster Description Cards content.  This part of the process should have been completed about 30-40 days ago. However, I have been extraordinarily particular about the descriptions that make the final cut. In my mind, they must be good —all of them.  For that reason, our writing room has created a ton of descriptions, and to guarantee high-quality creativity, we also have many rejections, edits, and rewrites. Each of these steps has gone slower than I anticipated.  I may add writers to the project, but I believe the best solution to the delay is to simply keep writing. There is no substitute for hard work, so work hard we shall.

campaign.story:
The Wildsea is a tabletop roleplaying game from Quillhound Studios for 2-6 players inspired by stories like Sunless Sea, Bastion, and the Bas-Lag Trilogy. Set in a world overrun by greenery, Wildsea uses a narrative, fiction-first d6 dicepool system that draws inspiration from games like Belly of the Beast, Blades in the Dark, and 13th Age. 
Clickthrough to access the Quick Start Rules!
This campaign's goal is to raise funds to produce and print a 1st edition of the Wildsea RPG. This is a production Kickstarter: after the campaign closes, we'll be using the funds raised to create a fully realized beautiful rulebook. The budget goal of $15,000 represents the minimum amount needed to bring the book to life with the resources we currently have available. 
Any additional funds will be funneled back directly into the production of the RPG, adding more content, art, professional layouts, and an offset print run to deliver a premium tabletop roleplaying book that will be a showcase for any collection. 
 Some three hundred years ago the empires of the world were toppled by a wave of fast growing greenery, a tide of rampant growth spilling from the West known as the Verdancy. 
Now chainsaw-driven ships cut their way across dense treetop waves, their engines powered by oilfruit, rope-golems, honey and pride.
You play a wildsailor, part of a motley crew consisting of humanity's weathered descendants, cactoid gunslingers, centipedal fungi, silk-clothed spiderfolk, and other, stranger things. 
With your fellow crewmembers, you'll journey across the lingin' tide discovering charts, pursuing drives, and avoiding mires of the deep. 
The Wildsea hungers and grows, roots sinking deep into the forest floor as the waves above ripple with life.  What will you discover in its depths? 



Check out our Actual Play on the Don't Forget Your Towel Podcast!
The Wildsea is a fiction-first roleplaying game with narrative and character decisions driving your interaction with the mechanics of the Wild Words engine. The game uses a d6 narrative dicepool system that constantly pushes the story forward.
At character creation, players select a Bloodline, Origin and Post, each with a variety of options to inform and customize a character's background and playstyle:
The four core bloodlines of the Wildsea: the cactuslike Ektus, Ardent survivors, hive spider Tzelicrae, and fungi Gau.
 Your Edges represent the way in which your character is most used to solving problems. Your Grace, Iron, Instinct, Sharps, Teeth, Tides, or Veils. 
Your Skills are more specific areas in which your character has training or a natural advantage. Things like Climbing, Charming, Cooking, Breaking, or Scavenging. 
You also have Aspects - gear, traits, or companions - that can be used, expended, or damaged throughout the course of play. 
 Resources are useful oddities, short term expendables used for things like whispers, scavenge, and specimens.
Your known Languages allow you to engage with different people and cultures in the diverse world of the Wildsea.  
Finally, your Drives and Mires define your personality, motivation, and long term goals. 
Each crew will also have their own ship, a vessel capable of braving the unique challenges of the lingin tide. You might cut a path with a chainsaw-ridged prow, drag yourself with hooks and grapples or scuttle from branch to branch on insectile limbs.
Customize and upgrade  your ship by designing its Size, Frame, Hull, Bite, and Engine, and outfitting  it with different Fittings. Make it your home on the waves! 
Stories and Characters develop as the crew pursues milestones, while time in the game is abstracted through three distinct phases: scenes, montages, and journeys. 
The Wildsea will initially be presented in landscape, 11.5 x 8.5'' inch (~29 x 22 cm) hardcover book with around 200 pages of mostly black and white interiors punctuated by full color spread chapter headings.  
Mockup. Artwork and Design of Physical Book not final. Design shown is a hardcover perfect bound edition that would only be unlocked should we reach certain stretch goal milestones.
As the campaign grows, so will the quality and contents of the book. Should we reach certain stretch goals, we will upgrade the physical book to a 3-piece clothbound, full colour, sewn book sure to be a centerpiece of any collection. For more information, see the Stretch Goals section below.
The initial funding goal of $15,000 represents the bare minimum for the creators to produce and print physical copies of the book and recoup the funds already expended by the creator to the artists. 

Community Copies: At Collector's Edition and above tiers, we'll include additional digital Community Copies to be claimed by the public. Community Copies provide a way for those with less means to enjoy content and are a feature of Itch.io. When our page on the platform goes live, we'll add Community Copies commensurate with the amount of backers we have at higher tiers.

Shipping is not included in the pledge levels for this campaign and will be calculated and added on when we are ready to ship via Backerkit. This is a production Kickstarter and it may be up to a year before we start shipping out physical copies. It would therefore be inaccurate  to include the shipping rates as part of the funds raised for this campaign. 
As in: you will not be charged additional VAT or Customs Taxes on your shipped goods.
Mythopoeia is currently in the process of partnering with fulfillment centers based all over the world to deliver customs-friendly shipping, including to Europe and Oceania.  According to our most recent quotes, packages for a <1kg (~2 lbs) package average around $7.50 to the USA, UK, Germany, and Netherlands and around $20 to Oceania and Canada. 

Shipping has been quite tumultuous in recent months due to the ongoing pandemic and politics. Canadian postage from the USA seems to have taken a dramatic spike over the past four years. This is a problem we are actively working on. If you know any local Canadian or Australian distributors for USA goods, we would love to hear from you!

If we reach our initial goal of $15,000, we'll include new Origins for character creation not seen in the Quickstart Rules! We'll also throw in a set of digital wallpapers and other high resolution Wildsea Artwork as part of the Kickstarter exclusive digital bonuses. 
At $17,000 we will be able to commission a full Wildsea Soundtrack from the amazing Liam P. Vaughan, composer of Thrash, Tangle, Sink, the song used in our Kickstarter video!  
At $20,000 we'll be able to afford to turn the book from mostly black and white to full colour! To do so will require us to go back and recolour about two thirds of our total art assets - a significant endeavor! 

At $25,000 we'll bring on board a Professional Layout Artist to help design the final look of the book!  We'll also produce and release Virtual Play Surfaces to facilitate online play on your favorite platforms of choice.

At $30,000 we'll be able to raise the rates of our artists as well as commission an expanded bestiary from bestiary artist Katy Shmeckerel (@schmeckerel)! 
At $32,000 we'll release the SRD for the Wild Words Engine, allowing you to hack and release your own games! To celebrate this milestone, we'll also be commissioning Creators to create new content for the Wildsea including new factions, beasts, and  ships, and perhaps even additional Reaches...
At $35,000 we'll be able to upgrade the specs of both the Standard and Collector's Edition of The Wildsea! This may include things like an offset print run, three piece clothbound hardcover, and embossed finish. 
At $37,000 we'll include a chapter on Arconautics - the study of the weird and strange. Arconautics presents an array of additional options for both players and Fireflies that want to embrace the extraordinary - alchemists, augurs, ironbound automatons, manipulators of metal and plantlife. Includes new bloodlines, origins, posts, skills, and hazards! 
At $40,000 we'll be able to spare no expense when it comes to printing the book, including being able to lower our carbon footprint by printing locally. We will also will look into more printing bells and whistles like foil stamping, endsheets, booksmarks, et. all.
At $42,000 we'll be able to bring on even more Creators to create content for the Wildsea! We'll announce if we get here, but preliminary discussions have included an appendix on gardening, and ventures deep into the undiscovered waves...
At $45,000 we'll be able to raise the rates of our artists yet again and commission more artwork for the final book. Perhaps we might even be able to include an illustrated Chart or three...
 At $50,000 we'll be able to produce a fully realized actual play of the Wildsea for your viewing enjoyment! This may include partnering with an existing show or perhaps striking out on our own. Details to come if we get here! 
At $55,000 we'll be able to add a set of ship creation options, unique hazards and Firefly guidance based around the ideas of exploring the upper skies and lower branches. Now we just have to work out what to call a submarine... 
At $60,000 we'll set aside a portion of the funds to subsidize the shipping fees for the project. This will hopefully enable us to lower shipping rates by $1-2 dollars per package, depending on a number of factors. Internally, what this means is that no matter what we will allocate a portion of our funds raised to shipping costs, which we'll then pass the savings unto you when it comes time to charge and fulfill via Backerkit.
At $65,000 we're going to pay Wildsea creator and designer Felix Isaacs more! The majority of funds raised from  the last stretch goal to this one will go directly to Felix in addition to his overall cut of the campaign and future sales.
At $70,000 we'll be able to raise the per word rate of the various designers and writers we are bringing on board to the Wildsea (which I promise we'll announce soon in a future update). Freelance game design is not exactly a lucrative profession but we're committed to building a bigger tent and providing opportunities to others when and where  we can.
At $75,000 we'll be able to design and manufacture a set of custom  wooden Wildsea Dice which will be available to purchase as an Add-On via BackerKit. This is something we wanted to have ready for the start of the campaign but alas simply ran out of time. Nonetheless, reaching this tier will give us the resources to begin the process of making these dice in earnest.
Handcrafted dice from Might Dog Games. Now available as add-ons.
At $85,000 we'll include the last content update for the core book: The Farthest Reaches. Consider this an expansion of the Arconautics chapter already unlocked detailing the furthest corners of the Wildsea. More obscure content, to be announced if we get here!

Finally, our ultimate goal at $100,000 will allow us to lower shipping rates yet again, reducing the rates by another $1-2 per package. In the interim, the funds raised to get this tier will allow us to pay the principles of the project just that little bit more :)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As a production Kickstarter, the primary risk is that the book still needs to be created in full before printing and distribution can begin. For that reason we typically like to run print Kickstarters where the product is already completed instead, but sometimes that's not possible when launching a new and amazing project like the Wildsea! 

Ray and Vince bring over six years and 13 projects worth of crowdfunding experience into this campaign. We know how to produce beautiful books and communicate with our backers and fans on every step of the process. We strive to have 100% satisfaction guaranteed when it comes our projects - ask our past backers about their experience! 

We gave ourselves a wide breadth for the campaign - almost a full year - but should we meet and exceed our goals, we will use that time to build a better world filled with gorgeous art and a handsome book you'll be proud to have on your shelves. There is always the possibility that things may be delayed further. We will do our best to deliver in a timely matter while maintaining transparency and striving always for the highest quality work possible.

Shipping is another major uncertainty heading into the year 2021. The state of global politics means that things like postal rates and customs and tariffs are in a constant state of flux. Brexit and the USA/China trade war may impact the printing and manufacturing of the Wildsea in ways we cannot foresee. Nonetheless, we will do our best to navigate these uncharted waters, just as we have done for the past four years. 

Backing this project means you're not only buying the book, but helping produce the work to make it real. For that we can't thank you enough. Together, we'll build something amazing.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: C is for Campaign: a Playtest Update!
updates.update_content:
Download Playtest C Right Here!
Today is a landmark day, which feels pretty good to say - the full release of Playtest C. This new PDF clocks in at around 140 pages, adding a whole host of additional options for ship creation, character creation and (perhaps most importantly given its focus) character advancement.

updates.update_userinfo: New Bloodline, New Reach, New Ships, New Month!
updates.update_content:
Hello Everyone! 
Just in case you hadn't guessed, the word of the month is new. I wrote in the last update about how good it felt to be back working on the creative side of the Wildsea, and I think the last month has really shown how much easier it is to work on a project like this when you have free reign to explore new ideas and throw out some old assumptions. 
So given the amount of progress it seems fitting to start things off with a general update, then we'll dive into the various summer treats I've prepared for you - more than average for the month, but don't get too used to it!

Well wildsailors, it's a big day on the rustling waves - some real progress to share, and an update on exactly how things have been going behind the scenes! 

 Layouts, Software, and Transcription

Welcome to your April update, sailors of the wild waves! Today we're talking mysteries and massivities, and at least one of those things is definitely a real word. 
Let's dive in!
Developing Leviathans

Felix here, with a miniature update for you all! Today marks the rough release of our first contributor-designed reach and a little dive into the progress of character-based art and design.

The Kremich Surge - Our First Contribuor Reach

updates.update_userinfo: The Road Ahead - Meetings, Milestones, and Mansions
updates.update_content:
Hey Everyone! 

To our American backers - hope you had a wonderful, relaxing, and safe holiday weekend. We over at Team  Wildsea had a bit of respite from a hectic two months. Some games were played, plans made, and celebrations shared. Now we're back ready to go with a book to make. Let's get into it. 

All Hands !

Hello people, Felix here. 
Before I get into the meat of this update, the excited congratulations and content reveals, I want to shine a light on the private side of development, the bit 'behind the curtain'. It'll be a little sombre, so if you're just here for the big kickstarter success bonanza bit feel free to skip ahead to the first heading down below. I won't hold it against you. :)
Let me share a little something with you from the start of the year. From the First of January, in fact. Taken straight from, a post seen by... what, twenty people? Maybe?

campaign.story:
It is the dawn of the American Revolutionary War of 1776. A tangled web of conspiracy spans North America. In the war for survival, it does not matter what your creed, color, culture or gender is – all stand together. But as the Revolution has begun, something far more mysterious stirs. Agents of the occult entreat both the Rebel Continental Army and Loyalist Red Coats. Freemasons conspire in the City of Brotherly Love. Maryland is in the throes of a witch hunt by the Knights Templar. Amid the chaos, other grim fairy tales have emerged.
The cover art depicts a young, powerful Black woman leading the charge with sabre and flag, as an older Indigenous soldier prepares their musket and a Colonial militiaman fires a Pennsylvania long rifle. British Loyalists stand at the left-hand side of the conflict.
Reports of witches have been seen in the Great Dismal Swamp. Indigenous sachem say that devils called Manitou walk among the living. Flesh-gobbling ghouls have been tunneling beneath Boston. The Pine Barrens of New Jersey are haunted by what the locals call the "Leeds Devil".
In this game, most people have either chosen to deny the supernatural or rationalize it away. A rare few accept it for what it is and act. You are among those heroes, and are destined for greatness… or death. 
Welcome to Flames of Freedom, where your grim & perilous tale hangs in the balance!
Flames of Freedom & Every Stretch Goal Unlocked ($200k) Mock-up

 Flames of Freedom is an American gothic horror RPG, powered by the Zweihander RPG d100 game engine. Intensely researched by Richard Iorio and developed by a diverse group of game designers, this game explores a range of cultures beyond the history of Europeans in North America. Developed with Black cultural consultants in key decision-making roles, interwoven with Indigenous writers of the nations represented in the work and guided by RPG safety and trauma experts, this game will show that colonial horror can be represented in a mature way.
Click to enlarge
This game represents a melange of heritages and conflicting beliefs, one where cultures and genders outside traditional standards were equally as instrumental in fomenting and conducting the rebellion. And, although traditional games set during the Revolution place men at the fore of the conflict, Flames of Freedom calls upon the true history: one where heritage and genders outside the norm were just as important – and, oftentimes working behind the scenes – during this pivotal time in America’s founding.
It is the dawn of the rebellion in 1776 and life is on the verge of drastic change. To some degree, the Europeans shun folklore and witchcraft as the so-called ‘Age of Reason’ is upon them. Tucked between missionaries, mutineers and midwives there are those who know they know the real truth. Sorcery – along with monsters, demons and mythological creatures – is real. 
Click to enlarge
Experience Flames of Freedom right now by downloading the free 61 page Quickstart! It comes equipped with 32 pages of game rules, an 11 page adventure, 7 pre-generated characters, cut-out paper miniatures and a print-out map. It can be played one-on-one, but also supports up to 7 players and one Historian. The rules and adventure are designed for new gamers, providing a 2-3 hour play experience.
Download the free Quickstart from DriveThruRPG
MODERN, SKILL-BASED DESIGN: This game is designed to accommodate a style of play where role-playing drives the story. The exception to this is when there are potential consequences for failure - then, and only then, is a Skill Test required to determine the outcome.
TRAD MEETS NARRATIVE GAMEPLAY: Melded with narrative gameplay elements, this game has four modes: Chase Scenes, Combat Encounters, Overland Travel and Social Interactions. All are handled in the same way: you’ll roll percentile dice using a Skill Test. Rolling equal to or under your chance of success means you succeed. Rolling over means you failed. If the dice match, something special happens - either a critical success, or critical failure.
Click to enlarge
LIGHT TO MEDIUM COMPLEXITY: This game embraces modern, familiar mechanics with smooth character creation and plenty of tactical depth to last a lifetime. If you have experience with games like Dungeons & Dragons, Pathfinder and Zweihander RPG, the game will feel familiar, encouraging role-playing and alternative forms of interactions before combat. 
BOUNDLESS OPTIONS: With over 84 character types, numerous cultures, tools, weapons, magic and threats to face, your adventures will take you far across North America into the very heart of supernatural darkness.
Click to enlarge
Let us be clear: Flames of Freedom is not a tabletop RPG where you will discriminate against women, practice slavery, slaughter innocent people or ‘tame the wilderness’ of Indigenous nations. It is a game where people come together to fend off a secret war that took root long before the American Revolutionary War. 
Click to enlarge
Flames of Freedom is a tabletop role-playing game where you’ll blaze your own path, free from outdated thinking. History certainly informs the story, but it is not meant to be completely historically accurate. This game does not endorse discrimination of any kind based on differences of the period its set in. 
Click to enlarge
Regardless of characters' identities, there isn’t any mechanical, intellectual, physical, emotional or spiritual distinctions between women, men, intersex, agender, non-binary and transgender characters, or any between cultures. This game will come equipped with ttrpg safety tools to help you navigate and embrace its positive elements while allowing you to explore its more visceral moments. We'll further deliver upon this promise across the entire Zweihander RPG game line with the release of our upcoming Touch The Darkness ttrpg safety tool.
 We have several exciting First Looks and Actual Plays for FLAMES OF FREEDOM scheduled over the next 30 days (and a couple of special extended campaign announcements after the Kickstarter ends):


Mock-up (not final)
Flames of Freedom is unlike other tabletop RPG when it comes to quality. We lean into sustainable quality book materials, over-index on durability & aim to provide a great reader experience without skimping on premium features. Every hardback book is crafted as a collector's item and can be proudly put on display and used around the table without compromising its condition. Here's what you'll find inside:
Premium offset hardback book
Soft touch matte coating cover for easy grip
Reinforced plank & rounded spine, guaranteed to last
Smythe binding, so pages never tear out
Thick, tasteful ribbon to mark your place
Chunky, matte coated interior paper (no reflections/ink bleed-thru on pages)
"Old school" sepia, black & white illustrations that evoke colonial pamphlets
Optimized information flow for an easy reading experience
Entire UX designed using legible font types, optimized for accessibility
Informed padding and spacing choices for those with color deficiency & dyslexic readership
Perforated pull-out horizontal & vertical character sheets
The cover for Flames of Freedom is digitally painted by Ken Duquet. Ken returns as our cover artist, coming fresh off of production of our last Kickstarter Main Gauche: Grim & Perilous Supplement. Watch his progress on the cover art from concept to finish at the video below:
Returning a 4th time to our projects is our artist-in-residence Dejan Mandic! Living as a full-time illustrator in Serbia, his exquisite drawings can be seen throughout the entire Zweihander game line. Dejan's artwork aims to be inclusive of age, body type, culture, gender, hair styles and situations for Flames of Freedom. Every single piece of interior art has been hand-drawn by Dejan, with little if any digital touch-up.
Joining him is Amber Seger, an industry certified UX designer. Her key focus is on information design and user experience in the book. Following her breakout Twitch hit series for character sheet redesign DESIGNHÄNDER, she joins our team to reexamine our layout standards from previous editions, and to reflow the entirety of Flames of Freedom. 
Our PDF will be fully screen reader accessible.
