In Flames of Freedom, your character will be changed by the choice they make in the world. Will they become a force for the Rebel patriots or the Loyalists? Will they fall prey to the wishes of the Freemasons or the Inquisition? Will they bend their morals to parlay with the Knights Templar? There is no right or wrong answer; there are only shades of grey.
Click to enlarge
Click to enlarge
Click to enlarge
Click to enlarge
Cartographer Gabriel Brouillard has mapped out the cities, settlements and long-forgotten places of North America. His map work spans New France and Canada, south along the Thirteen Colonies, into Florida and the Caribbean. Gabriel's maps permeates the cultural sections of the book, breathing life into Flames of Freedom.
Click to enlarge
Click to enlarge
Following our all-in-on approach from Zweihander RPG, Flames of Freedom will come with a player's handbook, Historian's guide, over 100 spells, a fully-illustrated bestiary of 80+ legends & threats, the setting of 1776, a 35 page adventure set during the Siege of Boston & an urban-based sandbox in and around Boston. We anticipate the book to be 600 to 668 pages when lain out. Much like Zweihander RPG, there will be upwards of 300+ pieces of art. Here's the chapter breakdown:
Click to enlarge
We've set up 6 simple pledge levels, which communicates in detail what you'll get at each pledge level:
Once unlocked, Stretch Goals are FREE to different pledge levels. To keep it simple:
 Pledge $75+: get all Physical + Digital Stretch Goals for FREE.
 Pledge $15+: get all Digital Stretch Goals for FREE.
At $20k we will include a full-color perforated World Map in the back of the book! Illustrated by Gabriel Brouillard, this thick, matte-coated gatefold map will be perforated for easy removal from the book (approximately 22"x17"). The map will be made of sustainable paper, matte coated and will exceed what the current ttrpg market offers.
At $35k we will include Campaign Coins! We'll partner with Mark Morrison & team at Campaign Coins to produce high quality engraved Metal Coins to track fortune & misfortune mechanics. They will be 6 poker chip-sized coins (39mm)– larger and heavier than a US half dollar. They will come engraved with a skull on one side (when the Historian needs to play the coin), or the rising star when in the player's hands.
At $50k we will include Custom Dice! These will be produced by our partner Geekify. The dice set will contain six total dice: 3D6 (face 1-6) at 14mm, 1D10% (face 00-90 percentile die) at 15mm and two 1D10 (face 1-10) at 15mm. The face 6 will come engraved with the Rising Star, marking the face '6' whenever dice explore for massive damage. The face 10 will be engraved with Skull, marked for critical hits.
FREE UNLOCK! We went back to our vendors, and are now able to unlock the 24"x36" Canvas Map for FLAMES OF FREEDOM ! As always, our physical Stretch Goals are 100% free to pledges at $75+



At $65k we will include a GM Historian's Screen! This will be a four panel horizontal gatefold screen, lain out by Amber Seger. It will be made of the same heavy duty stock we use for book covers, and matte coated. We'll poll our backers to gauge what sort of scene you want Dejan Mandic to illustrate on it. 
At $80k we will include a Magnetic Dice Tray! These will be produced by our partner Geekify. Using strong magnetic clasps, the dice tray locks in place easily. With a plush velvet interior and leather exterior, they won't scratch your table or make a loud CLATTER sound as you roll dice.
Mock-Up (not final)
At $100k we will UPGRADE the Custom Dice to Metal Dice! These will be produced by our partner Geekify. These will be copper-style dice, with engraved black enamel numbers: 6 dice: 3D6 at 14mm, 1D10% at 15mm, and two 1D10 at 15mm. 
Mock-Up (not final)
At $110k we will include a Velvet Dice Bag! These will be produced by our partner Geekify. These luxurious pouches make for the perfect fit with both your Metal Dice and Campaign Coins.
Mock-Up (not final)
At $125k we will Upgrade the Magnetic Dice Tray to a Wood Dice Vault! These will be produced by our partner Geekify. Made of a luxurious solid dark wood and soft interior liner, it will store and protect all the dice included in this Kickstarter.
Mock-Up (not final)
At $140k we will Upgrade the Velvet Dice Bag to an Embroidered one! These will be produced by our partner Geekify.
Mock-Up (not final)
At $155k we will include Pawns! We've selected a selection of characters, legends & threats in thick punchboard to represent iconic encounters. Pawns do not come with plastic stands.


Mock-Up (not final)
At $185k we will Upgrade the Small Canvas Map to a 24"x36" Small Velvet Map! This will be produced by our partner Geekify. The velvet is a slightly higher grade material than canvas.
At $200k we will Upgrade the Small Velvet Map to the canvas 32"x48" Canvas Monster Map! This will be produced by our partner Geekify. This will be the ultimate Flames of Freedom map! 
Should we blow the doors off the $200k Stretch Goal, we may evaluate some other fun stuff we didn't add to this Kickstarter. We'll let you know here!

This project has been selected by Kickstarter to pilot their new Add-On program! This means you can get Add-Ons when completing your pledge or by managing your current pledge in Kickstarter. New Stretch Goals will be available as Add-On purchases in Kickstarter as soon as they are unlocked:
You can also Add-On the Zweihander Revised Rulebook, the Zweihander Player’s Handbook, or the Main Gauche Supplement (or all three!) at substantial discounts, shipping before the 2020 holidays!
This is an exclusive offer for our Kickstarter backers only. These books will come with limited edition bookmarks. They have their own shipping charges (which will be collected in Backerkit w/ customs). We are also continuing our work to get further reduced international shipping rates:
United States $10 + $5 each additional book ordered
UK/EU: $25 + $10 each additional book ordered
Canada: $30 + $10 each additional book ordered
We will charge shipping through Backerkit, based on the actual costs incurred to ship your particular pledge and unlocked Stretch Goals at the time of shipment. All shipping charges will be at-cost, minus the discounted rates we have negotiated through our partners. Packages sent in the US will be tracked/sent via USPS while packages send to Canada and international will be tracked/sent with other trusted carriers. Packages with unlocked physical Stretch Goals will begin shipping July 2021 out of the United States.
Shipping estimates are as follows, based on 2020 rates and assuming all physical Stretch Goals are unlocked (estimated 11 lbs. box). This includes shipping + VAT/GST/taxes by country. If your country isn't listed, shoot me a message and I will get you a quote back:
Import laws and high customs rates prohibit us from shipping to Afghanistan, Belarus, Brazil, Kazakhstan, Russia and the Ukraine.
Depending on where you live, VAT/GST ("customs") may be added to your order in Backerkit. After collecting these fees, our fulfillment partner SkuTouch will pay the taxes and file paperwork for you. This will ensure a seamless, zero frustration shipping scenario for worldwide backers.
Flames of Freedom is in its 21st sprint of development, with writing and artwork currently at 90% completion. Our printers & schedules are locked in. Our schedule for distribution is as follows, with updates to to you as we reach milestones:
 Zweihander RPG, Player's Handbook, Main Gauche (PDF): November 2020 (end of Kickstarter)
 Flames of Freedom (PDF): late March/early April 2021
 Flames of Freedom (physical book): July 2021
 All Unlocked Physical Stretch Goals: July 2021
All books, physical Stretch Goals and Add-Ons will be packaged in one heavy package, and given the TLC that ttrpg fans demand of publishers but rarely met.
We guarantee all our shipments, and should your product be damaged during transit, simply send us a private message with pictures of the damage, and we will replace it 100% free.
We will be working with SkuTouch, a local Kansas City-based fulfillment partner. With warehouses all across the world, they will help us guarantee the least expensive shipping for backers, great packaging, tracking IDs and high quality customer support in case of damaged packaging.
 After the Kickstarter ends, you can manage your pledge through Backerkit.
There, you will pay for shipping, manage your address, change your pledge, download digital PDFs, include Add-Ons and receive tracking IDs.
Please note that we do not answer rules questions on our Kickstarter. 
Join our Discord to talk with Flames of Freedom and other Zweihander RPG designers & developers to get live updates, exclusive access to playtest material as it releases, previews of artwork and more! 
See our team's complete bios on our landing page offsite
 Researched and inspired by history, the characters, world and situations in Flames of Freedom are a work of fiction. This game was designed, developed and produced by a multicultural team of diverse identities, beliefs and orientation.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Flames of Freedom is an extensive project with a large team of contributors working on what we intend to be a high-quality, thoughtfully curated and produced collector’s item. The Kickstarter is designed to help us offset the substantial production cost and include attractive features.

We are excited to have you with us on this journey to produce an incredible RPG. We also want to reward our biggest fans with exclusive, Kickstarter-only Stretch Goals that could not be produced otherwise without your support. 

While this is our first Kickstarter, it is the third that our executive creative director will have ran. Along with a dedicated customer support specialist to answer logistical questions with content-related questions sent to Daniel, our communications will be regular, clear and set realistic expectations.

Andrews McMeel Publishing has over 50 years of independent publishing and global distribution experience. While we do not anticipate any challenges for print and shipping, COVID and tariffs may have an impact on our timeline. We will communicate quickly and clearly any perceived challenges, along with adjusted timelines.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
We design all of our tabletop RPGs with sturdy, collectors grade materials. It will be printed as a premium offset hardback book, with soft touch matte coating cover. The rounded spine is reinforced with planks, using smythe binding (so your pages don't fall out). It will have a tasteful, chunky ribbon sewn into the spine. The interior pages are 128gsm (80 lbs.) FSC paper, with zero bleed-thru issues with ink. Our perforated character sheets are printed on wood-free paper, with easy pull-out.
Reusability and recyclability
We are committed to Project Gigaton, an initiative that aims to avoid one billion metric tons of greenhouse gases by 2030. https://www.andrewsmcmeel.com/andrews-mcmeel-takes-sustainability-to-a-new-level/
Sustainable materials
We are committed to using FSC paper on all new book releases starting in spring 2021, which includes Flames of Freedom. This does not diminish the quality of paper or fidelity of the ink upon it. https://us.fsc.org/en-us/market/paper-printing
Sustainable Distribution
Our partner SkuTouch guarantees your order will arrive safely. The team as been dedicated to supporting domestic & international shippers for more than 20 years. By offering multiple international source collection through delivery to end locations benefits brand holders and consumers by reducing handling partners and costs while enhancing transportation visibility as materials pass through the required export/import steps. Further, domestic material handling sites for order fulfillment, distribution and value-add services, such as consumer returns, completes a total supply chain offering for shipping and customer inquiry transparencies.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Fear not! The base book of The Red Opera RPG is already completed, and our team is very excited to get to work on our stretch goals right away!

Apotheosis Studios has successfully completed many large scale crowd-funded publishing projects (The Last Amazon graphic novel right here on Kickstarter!) The only realistic risk (including natural disasters like COVID-19) is the official launch date of the book, primarily due to printing and shipping delays. We believe that we have budged enough time and will come in on schedule, but there are timing elements of the design, printing, and shipping process which are out of our control.

At Apotheosis Studios we believe in radical honesty and transparency and will keep backers fully up to date with all developments (and any setbacks) during the duration of the campaign and production process. We really enjoy interacting with our community and will post daily info on social media, weekly updates on our blog, and even detailed monthly Development Logs chronicling the adventure that is The Red Opera! Thank you for your support!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Our printers utilize a broad range of post-consumer and tree-free papers to maximize the longevity of our products and minimize the effects on the environment.
Reusability and recyclability
Our printers divert more than 90% of their waste (+522,000 pounds per year) from the landfill by composting and recycling, and our printing plates are recycled to keep metals out of the landfill.
Sustainable materials
Our Printers used low-VOC, soy- and bio-based inks, and the chemicals used in our plate processors and developers are recycled, too.
Environmentally friendly factories
When we look for a printer we make sure being “green” isn’t just talk, it’s a commitment. From our printers' sustainable practices to their environmental certifications, green must be more than just an ink color.
Sustainable Distribution
We recycle the paper trimmed from finished projects and the cardboard from shipping cartons.
Something else
Our Printers are certified by the City of Boulder Colorado’s PACE Program for Waste Diversion.

HUGE news, everyone! We will OFFICIALLY be launching our The Red Opera PDF on March 25th via DriveThruRPG!

campaign.story:
To be clear, this is not a Kickstarter for a game.
You see, we are working on amazing games... but first we want to say hello and introduce ourselves - a new board game publisher, ready to MAKE THE BEST GAMES. Your pledge, even at $1, helps us reach that goal by building a community. 
WIN-WIN-WIN. You get cool rewards now (art coasters and gametrayz!), we get to share games (we're kinda addicted), and the world gets more excellent board games! Really, that's the ultimate mission!
What game play keeps us up at night? What do we stand for? 
First and foremost - games that are GREAT! (That's a given right? Excellent - we agree!) Let's make fantastic looking games, games that are produced well with high quality components, games that don't overstay their welcome at game night and games that inspire repeat plays... basically the stuff WE want to play too.
We have two exciting reward types, both of which defend your games on the table! 
We're creating 3 custom coasters with beautiful art and we have also officially partnered with Gametrayz to bring you some great resource x-trayz - including a unique color design never made before!

 KEEP IN MIND, YOU CAN ADD X-TRAYZ TO ANY TIER ORDER!
Photo courtesy of Christian Strain and Sparta the cat. Featured game: Asking for Trobils. Planet Paradise could use some coasters and x-trayz!

We have a special $1 offer to welcome all backers, plus more ways to jump in!
In partnership with Gametrayz, we are excited to present x-trayz, including an all new custom color unique to this campaign! 
Let's talk about the trayz - size, tray layouts, color choices and more! You can add X-trayz to any other tier, or get extra sets in the main tier.

We had to try the trayz out on a game we know all too well! Here's Rise of Tribes with deluxe upgrade resources kept away from conflict!
We all know the games with Gametrayz Inside (Dwellings of Eldervale, Vindication, Endeavor, Parks to name a few).. .but what about the games in NEED? We've started a list of games that can benefit from x-trayz. Tell us your top games that would make this list! 
Brad Brooks: A tabletop gamer almost since birth, Brad has designed the published games Letter Tycoon (a Mensa Select winner) and Rise of Tribes, as well as the Rise of Tribes expansion, Beasts & Bronze. Brad is excited to unleash more of his creations on the world via Cardboard Alchemy, and looks forward to sitting across the table from all of you for some gaming fun. Some of his thoughts on game design can be found at the League of Gamemakers blog.
Peter Vaughan: Variable player powers, besides being his favorite game mechanism, is how Peter has developed over 36 published games and supported dozens of others for Breaking Games and Squirmy Beast. In addition, Peter has run 5 Kickstarter projects totaling over 1 million in funding. Among the titles Peter has worked on are Dwellings of Eldervale, Rise of Tribes, Letter Tycoon, and What the Food?! Somehow he has also found time to be the editor for The League of Gamemakers, and founded First Play L.A., a cornerstone of the playtest community in Los Angeles. Game on!
Sergio Chaves: He is an artist. Don’t believe him? Check sergiochavesart.com
--
Brad and Peter are founding members of the League of Gamemakers. Fun article links: 
Brad on FUN DENSITY, and TRANSMOGRIFYING YOUR MECHANICS
Peter on HEARTHSTONE CORE DESIGN LESSONS, VARIABLE PLAYER POWERS, TOP 10 GAMES EVERY DESIGNER SHOULD PLAY and NAME THAT GAME CONNECTION!

Thank you all very much for supporting Cardboard Alchemy! Many games later, when we say we appreciate all the backers out there, we secretly mean YOU most...

Dedicated to the memory of Mike Laubach, a childhood friend who always dreamed big and loved games, animation and fun hobbies.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
All campaigns have risk, especially in 2020. However, we have designed this campaign to be easy to fulfill, and with minimal risk. We are experienced game makers, and in this case, the accessories are not complex. The coasters will be made in the USA, and all artwork is complete. The x-trayz from Gametrayz have the molds made so it's now about production. 

We do not expect any major delays, but should we run into one, we are prepared to tackle it and get you a satisfactory resolution! We are so appreciative of your support and participation in the launch of CARDBOARD ALCHEMY!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello friends!
In this update,we have started shipping your x-trayz from Game Trayz! Also, Mission Catastrophe is coming to a close! Don't miss our first game on Kickstarter and a bonus coaster! Lastly, a chance to win Space Base is happening right now on our YouTube channel!

SHIPPING HAS BEGUN ON X-TRAYZ

Hi friends!
We have a double dose of news today to fill the vacuum of your inbox -  Gametrayz x-trayz are coming and we've launched into outer space with our next Kickstarter.

First, the Kickstarter rewards you've been waiting for have now been manufactured in China and they look fabulous! Here are some pics from the plant. No pics of the red shiny new trayz but we did confirm those are all packing up as well!

Hi friends!
We hope you are well and getting games in. We wanted to give a quick update on our progress with coasters, trayz and more! Our next Kickstarter is coming up on November 17! 
COASTERS

Hello friends!
We have exciting news to share - we're about to DELIVER the coasters. Normally, Kickstarters have a longer delay on fulfillment, so we could definitely get used to this feeling! :)
Expect the coasters to be shipped first class, later this week, and take the appropriate time expected shipped from California, USA. If you haven't received in a reasonable time, please let us know.

Hi friends!
We are back already with the rewards survey! We are excited to get started making the coasters and trayz. 
Survey begins this week - due Aug 27!

Hello friends!
24 hours to go as I write this. (Yes, the Ramones 1979 song, I Want to be Sedated is playing in my head). Thanks for joining us on a fun journey.
It's just the beginning! Over 1000 BACKERS for cool coasters and Gametrayz x-trayz is a rockin' start to Cardboard Alchemy. Brad and I are thrilled!
1000+ backers! Thanks for starting this community!

Hello friends!
We're approaching the last days of this campaign! As we head into the final 48 hours tomorrow, no doubt some new friends will join us to peek in at the coasters and trayz. I hope you'll say hello, just as you would at game night!
Thanks for being here - and cheers to the over 900 backers joining us on our mission to deliver artistic and high quality components - and eventually GAMES.
HOTTEST QUESTIONS:

Hello friends!
Just one week to go in our campaign! Thank you all and welcome to everyone just joining us. We can't wait to get you cool coasters and x-trayz! We unlocked a bonus color x-trayz today (SURPRISE BELOW!) and color is the subject of our latest video!

campaign.story:
Tournament of the Mythic Kingdoms is a fantasy-themed set of standard playing cards (52 cards + 2 jokers + 2 extra cards) printed by the USPCC on Bicycle's premium grade paper. Illustrated by Greg Swearingen with amazing attention to detail, these cards will add a new layer of fun as you use them to play your favorite traditional card games.
Click to view the rules
Click to See How to Upgrade
Limited Editions: These decks will only be printed once through this campaign! The deck seals will be uniquely numbered based on the total number of decks printed for this campaign (ie: 0042 / 1000). Resale of limited edition decks are allowed if purchased through this campaign (recommended $17 per deck).
Summary of Limited Edition Deck Features:
Printed by USPCC on Bicycle premium paper stock, air cushioned, poker size
52 cards + 2 jokers + 1 double backer + 1 bonus card
One-way backs and fronts, with 100% custom court and number cards
Card back vine graphics printed with metallic ink
Tuck boxes with premium metallic inks 
Each tuck box seal has a unique limited edition number
Self-fulfilled within the US, ArtOfPlay for international 
Tuck boxes wrapped in cellophane 
Each suit features unique characters from a completely new mythic world. Imagine a realm where the champions (Aces), royalty (J,Q,K), and soldiers (2-10) meet together in a tournament to compete in games of strength, skill and strategy. Invent your own ways to apply this theme to your favorite card games, or just enjoy playing games with awesome artwork.
Illustration Award: Four of the images from Mythic Kingdoms were juried into the Society of Illustrators Los Angeles 58th Annual Illustration Competition. The Queen of Hearts, Queen of Clubs, Jack of Spades and Jack of Diamonds were all exhibited in L.A. The Jack of Spades—One Eyed Jack—was recognized further with a Silver medal!
Many of the games we play require multiple decks of cards, so we created two decks that work perfectly as a set (just like Bicycle has red and blue decks). The decks are green to represent nature and purple to represent magic—two common elements in fantasy. The Nature and Magic decks use the same number and court cards, but the jokers are different.
Art in progress for joker and treasure cards
Art in progress for joker and treasure cards

About the Two Extra Cards
Below is an image that shows which extra cards will be included in each set. A double backer is a favorite among magicians for card tricks. The treasure and wizard cards can be used as an additional joker, a first player marker, a trophy to present to the winner of the game/tournament, a moving marker for the current winner of a game, or anything else you'd like to spice up whatever game you're playing.
About the Sets
For some of the stretch goals, pledge tiers and add-ons it will be important to understand what we mean by a "Set" of decks. Throughout this campaign, we refer to a "Set" of decks as a combination of one Green Nature Deck and one Purple Magic Deck. The $45k and $50k stretch goals apply to Sets of decks. Here is a graphic to show the differences.

Softcover | Design and layout in progress
Art book design and layout still in the works
See the creative process: What you don't often see when you buy finished products is the creative design process. So, the art book will include examples of how some of these concepts took shape, such as the design of the suit symbols and the creation of the characters.

Add-Ons are available for backers who have chosen pledge levels with one or more decks of cards.
How to add more to your pledge: 1) If you have already chosen a pledge level, go to the top of the campaign page and click the button that says "Manage your pledge." 2) Next, click on the "Change your pledge" button. 3) Now manually add the cost of the add-on to your pledge amount, making sure to select the correct amount based on your location/country. 4) To finish, click "Continue."
These add-on amounts having shipping included. After the campaign, we will be using BackerKit (a pledge manager) that will allow you to tell us exactly which add-ons you have selected.

Greg Swearingen has made illustration his career for over 20 years. His work has received awards in the most prestigious illustration competitions in the world including Communication Arts, Society of Illustrators New York, and Spectrum Contemporary Fantastic Art.
Jim Wittwer and Jon Wittwer are brothers who partnered with Greg back in 2011 to create the website BoardGaming.com. Although Jim, Jon, and Greg all live in different states, they get together at least once a year for multiple days of gaming. 
The Finest Quality Cards: The cards will be manufactured by the USPCC (Bicycle) for its premium quality cards and environmentally friendly paper, ink, and laminating. As limited edition decks, we will print at least 1000 of each deck (the minimum USPCC will print) plus additional decks if necessary to fulfill backer rewards and add-ons.
Card Details: Premium Paper Stock, Air Cushion Embossed Card Finish, Poker Size
Tuck Boxes:  Tuck boxes will be manufactured by either USPCC or another premium tuck box manufacturer, depending on stretch goals.
Reward Guarantee: We will not stop working until everyone who has backed us has received their rewards.
Shipping
Fulfillment: We are partnering with ArtOfPlay.com to handle all non-US fulfillment, and shipping within the United States will be handled by us. This will allow us to pass on some savings to our backers in the US. We have done extensive research, gotten advice from many other game and card publishers, and will be taking special precautions with respect to handling all packaging.
Customs Fees: The international (outside the US) shipping costs do not include customs fees. Customs fees due to imported goods will be the responsibility of the individual backer.
Covid-19: The pandemic has caused a lot of uncertainty in overseas shipping costs and delays. The estimated delivery by Jan 2021 is a conservative estimate that includes shipping delays. We hope to have rewards delivered much earlier than that. We will be keeping our backers informed of the progress and possible delays.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Covid-19 has thrown a wrench into many plans in 2020. Delays in overseas shipping may occur, depending on the country. We will keep our backers up-to-date to report on these types of delays. There may be import taxes for some countries that backers must pay before they can receive their goods. ArtOfPlay.com is handling our overseas fulfillment and they have a lot of experience in this area. If the volume exceeds our expectations, we may use ArtOfPlay.com to handle all fulfillment. 

We expect to begin production about one month after the campaign is completed. We are working with reputable companies for production, so we do not expect significant delays. However, if businesses get shut down again due to Covid-19, there may be delays. We will continue working through challenges until our backers receive their rewards.

For the art book, we have our pricing set based on estimates from 2 different book publishers. We will be printing samples prior to the final print run to ensure the best quality for the cost.

We will not be satisfied with poor printing and production, so although our prototypes so far have turned out amazing, there is always a risk that the final version won't be as expected. This may cause delays, but we will reprint if necessary to ensure that the final delivered product is the best quality possible.

updates.update_content: I'd like to thank everybody for their participation so far. We have something fun to share with you today. This update provides the preliminary rules for the game Mythic Challenge, the first new game designed specifically for our fantasy-themed decks.  , and we would encourage you to help play test this game and share your comments.

campaign.story:
Achilles. Lancelot. Robin Hood. Thor. Heroes, all.
The world is full of myths and legends which inspired those in our modern fiction and games. Iconic warriors and wizards, vampires and things from the deep, epic figures from history, these legends are universally known.
Mythological Figures & Maleficent Monsters delves into these paragons of literature, fable, and folklore. From Ancient Greece to Victorian England, deepest Transylvania to the High Seas, you’ll meet champions and thieves, pirates and knights, demigods and fey queens, ancient evils and urban legends. Archetypal heroes meet exemplars of villainy like Blackbeard, Rasputin, Dracula - even Lucifer, the Lord of Hell!
From Mike Myler’s popular by-request column, this 230-page epic compilation of over 100 legendary heroes, villains, and monsters brings these characters to life for the 5th Edition of the world’s oldest roleplaying game.   
Plus a foreword from James M. Ward, author of the original Deities & Demigods!  
We’ve unlocked 10 stretch rewards over the course of this campaign — bonus Villain Spotlight PDFs which you can download as soon as you pledge! Scroll down to see the whole list!
What You Get!
A gorgeous hardcover tome with 235 beautifully illustrated full-colour pages. 
Nearly 100 mythical figures and maleficent monsters ranging from CR 1 all the way up to CR 35. Each is between 2 and 4 pages, and comes with description and design notes.
 33 magical items, including Excalibur, Mjölnir, the Nautilus, and many more.
 The Masterclass Codex, a 190-page hardcover book containing 16 new classes for 5E, is also optionally included.
Or pledge for the awesome deluxe faux-leatherbound gift set of Mythological Figures & Maleficent Monsters and The Masterclass Codex!
Shipping to the UK, EU, US, Canada, and many other countries.
All hardcover books are ready to print and ship as soon as this Kickstarter campaign ends! And PDF rewards will be provided within minutes of the Kickstarter campaign ending. 
Bloggers and news outlets, here's a big folder of press assets you can use. 
Gorgeous cover art by Alba Palacio
Meet monstrous entitles like Cthulhu, Fenrir, and the Headless Horseman. Confront Cerberus, Dr. Jekyll, and Mr. Hyde. Parlay with Norse gods, Greek legends, Arthurian knights, and critters from American folklore. Meet Robin Hood, Aladdin, and Baba Yaga. We even have the Easter Bunny.  
Look Inside!
About Us
Brought to you by game designer Mike Myler (Vast Kaviya, Hypercorps 2099) and industry veteran Russ 'Morrus' Morrissey (ENnies creator, EN World, What's OLD is NEW, Judge Dredd & The Worlds of 2000 AD).  
We have included mythological or historical figures from a variety of world cultures in this book. To ensure that we remain respectful and authentic, we have employed a range of expert cultural consultants: Daniel Kwan, David Pena, Heba Elsherief, Mehr Husain, and Sachiko Burton. We would also like to thank our consultants, Salt and Sage Books, for their services in arranging specialist readers.
Here are just some of the many mythological figures and maleficent monsters that you will find within. 
This 230-page full-colour hardcover contains over one hundred stat blocks drawn from myths, legends, and history all across the world, each beautifully illustrated with full descriptions and designer's notes, with Challenge ratings from 1 to 35 (well, we had to include Lucifer, Cthulhu, and Fenrir!) 
Foreword by James Ward (Deities & Demigods)

Mythological Figures is a weekly column on EN World by Mike Myler. It includes both historical and fictional figures built as NPCs using class levels and standard ability scores, and mythical monsters designed with statblocks that adhere to the stories told about them in our world. A new entry appears every week on Monday. The first entry was Achilles, in March 2018. This book compiles the column with all new art!  
Entries come from origins as wide-ranging as British, Chinese, Norse, Greek, Japanese, Middle Eastern, American, Egyptian, Mesopotamian, European, and more.   
The back cover
So, who's in? 
The 100-or so entries included in Mythological Figures & Maleficent Monsters were those requested to be featured in the weekly column by Mike Myler. They represent a fun and eclectic sprinkling of different archetypes, encompassing myth, legend, and history. Also found throughout the book are over 30 new magical items, such as Excalibur and Mjölnir. Mike's column is ongoing, so if there's any mythological figure you'd like to see in the future, be sure to ask him on EN World!
The Masterclass Codex
You may note that some of the mythological figures in this book use classes not found in the 5E core rulebooks - Billy the Kid, for example, is a gunslinger. We have tried to keep to the core rules, but where the design demanded it, we recruited additional classes from The Masterclass Codex. 
The Masterclass Codex, was a very successful Kickstarter we ran last year. It had over 2,600 backers, and is a very popular 5E book. You can pick up The Masterclass Codex, which contains 16 classes for your 5E games, right here.
This book contains the alchemist, cardcaster, diabolist, feywalker, morph, noble, occultist, bloodweaver, fatebender, gemini, geomancer, gunfighter, lodestar, monster tamer, savant, and tinkerer classes.

⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ "My players have all been loving this book, maybe even a little too much since they keep passing it around the table!" -Cole Dilworth
⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ "The classes were well thought out. Not overpowered in any way. Good read and good format." -NiceDM

 Alchemist: Scientific Sorcery. The alchemist uses an almost scientific approach to magic to make alchemical discoveries. Will your alchemist become immune to poison, or discover the Elixir of Life? Will you delve into the Science of Creation and build a homunculus, or research the Science of Destruction and devise explosives? We also expand on the alchemist class with three new advanced studies: the Science of Illumination, the Science of Mutation, and the Science of Regeneration. Also included are two new spells, and an update which gives the alchemist a little more “oomph.”
 Cardcaster: Seers of Fate. The cardcaster uses a tarot deck to release magic, playing cards to cast spells—although she doesn’t always have control over what spells are currently made available to her by the winds of fate! Also included are three subclasses: the Knight of Swords, which embodies mental force and determination; the Page of Wands, which embodies the magical power of creation; and the Queen of Cups, with embodies the emotions. This class is also supported by new feats and new secrets, including the King of Pentacles, which pertains to thrift and wealth; and the Jack of Beasts, which unleashes the trapped spirits of monsters.
 Diabolist: Students of Darkness. Diabolists deal with forbidden secrets and dark entities, grasping for power through dark pacts. While they have things in common with necromancers and warlocks, diabolists are something entirely more…diabolical! Also included are two dark paths: the Demonic path and the Devilish path. We also introduce some conjured horrors, such as the accuser devil, contract devil, and more!
 Feywalker: A Taste of Primal Chaos. The feywalker is a mysterious warrior with mystical powers. Feywalkers can teleport short distances, breathe in air and water, and enchant others with a glance. They can also choose from three primal spheres: Beasts, Plants, or Entropy.
 Morph: Changing Faces. The morph is a shapechanging specialist, able to slide between different forms. Morphs have a choice of three essences—the Doppleganger, thePrimordial Beast, and the Trickster—and a selection of Morph Talents they can choose from and acquire.
 Noble: Chessmaster and Commander. Leader, tactician, and a source of inspiration, the full 20-level noble class is able to command and inspire through three paths: the Path of the Heart, the Path of the Brave, and the Path of the Tactician.
 Occultist: Freeing the Monster Within. The occultist allows you to play a monster, with a choice of three distinct paths: Abomination, Vampire, or Werecreature! Delve into the dark and secret creatures of the night, cursed to exist as monstrous beings shunned by the world.
 Bloodweaver: Macabre Magician. Bloodweavers fuel their magical powers with their own blood, enhancing their own prowess, healing or bolstering allies, and flaying open their foes. They can sense the presence of creatures of flesh and bone, resist the cold reach of death, and manipulate a target’s blood to spectacular, deadly effect. Choose from the Bloodbinder, Crimson Witch, and Scarlet Reaper subclasses!
 Fatebender: Destiny’s Chosen. At the extreme edges of fate’s tapestry, fatebenders pull upon its fraying threads, tugging at the strands of chance. Fatebenders manipulate their own dice rolls as well as those of allies and enemies, further relying on luck to make uncanny discoveries, avoid lethal attacks, and make the most of their own strikes. Subclasses include the Mascot, Jinx, and Weaver!
 Gemini: Two‐Faced Warrior. Evading and confounding enemies, gemini create dangerous semi‐real multiples of themselves and copy their foes’ techniques. Their duality affects more than how they wage war however, and each embodies two major contrasting ideals, never certain which will be at the fore the next time they wake. Will you select the Atavist, the Equalist, or the Reluctant Hero?
 Geomancer: Nature’s Hearthmage. These mages turn the surrounding elements into potent weapons and tools and fuel their spells with the primal components of creation. Geomancers can also protect companions from harm and draw upon nature outside of battle to reveal reality’s secrets. Four distinct orders—the Conqueror, the Apothecary, the Architect, and the Rune Knight.
 Gunfighter: Black Powder Desperado. These warriors shoot their way across the field of battle, pausing only long enough to aim their next bullets. Gunfighters are adept with the guns they choose to master, picking off targets hidden behind cover with precise shooting and aiming telling shots that leave enemies with catastrophic wounds. The Bushwacker, Drifter, and Maverick make your choice of subclasses!
 Lodestar: Fractured Soul Given Form. In combat lodestars are poetry in motion, their innate powers bringing both wonder and woe. To keep from unraveling into madness these fractured souls must train and hone their skills, becoming masters of body and mind—and their lodestones, magical spheres used to attack, defend, and more. The lodestar chooses from three methods: Control, Imagination, or Instinct.
 Monster Tamer: Companion of Beasts. Monster tamers bond with monstrous pets, whether beasts, exotic aberrations, slimes, or even draconic in nature! Though significantly weaker on their own, tamers with companions make for a potent and unique addition to any group of adventurers able to tolerate the presence of a monster in their midst. Select from the Animalist regimen, Monstrous regimen, and Oddball regimen.
 Savant: Mind Over Matter. Sometimes saving the day means weaponizing knowledge. Savants are brilliant detectives, iconic martial artists, and adventurous physicians, each utilizing genius where others rely on magic or brute power. Repositories of lore, savants also use canny combat tricks to put enemies at a disadvantage. You might be an Adversary, a Chirurgeon, or a Coordinator.
 Tinkerer: Engineer of Wonder. Tinkerers bring life to impressive contraptions, create incredible devices, and forge legendary destinies! When not making or improving mundane items, tinkerers use their technical genius to unleash elemental fury upon their foes, relying upon their own brilliance to resist any magic that might subvert their will. Steam Knights, Bombardiers, and Mechanics make up the tinkerer's choice of subclasses!
Collector's Gift Set
For collectors, and those looking for a great gift, we are producing a special Collector's Gift Set of both hardcovers with gorgeous faux-leather covers. We will only be doing one print run of these, so get 'em while you can!
Final design may change
Bonus Villain Spotlights! 
We have a collection of additional villainous figures from the pages of EN5ider. Unlike those in the book above, these myths are not from our own world; they're our own fantasy creations! 
These operate a little like 'stretch goals' -- each of the below Villain Spotlights is a PDF which all backers who have backed £15 or more (the PDF tier or higher) will get for free as we reach certain funding targets. The higher the funding reaches, the more bonus free stuff you get! And not only that...
... we give them to you as soon as we hit the stretch goal. Not after the campaign. Right away. Just as a little thank you for the trust you put in us and our project.
 REACHED! £10,000 Villain Spotlight: Jaxi the Blightgunner. Although they are certainly places of decay and death, swamps are also home to a great deal of life and they bustle with activity—the popping of gasses rising out of the muck, the chittering of insects ever searching for food, and in Chokewater, the clack of colliding lead firing off an explosive charge from Jaxi's rifle! The Blightgunner has fiercely protected her lair for 16 years now, though she has long since ceased loving her home and desperately searches for a way to escape its influence without giving up the powers it has bestowed upon her. In addition to her statblock (CR 7) this article includes a trio of magic items: an acid bullet recipe, drypowder, and Thorncase. Designed by Peter Martin, illustrated by Herman Lau and Savage Mojo.
 REACHED! £20,000 Villain Spotlight: Rosie Arkwright. Halloween is the theme of this supplement, and to help spookify your games we've got an unassuming horror to titillate, captivate, and eviscerate adventurers: the undead ragdoll Rosie Arkwright. Despite her small size she is durable, deadly, and able to create legions of creatures like herself, vastly outnumbering victims before swarming upon them with mystical needle and thread used to sew up mouths, eyes, and lives! Brilliantly penned by Andrew Engelbrite with a wonderful illustration by Xanditz.
 REACHED! £30,000 Villain Spotlight: Dras'a Wolf. This entry into the Villain Spotlight series is all about the scourge of the seas men know as Dras'a the Wolf, a hobgoblin pirate with incredible ambitions and the cunning to see them through. Originally master of the Drelway Chain of islands, after capturing a learned shipmaker from afar the monstrous buccaneer has been preparing for when his abductee's drafts and designs lead to ocean-worthy vessels, boats that will unleash him and his underlings to become a scourge upon the open waves.
 REACHED! £40,000 Villain Spotlight: Skrivena Moc. Usually found deep within a dungeon near the site of a bloody battle, the blade Skrivena Moc seems at first to be a powerful weapon able to sear foes with fire and strike through even the toughest armor. What more it speaks to its wielders, offering advice and admiration in equal parts—but only to gain their trust, convincing them that their unnatural attachment to it is nothing to fear all the while it slowly consumes their very soul! This devious intelligent magic item and creature was written by Andrew Engelbrite and illustrated by Rachel Maduro.
 REACHED! £50,000 Villain Spotlight: Eshaq the Zealoutous. Eshaq was once the prophet of an evil deity. His reward for a lifetime of faithful servitude was being embalmed and interned in a temple but he was quickly forgotten with the passage of time. 200 years since the last of his disciples have perished Eshaq has risen to spread the gospel of his now dead god. A CR 17 undead creature from Robert Lashley; illustrated by Indi Martin. Also includes details and map of of Eshaq's lair, plot hooks, and the new Zealotous Undead template.
 REACHED! £60,000. Villain Spotlight: Syndrathrax the Soul Eater. A mighty CR 27 monster! While technically an ancient red dragon, Syndrathrax’s necromantic transformations and attempted apotheoses have forever altered her. Though she shares the massive size of her fellow red wyrms she is gaunt and skeletal, and her scales sapped of their red luster and now bone white. Thanks to the necromantic energy that permeates her body she radiates a faint spectral glow that she can mask when she chooses--the souls of those that she has swallowed are sometimes seen struggling vainly to escape in this light.
 REACHED! £70,000. Villain Spotlight: Granny Buccus. Sweet, maternal, a dab hand in the kitchen, Granny Buccus is the heart of the town of Cridhe Briste. As the town’s baker she provides the people with bread, cakes, and pastries—on special occasions she even makes her famous  and beloved Boiled Tarts. The adoring townsfolk don’t even know that they’re under the spell of a succubus, ready and willing to do whatever 'Granny' asks of them!  By Anna Blackwell; illustrated by Alba Palacio.
 REACHED! £80,000. Villain Spotlight: Glamdrellyxxana the Gold. A gold dragon druid under the influence of an ancient curse, Glamdrellyxxana believes the only way to ensure that the world remains ‘good’ is to destroy all humanoid life. From her lair in a mountain lake she's amassed an army of plant creatures to sweep down across the world and cleanse it of the blight from meddling civilizations destined to bring ruin with their advancement, yet the dragon often feels melancholy about the need to destroy so many living things. Glamdrellyxxana is resigned to this course of action however, convinced by fell visions of an industrialized future—and distracted by mind-altering plants when the guilt becomes too much to bear. By Will Gawned; illustrated by Júlio Rocha.
 REACHED! £90,000 Villain Spotlight: Vengar the Reader. Goblins are known for many things—reading is not typically on that list, but it's not like Vengar is a typical goblin. Once a trapfinder for the Chokeleaf tribe, this errant necromancer went entirely off the deep end after selfishly stealing an ancient tome to fulfill his ambitions of power. The cursed book has sucked away his vitality and now Vengar travels from tribe to tribe posing as a shaman, utilizing everything he can to acquire more magics able to extend his piteous life before the dark entities he's pledges his soul to come calling for his debt. In addition to his statistics (CR 5), Vengar has access to a variety of enhanced undead that explode, ignite, poison, become conduits of deathly energies, and even hide other monsters inside their bodies. Designed by Charlie Brooks, illustrated by Renan Moraes.
 REACHED! £100,000. Villain Spotlight: Ezekial.Ezekial is a minotaur gifted (or maybe cursed) with intelligence and cunning beyond that of most of his kin. Ezekial is the leader of a small band of thieves who are on a crime spree stealing priceless artifacts and rare tomes of knowledge. This article describes Ezekial, his goals and personality, a description of his band of thieves, and lists possible plot-hooks that involve Ezekial.
REACHED! £110,000. Villain Spotlight: Bezkusmet the Unscaled. Dragons are known to be terrifying but all pale in comparison to Bezkusmet the Unscaled. As his name suggests there is no hue or substance to his draconic scute leaving his musculature and skeleton bared for the world to see, lattices of finger-thick veins and arteries the size of a human’s wrist inexorably pumping blood across his utterly naked body. Only a thin sheen of transparent magic holds Bezkusmet’s organs and muscles in place, the last of the twisted supernatural energies of his birthright all that keeps him intact. By Mike Myler; illustrated by Claudio Pozas and Ekaterinya Vladinakova.
£130,000. Monstrous Menagerie: From Stranger Woods. Four fantastical new fey monsters for your 5E game! The goat-horned ochokochi with a bony cleaver; the capricious trickster poludnitsa; the angelic-looking samovila, ladies of drought and harvest; and the repulsive via, with their gaze of dread. These creatures are inspired by Eastern European folklore.
We'll unveil more if we're lucky enough to reach those funding goals!

Want more than just one of each book? You can add on books piecemeal below. Note that you MUST include shipping costs to do this, and you will need to calculate those yourself based on your location. campaign.story:
This unique calendar project is brought to you by Board Game Art Creations. However, it would not have been possible without the support of 13 of your favorite publishers who partnered with me to see their logo, as well as their most popular games turned into handmade component mosaics. Whether you want to brighten up your kitchen, geek up your office so you can have your co-workers ask you about board games, or spruce up your game room - this is the perfect calendar for you. 
Every image I create takes between 3 to 8 hours to assemble. Sometimes I use a reference image to help me with proportions, but I also like to go with the flow for some creations. I begin the process by choosing the colors I need from the game boxes I know contain the right pieces. Once I have the correct components, I plan out where each part will go. As I carefully lay the pieces I am constantly moving them into just the right place! I use a pencil to move pieces in tight areas because it helps with precision. Photographing each image takes almost an hour. Depending on which pieces I have used for the mosaic, the angle of the lighting needs to be adjusted. There is a lot of trial and error when taking the shots, and climbing up a chair over top of my gaming table is time consuming! 
PLAY


Every month has a component mosaic of a well-known board game as the main image, as well as a mosaic of that publisher's logo.
There is a write up about the publisher, including their website so you can check out their games.
The calendar includes a section to write the games you played during the month.
At the end of the calendar, you will find a 10x10 challenge page!


PLAY

You asked for prints, coasters and magnets; so here is your chance! When you manage your pledge in Crowd Ox, you will have the opportunity to add the following: 
 set of 4 Wingspan-inspired coasters (*Not an official Stonemaier Games product) These coasters are 3 mm thick, made of hardboard with a glossy finish, and have a cork underlay so they do not scratch your furniture.
$US17 / $C23 for the set 
 Alternate set of 4 coasters 

 8"x 8" and 12"x 12" photo quality prints for your game room! (frame not included)
$US10 / $C14 for the small print and $US15 / $C20 for the large 
 10 assorted magnets (2.5" x 2.5" approximately) 
 $US15 / $C20 for the set 
The shipping will be added in the pledge manager when you finalize your transaction.
First of all, I want to thank the gaming community and all its members who have supported me since the beginning. Thomas Covert (BGR), I am so grateful for your friendship, your advice and support. I would not be where I'm at in the gaming industry without you. Blake Howatson, thank you for putting up with a messy game room for me to do my art and thank you for your support in this project and for tolerating my grumpy days. Marc Specter (Grand Gamers Guild), thank you for being such a good friend and for all your advice on the campaign. Daryl Andrews, Rob Byers and Steve Robertson, thank you for lending me games for components I needed but did not have. Helaina Cappel(Burnt Island Games), thank you for you help with the campaign. Thank you to all the Instagram friends I have made over the past few months who have shared my work on their social media. To those who created content to help spread the word about my work: Angelica Lazary (Married Meeples), Katia Dupras (Meeple QC), Jonathan Flike(Atomic Automaton), The Lonestar Meeple podcast, Board Game Halv, Bjorn Ottevaere, Chris Goodlet (The Charity Board Gamer), Conor McGoey (Inside Up Games), David Abadie (Patate des ténèbres), Adam Singer (Shelf Clutter Games) and I'm sure I forgot some, I am forever grateful.  Last but not least, thank you to the 13 publishers who joined in on this project, and for also sending games to make sure I would have pieces to represent you in my work. Without you, this calendar would not have been possible. 
I will send a survey within the next 2 weeks, using the CrowdOx pledge manager system, to the email address associated with your Kickstarter account. You will be able to choose your add-ons and provide your shipping information at that time.

updates.update_content:
Good morning!
I am so grateful to all of you who supported the 2021 calendar campaign. Your support has helped me get better equipment in order to improve the quality of the images I take of my art pieces, and it has allowed me to spend more time focusing on this new passion. This is helping me improve my craft, but also make sure I can offer a variety of products you will all love.

Good morning,
I wanted to take the time to first of all apologize for the shipping delays which resulted in some international backers not receiving their order by Christmas. It saddens me more than you know to have to write this update. As you can understand, we are in the holiday season (of a COVID year on top of that), which is causing additional delays. I tried my very best to ship in a timely manner, but as I explained in the last update, there were unforeseen circumstances that delayed the international orders from going out when they were supposed to. We are at the point where some of you are receiving your orders now which is great, some will get them before January 1st, and a few of you will be getting your orders after the new year starts. I know this is disappointing since some of you had purchased these to be gifted to others, but I can only hope that those individuals will be understanding of the current circumstances.

Hi,
I decided to write this quick update following some of the confusion around Canadian orders that were meant for local pick-ups. 

In my last update, I indicated you would be emailed to arrange pick up, which I did. I have all your stuff here. That being said, the reason why you got notifications from Funagain was because the shipment to me with all of your pick-up orders got sent after I was shipped all of the extras I asked they send me. That is why I have all that is required to fulfill your orders now, because of all the surplus they shipped to me. So please ignore this shipping notification you got from them; And no, they are not being sent to you by mail because I don't have your addresses and you selected pick-up and did not pay for shipping. I hope this makes sense now.

campaign.story:
Art by Julianne Griepp
From the creative mind behind Icarus: A Storytelling Game About How Great Civilizations Fall, comes Spenser Starke’s next project Alice is Missing, a silent role-playing game about the disappearance of Alice Briarwood, a high school junior in the small town of Silent Falls. 
Developed by Hunters Entertainment and published & distributed by Renegade Game Studios, Alice Is Missing is a unique kind of roleplaying game in which players only communicate using their phones, sending text messages to each other as they unearth clues about what happened to Alice.
The game is played live and without verbal communication. Players inhabit their character for the entirety of the 90-minute play session, and instead of speaking, send text messages back and forth to the other characters in a group chat, as well as individually, as though they aren’t in the same place together. 
Haunting beautiful, deeply personal, and highly innovative Alice is Missing puts a strong focus on the emotional engagement between players, immersing them in a tense, dramatic mystery that unfolds organically through the text messages they send to one another. Right at home with games like Life Is Strange, Gone Home, Oxenfree, and Firewatch, it’s designed to feel as much like an event-style experience as it does a role-playing game.
Alice Is Missing runs over a single session of 2-3 hours, with 3-5 players. In the first 45 minutes, players create their characters, their relationships to Alice, and their ties with each other. The next 90 minutes are spent uncovering secrets and unearthing clues in an attempt to discover where Alice is, and who is behind her disappearance.
Though text messages seem to be the most common mode of communication in our modern era, they are rarely utilized as a storytelling medium.
The integration of texting into the gameplay unlocks a brand new way to play RPGs that is unlike anything you’ve likely experienced before. It’s personal, immersive, and perfect for remote play.

Powered by simple but unique card mechanics that give everyone equal footing in telling the story, the game runs without a GM, or gamemaster, and instead empowers the players to create the story together.
While in-game time is fluid and the text messages could take place over the course of a day or more, the actual gameplay lasts a total of 90 minutes and is accompanied by a beautifully cinematic, licensed music playlist (featuring artists such as Message To Bears, This Patch of Sky, Justin LaPointe, and Be Still The Earth) which acts as both a timer and a soundtrack for the game.
You’ll start by choosing characters, drawing a motive for how that character acts, and assigning relationships to one another. Then, using the appropriate prompts on your character card, each player will record a secret voicemail to be played at the end of the game.
You’ll then establish some important information about your town of Silent Falls by choosing suspects and locations you think could have played a part in Alice’s disappearance. Lastly, you’ll receive Clue Cards that will be used during the game to generate information about the mystery you’re unraveling.
Once the timer starts and the game begins, you’ll flip your Clue Card when the number on the timer hits the number on the Clue Card’s back. This will often result in you drawing a card from the Suspect or Location deck and combining it with the prompt on the Clue Card to create the information your character uncovers.
This clue is then worked into the text conversation between the characters organically.

These clues will continue to be revealed throughout the game, building tension and heightening the stakes until the 10-minute card flips, and the game comes to its climactic end.
 Once the timer goes off at 90 minutes, players will have the opportunity to send one last text message before the secret voicemails play over the closing music track. Once the voicemails are finished and the current song ends, the game comes to a close. 
By putting its lens on the relationships, tensions, and story arcs between the characters looking for Alice just as much as the search for Alice itself, the game challenges players to explore aspects of emotional intimacy and personal connection in a unique and accessible way.
Alice Is Missing inherently deals with mature themes and potentially-difficult topics such as gender, sexuality, violence, and grief. We’ve been lucky enough to bring on the incredibly talented Lauren McManamon (Girl Underground, Good Society: A Jane Austen RPG, Codex) as our editor to ensure these topics are approached in a thoughtful and responsible manner. 
We’ve also included important tools to help navigate these themes at the table (and off the table) to ensure everyone has both an exhilarating and positive experience.
Though the game has been in development for the last year, in an unintentional way, it mirrors the reality we now face during this era of social distancing; the craving for connection despite the distance that may be between us.
Alice is Missing provides a unique way to play without the traditional hang-ups that come with trying to structure a Virtual Table Top session. Since the only time you'll need to 'go to the table' is to grab a card. The meat of gameplay exists on your mobile devices.
 We’ve put a great deal of work into ensuring Alice Is Missing will be available as a marketplace item on Roll20 not long after the campaign ends. With the lack of in-person gaming opportunities given the current social distancing orders in place around the world, we hope by making the game available in this format quickly, it will allow players to share a unique roleplaying experience together from the comfort and safety of their own home.
The Roll20 version of the game will not replace the use of players’ phones for sending text messages back and forth during the game. It will instead serve as your shared table during online play, allowing everyone to interact with the cards that drive the narrative forward.
 For those of you who would rather not use Roll20, we are offering a PDF with a Print on Demand cards via DTRPG to use with your other messaging systems of choice. It’s important to emphasize, however, that the cards need to be communally accessible individually via a cloud or other software to manage remote play in this way.
We plan to release the digital version of Alice is Missing in July 2020. We plan to release the physical version to our backers in November 2020, with the game being made available to stores soon after through a global publishing deal with Renegade Game Studios. We will use DriveThruRPG for all of our digital fulfillment.
 For this project, we will be charging shipping as we fulfill each item. YOUR PLEDGE DOES NOT INCLUDE THE COST OF SHIPPING. 
We will be using a pledge manager to collect information from backers. 
 We will be using Gamerati for all of our domestic and international fulfillment purposes.
Domestic Shipping: For traditional USPS shipping, we expect to charge ~$8 USD per package through our warehouse for the physical pledge.
International Shipping: We will be working with our fulfillment partner for available countries in order to ship via local shipping options. 
We expect the cost of shipping for the physical package to be as follows: 
Australia and New Zealand: ~$8 USD
Canada and the European Union: ~$12 USD 
Europe (Non-EU): ~$19 USD
Rest of the world ~$25 USD
NOTE: The final cost of shipping may differ from our estimations.
NOTE: Roll20® is not responsible for the creation or timely delivery of this content.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have run multiple Kickstarter campaigns in the past, including Outbreak: Undead, Kids on Bikes, Overlight, Icarus, and The ABCs of RPG (D&D), and Altered Carbon: The Role Playing Game. 

The manufacturing process is out of our hands and might cause unexpected delays for the physical rewards, as we have experienced in the past — especially during this current climate — but we will do everything in our power to ensure everything progresses as smoothly as possible.

While we are opening shipping to the entire world, there is always the possibility of unforeseen complications with the delivery to some locations.

For our previous backers who are aware of our US warehouse issues we've had in the past (damaged goods), our new relationship with Gamerati ensures that this project will not suffer the same issues.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
HeartBeat Dice is excited to announce the creation of our first line of Metal Pride Dice, featuring our new custom heart design, as well as offering our first set of Sharp Edge Dice!  

After the overwhelming success of our first Kickstarter, we decided to continue expanding our range of dice to include metal dice, so everyone could have a set to call their own, in their preferred style.  
  This second Kickstarter project aims to be simple and concise. Featured below, you will see:
• The 10 metal sets we will be offering for this campaign
• HeartBeatDice Sharp Edge Set 
• Rainbow Dice Bag 
• Plus a few extra treats from our friends at DogMightGames, Q-Workshop, Talon & Claw and more!
For those who hate scrolling to the bottom


 After almost a year in development, we are happy to unveil our custom HeartBeatDice Sharp Edge Set!  
$60 / set
We chose a sharp custom font to help the dice stand out!
Featuring our signature Heart Logo because love always crits!
Our dice in natural sunlight
PLAY

 Each Sharp Edge Set will come packaged inside a Kickstarter Exclusive Light-Up Display Box FREE of charge!  
LOOK AT THAT LIGHT
 We created a custom metal frame for these dice and carefully tested a number of colored enamels to best represent these Pride flags! 
 Rainbow Pride Set 
$50 / set
Under normal room light
Bisexual Pride Set
With your feedback we’ve updated and improved the Bisexual Pride Set! $50 / set
Under normal room light ( old color, please refer to updated color above )

$50 / set
Under normal room light
Pansexual Pride Set
Please note that due to the bright vibrant enamel used in Pan there may be a tiny amount of color overlap between the yellow and blue.  
$50 / set
Under normal room light
 Genderqueer Pride Set 
$50 / set
Under normal room light

$50 / set
Under normal room light

$50 / set

 Ebony Rainbow Set

Each metal set will ship inside a protective HeartBeatDice Tin. 
Our Rainbow Dice Bag is sewn out of colorful and durable canvas with a faux leather bottom stamped with our logo. Metal hearts are attached to the drawstrings to prevent fraying. Each bag can hold 200 dice comfortably when closed.  
$25 / bag
Our bags can hold over 200 dice comfortably and have 7 individual pockets for special sets to be stored
7 individual rainbow pockets are sewn into the inside of the bag
Our bags have a square faux leather bottom that allows them to stand upright with or without dice
Here’s a quick look at our Rainbow Aluminum set for this Kickstarter! These Aluminum Metal Dice are CNC machined with an easy to read font and Anodized, which is an electrochemical process that converts the metal surface into a decorative, durable, corrosion-resistant, anodic oxide finish.
$60 / set
$60 / set
A shot of our dice in outdoor lighting
This 60mm Rainbow Resin D20 features our signature Heart on the 20 side of the die! We wanted this d20 to be larger, brighter  and more affordable for this Kickstarter than what is on the market! 
$65 / per die
$65 / per die
  Our friends at DogMightGames have returned for our second Kickstarter!
We are happy to welcome two new additions to the HeartBeat lineup. DogMightGames have crafted for us a Deluxe Pastel Rainbow Dungeon Master Screen and a custom Pastel Rainbow Looking Glass Dice Box. 
• DogMightGames products pledged for will be shipped free of charge by DogMightGames direct. 
PLAY

Handcrafted in solid Maple with breakaway panels for easy storage.

Our friends at Q-Workshop have graciously helped us design and make a Limited Edition 7-pcs Rainbow Pride set for our Kickstarter. This set features our signature heart logo and an intricate engraved design inked with white! 
$13 / set
Q-workshop really loves the cause we represent and wanted to offer us a variety of die for this Kickstarter! Full Disclosure: These two new styles cost us 25% more to manufacture from Q-workshop as theyre not sets they normally offer to customize but we feel they’ll be worth the cost.
The first set we’ll be offering is a “Llama Glitter” Pride Set that uses their beautiful Blue Glitter die as a base with the colors of the rainbow used as the font color. This set will have our HeartBeat design engraved on each face as shown below. 
$17 / set
This second addition from Q-Workshop puts a twist on their Classic White Pearl set. This set will also have our HeartBeat pattern engraved on the die faces with the colors of the Rainbow used as the font color.  
$17 / set • Photo from Db.drnod.de

We are happy to announce that we’ll be offering an engraved version of Talon & Claw’s amazing “Council of Seven” Pride Vault for this Kickstarter! This beautifully crafted box would be a great addition to hold your Metal Pride Sets or Q-Workshop Dice! 
This is Talon & Claw’s default style of vault
Our HeartBeatDice Vault will be engraved with our signature slogan! 
$45 / vault ( Shipping included )
Our amazing and close friend Ceryneian Archer from Gilded Archive has created for us an exclusive Polyhedral Dice Pride bracelet! 

This 20cm double leather bracelet is engraved with the our HeartBeatDice logo and its six dice companions cut out on the sides. The complementing rainbow stained colour is painted by hand and the inside of the bracelet is soft and comfortable to wear. The strong stitching and copper coloured snap make it a durable item. The snap is nickle free.
$20 / each
We’ve teamed up with our phenominal and amazing friends at Arcane Spectacles to bring you this Pride Spell Tracker! Arcane Spectacles always try to make new intentional items for your many adventures! Their passion is finding more ways to get more out of your gorgeous dice!
$30 / each
Each tracker is 3D printed with vinyl lining and a protective clear coat. Rubber feet will be included!
The back of the spell tracker will feature a collaborative illustration featuring the mascots of Arcane Spectacles and HeartBeatDice!
Look at Elza and Mocha!
For this Kickstarter we’ll be offering 10 styles of Spell Tracker including the Rainbow tracker shown above!
$13 / per pin

 For this Kickstarter we wanted to collaborate and showcase: Queer, Marginalized, and POC artists in the community and have them design an enamel pin for HeartBeatDice! Please support them further by visiting their respective social media platforms and online shops! 
Misa is the unofficial artist for HeartBeatDice and the mastermind behind our mascot Mocha the Shiba Inu! You’ve probably seen their artwork plastered all over this Kickstarter and our Social Media! Their masterful sculpting skills are just as impressive as their digital illustrations.
Ceryneian Archer is the owner of Gilded Archive and the crafter of the popular Polyhedral Pride Bracelets. Their leather works are phenomenal, and any of their accessories would be a welcome addition to your collection!
Lily is a freelance artist who has done work for such companies as: Disney, Cartoon Network, Mattel, Bandai-Namco, Furry Puppet Studios, Amino and MORE! Their playful, vibrant & delightful illustrations are a sight to behold!
Tori Grant is Storyboard Artist based out of Vancouver, BC whose previously worked on Equestria Girls/My Little Pony, Polly Pockets and Johnny Test! Tori has also illustrated some absolutely phenomenal patches and enamel pins that are available on their webshop!
Jewell is a game artist at Ubisoft. Their love for creating small and quaint worlds through their art shines through in every illustration they create. Check out their personal games, Irori and Gacha on itch.io
$13 / pin
$13 / pin
Maratastic is a 21 year old art student whose an up and coming designer in the world of tabletop accessories. They’ll be designing additional pins, patches and accessories through HeartBeatDice in the near future!
 This artist has designed 4 unique pins for this Kickstarter. 
Migo is an up and coming 19 year old animation student with big dreams and bigger ambitions! Her forte is expressive and vibrant high-color fantasy illustrations and you can expect to see more of their artwork featured through HeartBeat Dice in future projects
After the Kickstarter you’ll choose which pin(s) you’d like to order via the Pledge Manager



Once the campaign ends your pledge will convert to Pledge Manager credit. Pledge Manager is a tool used by most Kickstarters to allow backers to alter their pledges, choose additional items, personalize what they bought and type in their shipping address. You’ll be able to add, and pay for, any additonal items to your pledge via our Pledge Manager. Final shipping costs will be calculated and paid via our Pledge Manager. Additional shipping will use real-time calculations, and automatically apply. We’d like to reassure you that by using our Pledge Manager youll be able to add more funds to your pledge after the campaign has funded. Pledging now helps to ensure we reach our goal and can start production on our new line of product.  
If we have any delays Mocha will contact you ASAP!
 • The HeartBeat Rainbow Dice Bag and Community Pin will be Free Shipping due to their light weight! 
Retailers
If you are a Retailer who wishes to carry our dice please contact us via Kickstarter so that we work with you directly once the campaign has concluded.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our team at HeartBeat Dice has grown exponentially since our first Kickstarter. We learned plenty of do’s and don’ts and feel confident in this second crowdfunding project! Over the last 2 years we’ve streamlined our shipping and handling methods, research and development of new products and have worked hard to provide you with the finest LGBTQ Pride Dice on the market. 
 
With this second Kickstarter we have spent almost a year in development with these new factories to ensure a top quality product. With that in mind, depending on the final backer count there may be a production delay on the factory level, for that reason we have pushed our initial shipping date back to December 2020 though we hope to have our items shipped out sooner. 
 
 If there are other unforeseen challenges that arise throughout the project such as: Production delays, Shipping delays, and Customs delays from China we will ensure to provide updates on anything noteworthy in a timely manner.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
