campaign.story:
Black Oak Workshop is back in black with a d20 that gives no quarter - The Black Death! We are sure you will agree, this d20 will reign supreme on your game table. All other dice will quiver in fear before it!
The Black Death crushes all other dice!
Standing at almost an inch tall and featuring a skull on the 20 face, this mighty d20 will allow you to go medieval on all those who oppose you! Reach into your dice bag and draw forth the deadliest d20 available!
The Black Death is as fearsome in appearance as it is in name! Many tales of woe will be wrought by its cold, silent faces. Check out some of the deadly features detailed below.
This die towers above lesser dice. The size of the Black Death along with its crisply presented numerals means it is easy to read while being frightening to behold!
We've worked to offer some unique and exciting exclusives as part of this project. In addition, we've got some GREAT stretch goals. Our backers from previous projects know that we focus on creating value within our projects and we think the stretch goals really show this. Read on!
Each of these exclusives are part of this project only and will not be available again after the project closes (except the Coin & Blood PDF) so get yours while you can! Each of these items are associated to a specific pledge level and will not be available separately in the pledge manager. For backer levels that include physically shipped exclusives on this project, we are only shipping to the USA.
Not just any dice box can contain the insidious Black Death. We asked Dog Might Games to design a dice box worthy of the theme and they returned with a killer design! This dice box features a skeletal coffin top and black finish that pairs exceptionally well with this stone cold d20. It can hold a dozen Black Death d20s with ease.
As with the exclusive dice boxes from our Dragon d20 project, this dice box is based on Dog Might's Dragon Sheath product line and comes in their Abyssal Black Flame Birch. It matches the theme perfectly!
Dog Might really came through for us on the Dragon d20 project and our backers LOVED the dice boxes. We are excited to have the opportunity to work with them again!
This item is available to ship to US backers only.
Let your Black Death d20s roll in style through the winding stairwells of Skull Keep! This dice tower brings all the theme and then some. At a full 12" tall, this 3d modeled and printed tower is a sight to behold. These towers come fully assembled and hand painted in the likeness of the photos. You will be ready to roll upon the opening of your rewards shipment! 
This tower is based on designs licensed from Fat Dragon Games and also modified designs from the Dragonbite Community Creator program. The Skull Keep is a sturdy and well crafted tower. It will last you many years and look incredible on your game shelf!
PLAY

There have been questions regarding availability of the STL files for the Skull Keep model, but these will not be available as part of the project as they are not owned by Black Oak Workshop. We do not have an agreement in place that allows for release of the files, so we will not be offering those this go around. Thanks for understanding everyone!
NOTE: Due to the work required for these beautifully hand painted items, the quantity is limited to 30 (updated from 20). The reward level is limited and if all 30 are taken, there will be no option to purchase this item in the pledge manager. If any do remain, they will be available on a first-come/first-served basis. This item is available to ship to US backers only.
If you need to take death to the next level, we have you covered! The Epic Death is an utterly HUGE d20 that stands a full 6.5 inches on your game table! This is a hand painted and assembled item using 3d printed faces and a tough rubber frame - it's light, but rugged. You can roll it with no fear - that's right - this mega d20 can be rolled and used in game!
This is an exclusive, custom variation on the Giant D20 by Amber's Secret Cove. You can view the standard product here. These huge dice are awesome fun to toss on the table or put on the shelf for display and are well rated by customers. Check out this monster in action!
PLAY

NOTE: Due to the work required to assemble these, the quantity is limited to 50 (updated from 25). The reward level is limited and if all 50 are taken, there will be no option to purchase this item in the pledge manager. If any do remain, they will be available on a first-come/first-served basis. This item is available to ship to US backers only.
While not truly an exclusive, we are partnering with the fine folks at Gallant Knight Games to once again offer one of their killer RPGs as a fun addition to the project. For Coin & Blood is another one of many well-received products by the GKG team and we feel it is a great thematic pairing for the Black Death!
For Coin & Blood is a classically inspired d20 fantasy roleplaying game with a twist...a twist of the knife!
This game has received very positive reviews and is a great read. We're very honored to be able to offer it to you here at as a PDF bundle with our dice or as the PDF with a print on demand code to get a physical copy. Check out the game on DriveThruRPG!
Embracing the literary genre known as "grimdark", and inspired by stories of mercenaries, sellswords and blackguards, FOR COIN & BLOOD keeps you on your toes, as you tell stories about the terrible things that happen to people, when they head out in search of coin, passion, and revenge...
Clearly, this is a most excellent game in which to sling your Black Death d20s! We're offering two pledge levels for this item. The first includes a PDF download of the game and the other includes the PDF and a code for a free softcover POD copy of the game! These are both excellent values for this product! For backers ordering the POD version, the physical book will ship separate from the other rewards on the project.
NOTE: The Coin & Blood PDF will be available in the pledge manager post project for $6, so for those backers who would like to receive a copy it will be available there. However, the POD code will not be available in the pledge manager.
All shipments will be processed through the United States Postal Service. Domestic (USA) orders will ship utilizing First-Class Service and International orders will ship utilizing First-Class Package International Service. All rewards will be packed securely in an effort to minimize risk of damage during shipping. Tracking numbers are emailed to backers at the email address on file with BackerKit upon printing of the respective shipping label.
For our International backers, we are adding a note that the shipping costs are reflective of what the USPS charges us. We do not have overseas distribution and likely will not for some time as we are a small shop. As we grow, we hope to be able to get those costs down for  you as we know they are painful. All tariffs/taxes/fees associated with international shipments are the responsibility of the receiving party.
NOTE: For backer levels that include exclusives on this project, we are only shipping to the USA. We cannot risk lost international shipments for these items as replacements will not be possible.
NOTE: We do not ship to the Russian Federation or the DPRK.
Dice Maniacs!
For all you dice lovers out there, Black Oak Workshop encourages you to visit and join the Dice Maniacs Club on Facebook. It is a great place to share your collection, view some great dice, ask questions and enjoy all things dice related! 
Thanks for checking out our project!

updates.update_content:
Hello Backers!
A quick note to say all shipping wrapped up about two weeks ago. We are all done! Thank you for helping bring this project to life...er, DEATH!
Long Promised Extras

Hello Backers!
Our missing dice have arrived!

Hello Backers!
I wanted to provide a quick update to say our shortage of Bloody Black Deaths will soon be a thing of the past. Our order is well underway and will be headed our way in just 2 weeks time. They'll take between 5-10 days to get here and then it will be right back to shipping our last remaining orders. We should have everything out a little earlier than I was expecting.

Hello Backers!
Shipping has almost wrapped up! Over 90% of you should have received an email from Stamps.com now providing tracking data. This email would have gone to the email address you have on file with Kickstarter. It has been FANTASTIC seeing the posts out there on social media featuring beautiful pics and kind comments. We're happy the dice are being well received!

Hello Backers!
We wanted to provide a quick update on shipping. We are still attacking! We've slipped about a week from where we wanted to be, but we are just over 80% of the way complete. As things stand, we will finish no later than next Friday (October 18), although I expect we will wrap up a day or two earlier. Once we have the last package out the door, we will post an update for everyone.

Hello Backers!
As many of you have noticed, we have begun shipping. We REALLY appreciate the pics out there online! It's cool seeing the dice out there in the wild. We will continue shipping this week and into late next week. While we will not make our original goal of completely fulfilling in September due to the RPG sets being unlocked, we're on track to complete around mid October.

Hello Backers!
Our Black Death d20s have arrived - every strain! We think you will agree they look incredible!!

Hello Backers!
We are awaiting inbound shipments scheduled across the next couple of weeks and those shipments will need to be checked for quality purposes, but we are beginning shipping preparations. Each of you who has completed their survey will receive an email today for final notice about changes to your shipping addresses. Please make sure to make any updates as necessary to avoid shipping errors. A quick response will be appreciated!

Hello Backers!
Production of the our run Skull Keep towers is nearing completion! Take a look below...

Hello Backers!
We have returned from GenCon to find our dice bags and pins have arrived and they are gorgeous! The pins are BIG and aaaaalllllll death! The bags are sharp as well. All of you will find these in your shipments!

Why did you want 65 sets? That reason will be the same reason someone doesn't want 64 sets of percentile d10. Consumer choice. Thinking a 'set' is only 7 dice is thinking inside the box, and it is not your original thinking, but rather thought up long ago by someone who said this is the choice you will be allowed to choose and how to think about the choice. You get the illusion of choice, not true freedom when you then think of a complete set as only 7 dice.

That is the point: it is your money and if that is what you want then get it, but for those who don't want the choices forced upon us limiting us, and if we do want something slightly different we pay a very high price, much higher than you might pay. The starter set for D&D 5e is a standard Poly 7 set x 6 so you get six different colors of translucent dice each with 7 dice. I would not want any of those dice personally, but I see why they made it. That product then was not something I would buy as I like real choice, not slightly cheaper options if I get the choices someone else made. That is why most of us are backing this kickstarter we want a dice with a skull on it, or that dice tower as it is not a normal choice and obviously not one Chessex or other big manufacturer provided long ago as it doesn't take a genius level creative to think up skull dice, an emblem quite old and venerated. Call them Pirate dice, Death Dice, but in the end such an idea could have easily been thought up back in 1977 when they start churning out dice. For some reason it took 2019 to be the year of the Skull dice. I also like that they will be larger 26mm sized dice. Those two things are the selling point for me personally. I have seen skull dice before, d6, yet I'm glad this kickstarter decided to make some full sets available.

I'm the customer. I'm the one buying it and I just bought it not from you. That is why when I find an online dice store that allows me to buy individual dice at a good price I give them all my business and DO NOT support local stores because they won't give me that choice as all they do is offer me choices forced upon me by companies who refuse to provide that option.

We get it, Yet, dice can be made available individually and selling the set without the percentile and then having that as an add on just like someone can add on all those other individual dice means it is very possible to do, and is thus all about the choices you decide. The end result for those who want multiple sets or one set and multiple of a given dice to simply avoid owning dice they probably will never use, and these are not cheap dice, is to pay a lot more for the privilege just so they can have a couple more dice. The lynchpin of the problem is a d10 percentile. I get we can roll it and just say 'that's a 3' rather than a 30 but these dice are about aesthetics.

A set of dice at 11 would be 1.80 per dice if it were 6 dice per set, but since you have the percentile it is 7 dice per set and that means 1.50 per dice. Yet, if we can add individual dice at 3 dollars per, that is essentially double the cost. The choice then becomes adding more sets and taking percentile dice we don't need, verses adding dice individually that are twice as much. In the end, offering a set that is 6 dice, saves us the money and I doubt many people are going to run out and buy tons of percentile d10, but some will and for those who want multiples of dice can more easily buy those sets without getting saddled. It is a win-win. You'll sell more sets, and still give the option to get that d10 percentile dice. The alternative will just leave a more salty flavor.

campaign.story:
Hey there! I'm Andrew, but you can call me "Schmandrew" because, let's face it, there are a lot of Andrews out there who also make art. I'm an Illustrator, Designer, and Professor who smiles a lot. Over the last three years, I've slowly transitioned from the world of pop art style alternate movie posters to the world of freelance and original art. 
Before we get too deep and become besties, let me explain exactly what this Kickstarter is and why it’s important. First and foremost, this is a campaign to create enamel pins alongside my good friend, and fellow artist, Allen Panakal. Allen and I have overlapping audiences and we’ve both been toying around with the idea of doing pin Kickstarters for awhile now. The thing that makes this truly unique though is that we are running separate campaigns, BUT we are going to reward anyone who supports us both with a very limited edition metal card with both of our art on it! On top of that, we have a stretch goal planned where we’ll each do an interpretation of the other person’s illustration! Pretty rad, right?!
Allen and I at C2E2
So now that I’ve hyped you up, it’s time to get real. In order to understand where these designs came from I need to explain just what the “Banishment” Collection is and what it means. 
Banishment
Everything changed when the fire nation attacked…
Sorry, I couldn’t resist! It’s hard not to jump to Avatar when you start a sentence with “Everything changed.” In all seriousness though, I went through a really difficult experience at the end of 2017 and into the early parts of 2018. Without going too in depth, a few very important cornerstones in my life either left or passed away. It was hard. I’m usually a pretty happy, optimistic person, but during all of that, I was not myself. 
Finally in May of 2018, I remember thinking things were starting to return to normal, but I still felt like I had some pent up energy that needed a release. That’s when I started on “Banishment” and everything actually changed. 
“Banishment” is about that turning point in any struggle where things start to improve. It’s that moment of victory where the tides turn and good overcomes evil. It’s the first of many steps out of any struggle we may have gone through or are currently in. It wasn't the whole story which eventually led to two more pieces, “The Banisher” and “The Banished”.
The Banisher & The Banished
While “The Banisher” represents the mix of exhaustion and relief as we let go and move on, “The Banished” symbolizes the beauty we can find wherever we end up. We are all stronger than we think and whatever happens, we will get through it. That is what the “Banishment” Collection represents.
Having no prior experience doing personal work, I had no idea how it would be received. Thankfully, I was blown away by the reactions I got! So many people shared their own stories with me and how they related to "Banishment". Someone even got one of my pin designs tattooed! 
It’s because of that strong reaction that I decided to create these soft enamel pins designs. I think we could all use a physical reminder on our person to remind ourselves just how strong we really are.
 Check out Allen's pins, prints, mats, and metal HERE
And if you only want to snag the pins, there's no need to jump between campaigns to get the metal cards. Just pick Tier 2.5 and you'll get our pins and all the crossover benefits!
Assuming we can exceed our funding goal, I've prepared some stretch goals to unlock.   


Last but least, all shipping costs will be added on at checkout. All shipping amounts are priced at cost via the weight of each item.

Risks and challenges
The biggest risk and challenge of this kickstarter will be producing and shipping the pins. Once the campaign closes, it takes about a month to receive funds and at that point we'll place orders. Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Over $100k Canadian Raised! Four Stretch Goals Unlocked!
Time for some real Sweet Rolls!
I created Ice Cream Dice to address the severe lack of nearly edible looking dice in the marketplace. I believe I have succeeded.
OK, OK, that wasn't actually why I started Ice Cream Dice. I wanted dice that were fun, unexpected at a gaming table and a little bit whimsical, all while being usable. I started it because I was so tired of seeing the same dice offered on different sites, by different companies with different names. Names like 'Goblin's Blood' and 'Dragon's Blah Blah Blah'. 
When I got to thinking about fun and whimsical, ice cream came immediately to mind and I started on a journey to design the most ice creamy looking dice I could.
Neo, the classic flavor we all love to hate (well a third of it anyway).
Orange Dream, a dreamy mix of orange and cream.
Rainbow, also known as Schubert's Sherbet.
Your Favorite, whether your favorite is chocolate, coffee or caramel, this set has you covered with just a touch of cream.
Bubble Candy, old school bubblegum and carnival cotton candy.
Kiwi, it's even got the seeds!
The matte set on the left and the glossy d20 on the right.
Razzman, the Kickstarter semi-exclusive set. 
After this Kickstarter is done, Razzman will be offered once a year to celebrate the day this Kickstarter was fully funded.
Butterscotch: The epitome of potential. 
Butterscotch will be redone in production to look like Orange Dream. The original intent was to swirl white and a light brown with a highlight yellow/brown. Unfortunately, these are what I got and with no time to order more test sets, you'll just have to trust me. As you can see, I take my dice palettes very seriously, and will deliver on the potential of these dice.
The Dice You See are the Dice You'll Receive
Unlike some dice companies, there are no renders here, these are the dice you will receive. 
Except Butterscotch. 
Butterscotch will get the Orange Dream treatment with a brown and white gemini/swirled result.
Kiwi's numbers will be re-inked in a pale/golden yellow.
The Waffle Dish
This waffle dish is a Kickstarter Exclusive. They will never be made or sold again. These are each individually hand blown glass waffle dishes. They are made with borosilicate glass, which is often used in cookware. They are not as delicate as soft art glass, however, they are still fragile.
They are small. Roughly 1.5" - 2" high and about 2" - 2.5" across at the top.
This shot shows you how beautiful the inside is.
Ssssssssssstretch Goals
I could easily have done what most dice companies do and locked the popular dice designs behind fake stretch goals, but I won't. I could have easily found something that was sort of related to dice and offered that as a stretch goal, I didn't.
I'm a very small company (it's just me) and this is my first Kickstarter, so over complicating things to make it 'look' cooler seemed both dishonest and foolhardy. There's enough moving pieces already, and I'm confident I can deliver on these stretch goals.
QUICK EDIT: If you're stoked about the D6/D10 Sets and mini D6 Bricks, please read update #17. The graphic below will be changed to reflect the updated information later today.








Right about now you're saying to yourself, well, that's great and seems like you can deliver it all, but I WANT MORE! To that, I say, take a gander.
Add-ons, or...more ways to give me your money!
I have worked with small creators in our community to bring you two add-ons. These will both be available to add on to your order in Backerkit after the campaign ends.
Flavour of the Month
For $5 (approx. $4 USD / €3 / £3 ) You can take your kids, your friends or both on an Ice Cream Adventure written exclusively for Ice Cream Dice by Andrew Morley. The local ice cream maker has disappeared! It's up to your party to discover what happened to him. Along the way you may meet yourself some new elementals inspired by Ice Cream Dice. You'll receive a PDF copy of this sweet adventure by late June.
Handmade d4 Dice Bag
For $15 CAD (approx. $12 USD / €10 / £9 ) you will get a custom, handmade d4 shaped bag that holds over 100 dice! 
These are Ice Cream Dice exclusives. I partnered with people that could create things that were special, a bit whimsical and useful. These d4 dice bags aren't likely to be produced again. If you want one, this may be the only time to get one. The inside of this dice bag will be a waffle cone pattern, rather than polka dots.
Pins
For $5 CAD (approx. $4 USD / €3 / £3 ) You'll receive a soft enamel pin that will not only shout to the world you love dice, but also, ice cream.
If you love pins and just need a couple extra for every lapel you own, I got you covered! The pins are soft enamel with a rubber backing.
Ice Cream Dice Custom Dice Box
For $110 CAD (approx. $83 USD / €75 / £65 ) you can get yourself an Ice Cream Dice exclusive dice box made by the wonderful folks over at Dog Might.
For $150 CAD (approx. $114 USD / €100 / £85 ) you can get yourself an Ice Cream Dice box made out of stunning Wenge wood. This rare dark chocolate colored wood is stunning and sustainably sourced.
The folks over at Dog Might reached out to me after seeing my project and told me they had a great idea for a dice box. They weren't lying. These boxes have a lifetime warranty and are gorgeous. Dog Might only works with the best of the best in the industry. I will update this with more details and pictures once I have the prototype in my hands and have all the information.
From Dog Might:  The Dog Might Ice Cream Dice Box is crafted from Flame Birch wood and features a hand applied finish. It comes with a removable foam insert cut to cradle your set of dice perfectly. Remove the foam to easily carry two full sets of polys. Like all Dog Might products, the Ice Cream Dice Box comes with a lifetime guarantee. 
These boxes are prototypes and a couple of small changes will be happening in the final production. The edges of the D20 top will be a little crisper, and the front facing number will be a 20, because we all know that's the number we like to see the most!
The Blue Ice Cream Dice Box
This color combo is called cake by Dog Might, but I call it sno-cone!
The stunning Wenge wood box with Your Favorite. A match made in heaven.
Flat Pack Ice Cream Dice Dice Tower
For $25 CAD (approx. $19 USD / €17 / £15 ) you can get yourself an Ice Cream Dice dice tower made by the awesome folks over at Galaxy Gaming Gear.
The awe inspiring Ice Cream Dice Tower of Doooooooooooooooooom!
Galaxy Gaming Gear makes a slew of flat pack minis, terrain and buildings for all your gaming needs. Their designs are particularly kid friendly and it's great to have them on board. I will continue to sell this tower after the campaign, though the price will likely be $30.
I know, Mom said not to talk about the 'S' word, but we have to...Shipping.
Shipping is the one spell that neither creator, nor adventurer, can break. Being based out of Canada, I feel your pain. I have partnered with a Canadian company that ships straight from China. This is hugely beneficial to all of us, myself included, for a few reasons.
We don't have to wait three months for the dice to arrive by freight ship to North American shores, and then wait further while it's unpacked and sent to different shipping centers which then finally get it shipped to you.
It's reasonably affordable and delivered with tracking number and insurance to everybody.
I save money on not having to ship it by sea, which means I pass that savings on to you.
So here's the shipping breakdown, it doesn't cover every possible currency, but it covers a lot.
There, we did it, we had the dreaded 'S' talk.
Matte or Glossy, that is the Question:
Here are the side by side shots of the Matte & Glossy versions of each set. Some key things to keep in mind: 
The glossy look is achieved by tossing the dice into a rock polisher, so the matte dice are a little larger because they've haven't been polished for as long as the glossy sets. The matte Rainbow and Neo d20's are a little larger than the rest, due to being cast in resin.
The powdery look on the matte Neo and Rainbow will eventually wear off. The colors are still softer than gloss, but the frosty look is not permanent.
If you prefer your colors to be vivid and brighter, you'll want to go with the gloss.
Matte isn't very shiny, I know this should seem obvious, but if you like your dice shiny, go with glossy.
They do feel different, but the difference isn't night and day like it is with matte and glossy paper.
With less polishing, there is occasional color bleed around some of the numbers, it is negligible when it does happen and it only happened on a couple of single numbers on a couple of individual dice in the 25 test sets I got. This may be fixed in production, but I felt it was worth noting
Let's get to the comparison shots...
Neo
Orange Dream
Rainbow
Your Favorite
Bubble Candy

Razzman
The Final Butterscotch will look more like Orange Dream
Let's End this on a High Note
Thank you. They're two simple words that we often toss around without really thinking about what they mean. I think about them a lot and how they relate to this company.
'Thank' is defined as: to express gratitude to or to hold responsible.
So, let me say it again. Thank you. I hold you all responsible for the gratitude I felt every single day leading up to this launch, and will always feel. You cheered me on and you cheered me up, you shared my dice on your podcasts, streams, tweets, instagram, on Facebook. You made sure people knew about me and Ice Cream Dice. 
This company was inspired by some pretty amazing kids and my desire to make D&D and other TTRPG's more accessible to schools and kids. It is my belief that the skills learned and demonstrated while playing tabletop games, of any sort, are the ones we want our next world leaders to possess. Risk taking, problem solving, learning that you can't do everything by yourself, the value of friendship, exploration, listening to multiple viewpoints, among many other things. 
I didn't get here because of a marketing budget or the right analytics or targeted ads. I got here because of my own work and your support. I didn't get here because I hired a team or had an unlimited amount of money to throw at things. I've said from the beginning, what you see is what you will get. campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest risk in this project is the production & shipping time required to manufacture the dice and get them to you, my backers. I have been working with my factory for a while now and they are expecting my order at the end of March. Production time is usually in the 45 - 60 working day range. So somewhere between 9 - 12 weeks. However, complications can occur, holidays happen and to be safe, I have estimated a 9 - 18 week production range into my timeline. This allows for the custom molds to be created that are required to honor the stretch goals that may become unlocked during the campaign.

I have partnered with a Canadian company that has years of experience shipping dice. They ship from their warehouse space in China which allows me to ensure a lower shipping cost that I can pass on to you, the backers. By choosing to ship from China I save time on the actual mass shipping of the product to North America.

Typically, shipping can take up to three months to get to North American shores, and then you still have to wait for it to pass through customs, get unloaded and then get shipped to the shipping companies who then, finally after a couple of weeks, ship to you. By shipping directly from China, using a Canadian company to do it, it'll take a few days to get to the warehouse and then the shipping to backers will start.

This is my first Kickstarter, and I've done everything I can to ensure that you receive a quality product on time and I have researched and learned from the mistakes of those that have come before me.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Finally, some progress...
It's been a while, and this will probably be a long one, so I'll get right to it.
This whole thing has taken much longer than it was ever supposed to, even with anticipated hiccups that were encountered early on. The pandemic has wrought havoc on the world and this Kickstarter got caught up in it, and is still in it, sort of.

Replacements/Never Received Dice
Things are going to start moving slowly in this respect. I am still waiting for my team to ship everything to me, but I received a small shipment of extra dice from this campaign that I had sent to be sold at conventions while everything seemed to be on track to finish up.
I will start going through the form, and next week I will start sending out packages to the folks that need sets replaced. I will also be refunding anyone that has requested a refund and starting to ship the sets requested from the shop as replacements.

I'm Sorry.
I'm sorry this campaign went awry in almost every way imaginable and then some.
After serious consideration, and talking with my team in China, some final decisions have been made. It will add time to things, but it will also ensure every package is tracked and has a better chance of arriving.

updates.update_content:
Replacement & Missing Dice Form Explanation
Alright, it's become pretty clear that what made sense to my brain (which admittedly isn't operating at full capacity these days) didn't make sense to a lot of you, so here's an explanation of the form, broken down question by question.
First though, I want to apologize for not giving you the option of Neo and Kiwi replacements. I will add them to the form, so that if you do want them, you can receive them. I'm going to go into a bit greater detail here about these. If you're here because the form was confusing, just skip to the next headline.

This Should be It.
We're going to cover a lot here, but this should be the final update. Yes, there will be a form to fill out, and unfortunately, even if you've filled one of the previous ones out before, I will ask you to fill this one out as well. It will ensure that you get whatever you need/want, and it will keep everything centralized so that I can send one last spreadsheet off to the fulfillment team and have all the information. There will be no need to confirm bad dice with pictures this time around.

Tomorrow: Pride Vol 1. Launches
And yes, I know not everyone has received their dice from this one yet. And nobody expected this/wanted this to go on as long as it has for some of you.
I came to the decision to launch the Pride Vol 1 after months of consideration, I've had the samples finished since last September, and was originally planning on launching it in February on the one year anniversary of this one launching, then Covid hit. So I delayed until April. Then I realized a small percentage of packages still hadn't made it to their forever homes, so I delayed again, until now.

Thank You. It's Been More of a Ride than I Ever Wanted
...but it's done. Mostly.
I spent the majority of this last year and a bit focusing on all the things that went wrong. And very little of it on the successes. It's now officially time to wrap this thing up, but it's not quite ready for it's bow entirely.

campaign.story:
"Icarus - Opulant Tides" Art by Kent Davis (@idrawbagmen)
Icarus is a collaborative storytelling game about how great civilizations fall, written and designed by first-time designer Spenser Starke 
This GM-less macroscopic RPG begins with Icarus: A city-nation of your design. 
At the height of its power, your city of Icarus has decided to erect a massive, ever-growing monument in the center of town to display its sophistication and prestige to the world. 

Those who have played “The Quiet Year” or “Tales of the Arabian Nights” may be familiar with the format of this game; rather than individual stories of adventurers going on dungeon crawling adventures, players will take on the roles of Diplomats, Scientists, Marshalls, Actors, Politicians, and Business Moguls as they describe events taking place over months, and sometimes years, that will help shape the fall of a powerful civilization.
Icarus is played using the rulebook, a deck of 52 cards, some notecards, and a set of dice, all of which we’d love to offer you as a boxed set as a part of this Kickstarter.
If you'd like a brief summary. Just check out this great "How to Play" with Becca Scott from Geek & Sundry!
NOTE: Displayed is a prototype version of the game, and does not reflect it's final appearance (for example, the aspect cards will be smaller, and the dice will be engraved).
Over the course of the game, players will be stacking dice to represent the growing hubris of the great city, and the failures that characters generate will contribute to the tower as their nation falters and decays. Once the dice tower itself tumbles, the city goes with it.
Icarus invites you to build your own utopia, but also comes with a handful of setting suggestions to get your game up and running quickly. With fascinating and evocative civilizations like:
 The cradle of early mankind
 A fantasy city imbued with magic 
A booming western town along the ever-expanding railroad 
A mystical jungle city full of divine secrets 
The first major city on Mars 
A burgeoning space colony of alien life-forms 
and more, you'll have all the details you need to get a game off the ground within minutes.
Though the range of settings for Icarus are endless, it is important that Icarus features a tower that shall rise and a city that will fall.
"Icarus - Rise of the Singularity" By Kent Davis
Because of this, Icarus is also the perfect tool to use during your campaign’s ‘Session 0’ before hopping into the RPG of your choice. As a game designed specifically for one-shot play (once the tower falls, the game comes to an end), it can serve as both a satisfying single session and as a rich campaign starter for your group's next adventure!
By leading players through the sprawling, epic stories of a civilization’s fight to survive against insurmountable odds, the game creates a world with memorable lore, momentous events, and tragic heroes. 
Exploring a "Retro Sci-Fi" version of Icarus on the surface of Mars.
For games like Outbreak: Undead, Apocalypse World, or any other dystopian/post-apocalyptic systems, Icarus effectively puts a "World Bible" into your hands that can be used to immediately jump into a fully-realized and player-generated universe, where characters are intimately tied to the history and lore of the world they must now fight to stay alive in.
Watch our Live-Play of Icarus, featured on Geek & Sundry and get an idea of how YOU can create any kind of Civilization - only to watch it fall.
Writer: Marvel Comics, DC Comics, Dark Horse, Valiant, IDW
Relics & Rarities, We're Alive: Frontier, Sags of Sundry, King of the Nerds
"Icarus - Byzantine" By Ryan Richmond
Each Player will be dealt a ‘Pillar of Society’ card that will represent a key element of Icarus that you will explore during the game.
Art
Technology
Agriculture
Law
Energy
Social Structures
Etc
Each of the Pillar of Society cards have the choice of either a strength or a weakness prompt to answer. Players will collectively choose only one of their Pillars to be a weakness at the beginning of the game - but that crumbling Pillar will serve as a crucial narrative force in the story to come.
STRENGTH: The people of Icarus feel safer here than anywhere else, why? WEAKNESS: The people of Icarus all share a common fear, what is it? And where did it come from?
A single Pillar card will also be placed in the center, to represent the monument of Icarus.
Afterwards, players will create characters that serve as keystones and cracks in the foundation of society.
These characters are usually a major player in this city's infrastructure, and are tied to their pillar and Motive they receive during character creation. While players can create archetypal relationships (such as a Marshall that represents the pillar ‘Law’ in a western city and whose motive is to “Protect The Citizens”) they can also explore deeper, more subtle roles that can manipulate the city in big ways (a Judge, Lawless Mercenary, Parent who has a position on city council, or a Silent Film Star who has taken a personal interest in politics).
Your Motives will guide you into affecting the narrative in distinct, powerful ways as it unfolds. 
"Icarus - Royal Jungles" Art by Kent Davis (@Idrawbagmen)
During gameplay, each turn a player will draw a Story Card, which will provide them with a prompt they will answer to drive forward the city's narrative. They'll record these answers on notecards as phrases or sentences called 'Aspects' and use them to create a mindmap of the city on the table in front of them.
An 'Aspect' might be something like “city has a fear of mutants” or “We’re running out of water!” It can also relate to a certain character like “President says dissenters should be executed” or “Jacob is the only survivor of his expedition”. 

Aspects are the creative powerhouse of the game, and will be added and replaced often in order to build the narrative. . Consider each one like a 'Scene' in a TV/Movie Drama or a 'Major Event' in the history books telling the tale of this civilization's collapse. 
This is where players can roleplay how/when they either resolve or escalate 'Aspects' in the game.
As characters attempt to affect the world around them in accordance with their motives, players place dice on the Aspects their characters are looking to change within the city. 
When resolving these dice, on a success the die returns to the pool and the player has the chance to create or modify an Aspect to reflect that success. But on a failure, the problem escalates, and the dice must be added to the ever-growing tower at the center of the table.
Ultimately, the dice tower you’re building will fall. This triggers the final collapse of the civilization and the end of the game. You’ll answer three questions as a group before walking away from this fallen society..
What caused the tower to collapse?
What happened to your character in the aftermath?
What became of the civilization after its fall?
Our Kickstarter is pretty straight forward "all in one" Storytelling Experience. Our standard pledge is everything you'll need to play the game. 
However, we do understand people like stuff. As a result, we do have a few additional pledge options to feature as part of our pledge level line-up.
Our Standard Edition "Rome" Icarus box set includes all you need to play:


NOTE* - these are product mockups and do not reflect the final product (but it'll be pretty close!)
Our Deluxe Edition "Teotihuacan" includes a set of optional Add-Ons to heighten your gamplay experience.
NOTE - Products shown are Mockups and do not reflect final products (but they'll be VERY close)

Our Premium Edition "Pandora" includes a beautiful wooden box to hold your deluxe edition inside of. Lovingly crafted by the find folks at Dogmight Games.


ACCESSIBILITY OPTIONS
We understand that this game can rely heavily on table elements, and also ask for a certain amount of dexterity in order to play.  Since we believe that EVERYONE should have a chance to play Icarus, we've included a few cool things as part of our DIGITAL tier. 
Dex-Friendly Tower Resolution (for those may not have the physical capacity to stack dice, or to play online)
 An Oracle (So you can play Icarus with a standard deck of cards) 

Additional products you can add to your pledge and enhance your playing experience:

Delivery
Development: Icarus is currently done development wise, all that is left is to put it into layout. The final stage is to receive dice from our manufacturers to test their stackability (technical term), and balance the gameplay accordingly.
Art: We have about 10 pieces of art completed. We're looking to have another 5-8 pieces finished before the book goes to print. Right now we're on schedule to make that happen.
Digital 
We will be using DTRPG to do all of our Digital Fulfillment, as well as provide our International Customers with Print and Play documents (as well as Print on Demand options, if people are interested).
The best place for Digital RPGs!
Shipping
For this project, we will be charging shipping as we fulfill each item. YOUR PLEDGE DOES NOT INCLUDE THE COST OF SHIPPING. 
We will be using a pledge manager to collect information from backers.

Domestic Shipping: For traditional USPS shipping, we expect to charge $5-8 per package through our warehouse. If you’d like to get your package more quickly, we’ll have new upgrade options to USPS Priority, UPS, etc. 
EU/AU/CA Shipping: We will be working with our fulfillment partners in the US to ship via E-packet. Currently, we are exploring partnerships in the European Union, Australia, and Canada to ship books to backers with a minimum of fees. Typically, the cost to ship a package is $10-15.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have run several Kickstarters at this stage in our career. The game is fully developed, and will be shipping to print in April. During our last major project, we had delays in delivery - which has now been ironed out.

We have fulfillment centers lined up in both US UK, CA and AU - and we'll be limiting our delivery to these 4 countries. Our desire to "Deliver to the entire world" in the past has severly hampered our ability to deliver. As a result - we'll be focusing on these 4 countries only.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

CA Fulfillment Update
Hello Canadian backers, this update addresses the lack of Canadian fulfillment and outlines our plans going forward.
What Happened
Due to a lost shipment of wooden components for Icarus, Canadian fulfillment has not occurred. This is due to our CA fulfillment partner’s practice of performing all fulfillment at once. So with a package missing, nothing has shipped.
In our last check-in, we had hoped the package of wooden components was still inside our US fulfillment partner’s warehouse, having been trapped there by an adjacent hurricane. In the time since, our US fulfillment partner has assured us that the package is out in the world. Having given ourselves time to attempt to hunt down this package, we are now being forced to write it off as lost for good.

updates.update_content:
Extra Dice Update - A message from Icarus Designer, Ivan Van Norman:
“Hey Gang!
Some of you have reached out to let us know that only 10 dice are included in the 'add-on' pack, rather than the displayed 12 which we originally expressed on the Kickstarter. Good Eye! That was on purpose. Let me explain.

EU - Fulfillment Plan
Hello EU backers. As we addressed in a previous update, a number of Icarus components have been identified as children's toys by the EU and require special certification which they do not currently possess, making them illegal to ship in the EU. We are actively pursuing these certifications, but at this time we do not have an estimated date at which they will be attained. We are deeply sorry for this delay in your fulfillment.

Canadian Shipping: Imminent
In our last update we asked our Canadian backers to reach out if they had not received their backer rewards. It turned out none of you had.
We have reached out to our Canadian fulfillment partner and sorted out a brief stop in the process. Fulfillment should occur over the coming week. Thank you all for your swift feedback.

updates.update_userinfo: SHIPPING UPDATE #3 - Global Update, EU - Delayed
updates.update_content:
US Shipping: Delayed but Imminent
As you will have all noticed, we jumped the gun a bit about the status of US shipping! Long story short, a shipment of the “Extra Dice” product went rogue. Over the last week it was found, rerouted and it has been received by the US warehouse. US shipping now has everything that it needs to move forward and we are hoping to see orders going out in the next few days.

Greetings Citizens, we have a big shipping update! 

Shipping Begins : United States
All core components of Icarus have been received and the majority of Icarus shipping has been ordered within the United States. Most areas will have been delivered by the end of this week.

Attention Mainland EU Backers (all EU backers that are not in the UK) we have come to a conclusion regarding our ability to ship Icarus.
Those of you who have already attempted to upgrade to a physical copy will have noticed that there are no options for mainland EU shipping. We will be unable to provide a generic shipping solution to the mainland EU but are offering a work around. This is due to a lack of volume and tax complications of overseas shipping (as we are a US based company).

For those of you in the EU who are determined to have a physical copy of Icarus shipped to you: we are willing to sort out more individualized solutions involving shipping product directly from our warehouses off the European continent. Be aware when choosing to pursue this option that this may lead to a greater than expected cost of shipping. Please get in touch with us at if you are willing to pursue this option with us as we will be unable to process such action through Crowd Ox (their software does not allow for the flexibility required). We hope that everyone can get their hands on Icarus that is excited about it, and this is the solution that we are capable of providing on this project.

Greetings Citizens, we have important matters to discuss! 
First a reminder, then an update.
_____

campaign.story:
Treacherous Traps is an incredible resource for game masters who are looking to get more out of their dungeon design. The book contains two hundred and fifty pre-built traps ranging in level and severity so that you can always find the perfect trap for your party.
There is also a chapter containing a random trap generator written, in part, by the legendary Steve Winter. This chapter contains fifty trap triggers, and fifty trap effects that, when combined, create up to twenty-five hundred different combinations. 
Playtest Material
This small sample from the Random Trap Generator will give you an idea of what to expect from the final version of Treacherous Traps. Please download your copy from our website through the link below:
Treacherous Traps Playtest Material
Compatibility
Although the content in this book and collection of card decks is written for 5th Edition D&D, the trap concepts and mechanics can be easily adapted for use with other editions of D&D as well as other fantasy themed tabletop RPGs. 
Cover Mockup
Feast your eyes ladies and gentlemen. We've had the logo for some time now, but the cover has been hard to lock down. We wanted something that really put the viewer there with the party. They're in quite a dire situation, and it'll take all of their whits to make it out alive...
The Book
Treacherous Traps currently consists of 16 chapters:
1. The Philosophy of Traps - An introduction to traps and their use in fantasy RPGs: why you should use them, when you should use them, and how to keep them exciting!
2. How To Use Traps - A detailed look at how to best use traps in your adventures as well as instructions on how the pre-built traps in chapters 3-7 are structured.
3. Level 1-4 Traps - Traps appropriate for parties with characters level 1-4. 50 traps in total, a mixture of mundane, mechanical and magical. These range in 5 levels of severity from simple 'setbacks', to 'moderate', 'dangerous', 'life-threatening' and 'deadly'!
4. Level 5-8 Traps - Traps appropriate for parties with characters level 5-8. 50 traps in total, a mixture of mundane, mechanical and magical. These range in 5 levels of severity, as detailed above. Some may be upgraded version of traps found in the previous chapters.
5. Level 9-12 Traps - Traps appropriate for parties with characters level 9-12. 50 traps in total, a mixture of mundane, mechanical and magical. These range in 5 levels of severity, as detailed above. Some may be upgraded version of traps found in the previous chapters.
6. Level 13-16 Traps - Traps appropriate for parties with characters level 13-16. 50 traps in total, a mixture of mundane, mechanical and magical. These range in 5 levels of severity, as detailed above. Some may be upgraded version of traps found in the previous chapters.
7. Level 17-20 Traps - Traps appropriate for parties with characters level 17-20. 50 traps in total, a mixture of mundane, mechanical and magical. These range in 5 levels of severity, as detailed above. Some may be upgraded version of traps found in the previous chapters.
8. Complex Traps - This chapter consists of up to 25 complex traps which have multiple triggers, effects, or both. Many complex traps also reset after activation, so unless they are disabled or destroyed, they will continue to be dangerous.
9. Random Trap Generator - This chapter consists of 50 triggers and 50 effects. When combined, they create a random trap which is both interesting and challenging. With 2500 different combinations, and the partial brain-child of the legendary Steve Winter, this is truly an incredible resource for any Game Master!
10. Designing Your Own Traps - This chapter goes into detail on how to create your own traps using our unique methods.
11. Creating Trap-centric Dungeons - This chapter is focused on how to place your traps in the best possible locations within your dungeons for maximum results. It includes a random dungeon generator tool, as well as detailed diagrams on where best to place your traps.
12. Perplexing Puzzles - This chapter is all about puzzles. They can be big or small, simple or complex, but they are all challenging in their own way. They can even be paired with traps or trap effects to turn them from barriers into potentially deadly encounters.
13. Creating Puzzle-centric Dungeons - This chapter gives detailed instructions on how to create your own puzzles as well as how to integrate puzzles into your dungeon design.
14. Seductive Secrets - This chapter offers suggestions on how and when to use secrets in your adventures.
15. Ridiculous Riddles - This chapter includes a diverse selection of riddles designed to be used along side traps, puzzles, and secrets.
16. Player Options - This chapter contains a new player profession (The Trapsmith), as well as options for players designing and setting their own traps.
The Decks  
All of the decks that are associated with Treacherous Traps can be used with or without the book.
Level 1-4 Traps. This deck of 50 cards includes all of the traps from chapter 3 of Treacherous Traps.
Level 5-8 Traps. This deck of 50 cards includes all of the traps from chapter 4 of Treacherous Traps.
Level 9-12 Traps. This deck of 50 cards includes all of the traps from chapter 5 of Treacherous Traps.
Level 13-16 Traps. This deck of 50 cards includes all of the traps from chapter 6 of Treacherous Traps.
Level 17-20 Traps. This deck of 50 cards includes all of the traps from chapter 7 of Treacherous Traps.
Random Trap Generator. This deck of 100 cards is derived from chapter 9 of Treacherous Traps. It contains 50 trigger cards and 50 effect cards. A game master separates the two card types, shuffles them, and then draws 1 card from each stack. The combination of the trigger and the effect creates a random trap each time. This is a great resource for impromptu adventures as well as for game masters who want to be just as surprised as their players by what they find in the dungeon!
PDF Adventure Modules (Included for All Backers)
Dungeon of Doom - Treacherous Traps Compendium. The Treacherous Traps Compendium by Nord Games is designed to be a companion to the incredible Dungeon of Doom terrain line from Dwarven Forge! The Compendium offers a selection of alternative builds for each Dungeon of Doom encounter, along with a collection of unique traps, quest hooks, and suggested uses to cut down on prep time and keep the party on their toes with unspeakable dangers awaiting them around every turn!
Cover Mockup
Witch of the Wilderlands (Unlocked at $130,000). A once peaceful valley town is under siege. The forest to the east, once a beautiful enchanted place, has become blackened with disease and foul creatures. The townsfolk blame a witch who they cast out for her wicked ways, but what our heroes discover on their journey is far, far worse...
Crypt of the Crimson King (Unlocked at $140,000). A sacred order of zealots seeks out anyone who is willing to help them. The tomb in which their god-king is buried was invaded by an unwelcome spirit, and it has driven them out into the unforgiving mountains. In order to vanquish the foe, the heroes will have to delve deep into the catacombs and survive the many trials within. 
Stretch Goals
$10,000 (Unlocked) - 5 Complex Traps. We will add a new chapter to this already-epic book. It will give instructions on how to create complex traps as well as present 5 pre-built examples, one for each level range in the 'setback' category.
$15,000 (Unlocked) - 10 Complex Traps. We will add 5 more complex traps to the book, one for each level range in the 'moderate' category.
$20,000 (Unlocked) - 15 complex Traps. We will add 5 more complex traps to the book, one for each level range in the 'dangerous' category.
$25,000 (Unlocked) - 20 Complex Traps. We will add 5 more complex traps to the book, one for each level range in the 'life-threatening' category.
$30,000 (Unlocked) - 25 Complex Traps. We will add 5 more complex traps to the book, one for each level range in the 'deadly' category.
$35,000 (Unlocked) - Perplexing Puzzles. Who doesn't love a good puzzle? At this stretch goal we will add a new chapter to the book with 10 puzzles which you can use to challenge your players.
$40,000 (Unlocked) - More Puzzles. 10 more puzzles (for a total of 20) for even more options and versatility.
$45,000 (Unlocked) - Even More Puzzles. 10 More puzzles (for a total of 30) and you're just about set for the rest of your game mastering career!
$50,000 (Unlocked) - Creating Puzzle-centric Dungeons. Now that you have puzzles to play with, learn how best to use them in your dungeon layout and storytelling.
$55,000 (Unlocked) - Seductive Secrets. Traps and secrets go hand in hand. At this stretch goal we will add a new chapter all about secrets, when to use them, and how best to incorporate them into your games.
$60,000 (Unlocked) - Ridiculous Riddles. Who doesn't think of riddles when dealing with traps? This new chapter details the guidelines around creating riddles. You'll also get a variety of example riddles you can use in your game right away.
$70,000 (Unlocked) - Trap Schematics. At this stretch goal we will add schematic drawings of various traps. This will give you a very clear example of how the mechanisms work, and how best to place the traps within your environment.
$80,000 (Unlocked) - Pre-Built Dungeons. At this stretch goal we will add a new chapter with 5 pre-built dungeons complete with top down maps, quest hooks, and other intrigue.
$90,000 (Unlocked) - Player-centric Material. At this stretch goal we will add a new chapter full of player resources such as the Trapsmith profession, setting makeshift traps, recovering trap materials, and more!
$100,000 (Unlocked) - Traps by Environment. At this stretch goal we will expand chapter 10 to include traps beyond the traditional dungeon. This will include a section about race/monster specific traps. Why a particular monster type uses a particular style of trap, what materials they utilize from their environment, etc.
$110,000 (Unlocked) - NPCs and Hirelings. At this stretch goal we will add a new chapter to the book featuring generic NPCs and hirelings who are proficient with setting and disarming traps. A useful companion for those in need of a guide through a trapped dungeon!
$120,000 (Unlocked) - Trapsmith Legends. At this stretch goal we will add a collection of NPCs who are legendary for their skills around traps. Each of these NPCs comes with a unique backstory and full color artwork!
$130,000 (Unlocked) - Adventure Module #1. At this stretch goal we will publish a new variable difficulty adventure module with a dungeon designed around traps, puzzles, and secrets. This PDF module will be FREE to all backers!
$140,000 (Unlocked) - Adventure Module #2. At this stretch goal we will publish another variable difficulty adventure module with a dungeon designed around traps, puzzles, and secrets. This PDF module will be FREE to all backers!
$150,000 (Unlocked) - More Artwork. At this stretch goal we will add more artwork to the book. This includes inspirational color artwork peppered throughout the book, more trap schematics, and even puzzle diagrams!
$150,001 And Above - Creative Team Bonuses. All funding over $150,000 will go toward bonuses for the creative team. Thank you so much for your support! Over funding like this really helps to reward our employees and speed up development of new products!
(Some stretch goals, such as added artwork, will add time to the estimated fulfillment date. We will post updates with more information on fulfillment dates as stretch goal material is completed.)
Add Ons  
If you're not seeing a pledge level that best suits your desire, such as a Hardcover copy of Treacherous Traps and 2 Trap Decks, you can simply pledge for the Hardcover and add the appropriate amount of money to you pledge to cover the extra items. In this example, you'd select the $40 pledge level to receive the Hardcover, then you'd add $24 to your pledge ($12 per deck) for a total of a $64 total pledge amount. You will then receive a Hardcover and your choice of 2 of the 5 50-card decks available during this campaign. You'll make your selection of which decks you'll receive through Backerkit once the campaign has ended.
$10 Treacherous Traps PDF - If you're the type of person who likes to hold fun gaming accessories like card decks in your hands, but you prefer to have your books in PDF form on your laptop or tablet, this is the perfect add on for you. 
$12 Level 1-4 Traps Deck - 50 trap cards designed to challenge players level 1-4 (not available to PDF Pledge Level Backers; you must be a backer at a physical pledge level to add on other physical products).
$12 Level 5-8 Traps Deck - 50 trap cards designed to challenge players level 5-8 (not available to PDF Pledge Level Backers; you must be a backer at a physical pledge level to add on other physical products).
$12 Level 9-12 Traps Deck - 50 trap cards designed to challenge players level 9-12 (not available to PDF Pledge Level Backers; you must be a backer at a physical pledge level to add on other physical products).
$12 Level 13-16 Traps Deck - 50 trap cards designed to challenge players level 13-16 (not available to PDF Pledge Level Backers; you must be a backer at a physical pledge level to add on other physical products).
$12 Level 17-20 Traps Deck - 50 trap cards designed to challenge players level 13-16 (not available to PDF Pledge Level Backers; you must be a backer at a physical pledge level to add on other physical products).
$16 Random Trap Generator Deck - 50 Trigger Cards, and 50 Effect cards create a 100 card deck with 2500 possible combinations (not available to PDF Pledge Level Backers; you must be a backer at a physical pledge level to add on other physical products).
$40 Treacherous Traps Hardcover - Get an extra hardcover for a friend, or as a collector's item, and save on shipping!
$100 Dog Might Deck Jacket - A beautifully crafted wooden box to hole all 6 of your decks. Pick between a Flame Birch or Demon's Blood finish, both with a laser engraved Treacherous Traps Logo. Check out more Dog Might products at dogmight.com!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Delays are often caused by stretch goals, which require additional content be written or additional artwork be commissioned. We have set our fulfillment dates based on the stretch goals we've stated from launch. If more stretch goals are added, we will declare a new fulfillment date if need be. Other delays may include problems with production and fulfillment but, as this is not our first Kickstarter project nor our first book project, we're confident in our reward fulfillment estimation.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

The decks arrived yesterday and the books came in today!
We will begin shipping Monday. Here are some pictures!

Hello everyone!
I am sure you are all anxious to receive your product as much as we are, so here is a quick update on that.
-Both books and decks made it to California safely.
-Due to the holiday there has been a back up at customs/docks.

Hello backers!
We have a received another update from the production company on when the product will arrive to our warehouse. I want to note a couple important details first:
1.  Due to the ongoing pandemic of COVID-19, there were unforeseen slow downs with production shipping our product to us. We were not made aware of this until it was finally on the ship.

updates.update_userinfo: Sometimes, No Change Can Be a Good Thing
updates.update_content:
Greetings intrepid gamers! I am here to give you a very quick update on the book(s) you are expecting. Our current timeline has not changed and we are expecting to get all three books(Settlements, Traps, and Dreaded Accursed) into our warehouse in about 2-3 weeks. At that point we will begin the task of shipping them all to you!
Apologies for any slow response times. A couple of us have returned, but in very small capacities(just a few hours a week, to keep the lights on).

Hello everyone! Megan here again. Thank you all for your patience as I’ve gotten this update to you a tad bit behind schedule. These past few weeks have been chaotic for Nord Games, to say the least, and we’re very grateful for your patience as we sort things out.
Shipping Update
As many of you know, California is one of the locations most fiercely affected by COVID-19 in the United States. Nord Games, which is based in California, is now under shelter-in-place orders for the foreseeable future.

campaign.story:
Black Oak Workshop is proud to present the Dragon d20! These d20s are designed to capture the essence of the five mighty chromatic dragons in all their glory. Each of the five dice features a unique swirled mix that captures the coloration of a specific dragon type and is inked with a bright color that represents its deadly breath weapon. The 20 result on the die features a dragon design that lets you know that you're bringing the pain to your foes!
Who doesn't love dragons? The awesome ranks of dragons are many: Malificent, Drogon, Rotgut, Spyro, Malystryx, Icingdeath, Singe, Smaug or the deadly Vermithrax...who's your favorite? Channel any of them with these killer d20s!
These are gorgeous dice!
To add to the treasure hoard, we've got some fantastic Kickstart Exclusives hand crafted by the fine folks at Dog Might Games and some stretch goals that we are very excited about (more Dragon d20s). Read on fearless adventurer!
Not Your Average d20
Here's what makes these dice special and why we believe they will hold a place of honor in your dice bag!
 Dragon Breath Swirl We're very proud of the coloration of the dice. They feature a blend of two colors with an iridescent glimmer that came out fantastic! We think they are super cool and the blending method perfectly captures the billowing dragon breath attack!
 Larger Size Like the majority of the dice we produce, these dice are larger and stand out on your game table. They tower over lesser dice and make them run for cover! Another upside to our larger size is they are easier to read.
 Draconic Design The design on the 20 face captures the power of the dragon and roars CRITICAL HIT! 
 Tiamat Special You can harness the power of the five most vile dragons in the lands - not just one or two of them. Once funded, All FIVE become available! The Tiamat reward level ensures you can get the whole set.
 Dragons in the Blood? If your character is born of the dragon, these will make the perfect d20 for you - roll in style!
 Dragons Awesome in their own right. Death from above!!
The majority of our dice are scaled to a larger 19mm d6 size. As a result, they stand out on the table and are easy to read. These d20s are no exception and they will intimidate and make other dice flee before them!
Reward Levels
So what's included with each reward level?
Dog Might Games Exclusive
We've partnered with Dog Might Games to present a special Dragon d20 exclusive for you. We asked Dog Might for a design that would pair well with the Dragon d20 and their team stepped up with a beautiful, custom version of their Dragon Sheath dice box for us. It came out fantastic! These boxes are utterly gorgeous and Dog Might's reputation for quality speaks for itself. These are exclusive to Black Oak Workshop's Dragon d20 project and will not be available again after the project has completed!
There are two variations of the boxes. We have a standard version in red and a higher end variant in beautiful padauk wood. Both share these great qualities:
Beautiful all wood design with protective finish
Exclusive dragon design
Embedded magnets keep the lid securely in place
Holds lots of dice - 8.5" x 2.25" x 2.0"
Dog Might Quality - they will last for many years!
You will find the boxes available as part of specific reward levels and they will also be available in the pledge manager so you can pick up additional boxes if you'd like. However, they will not be for sale on our website or as part of future projects so grab yours while you can. We cannot overstate how beautiful these boxes are!
Tiny Dungeons for Your Dragons
The fine folks over at Gallant Knight Games have worked with us on a few projects now and we are glad to see they are back again! Tiny Dungeons by Alan Bahr is a minimalist RPG that has been well received and comes highly rated - check it out here! Backers at the DRAGONS & DUNGEONS reward level will receive a DriveThruRPG link for a PDF download of the game which has an ever growing following of fans! It's a great game!
We wanted to include some cool stretch goals to help keep the excitement up and what would be better than more dragons?
$4,400 Chromatic Dragons & Tiamat Pin (funded) - UNLOCKED 
First and foremost, if we reach our funding goal ALL FIVE of the mighty chromatic dragons will be available! Individual d20s will also be available for purchase in the pledge manager ($5). In addition, every backer receiving rewards will get an exclusive Tiamat pin included with their loot!
$5,500 Tiamat Dice Bag - UNLOCKED
Following through with the Tiamat theme is the Tiamat Dice Bag. WE HIT THIS GOAL! Backers can expect one included with their shipment at no additional charge!
You can count on the following features with these awesome dice bags:
Same materials and exceptional quality as our previous dice bags
Light, but tough exterior
Smooth black satin interior
Stay-Tight drawstrings
Fully embroidered Tiamat design
Plenty of room for your dice hoard: 5"x 8"
$7,000 Faerie Dragon d20 - UNLOCKED
The Faerie Dragon isn't evil, but it is mischievous and that's good enough in our book! WE HIT THIS GOAL! Backers will receive a Faerie Dragon d20 included with their reward shipment! As with the chromatic dragons, these will also be available for individual purchase in the pledge manager.
$9,000 Dreaded Dracolich d20 - UNLOCKED
The undead embodiment of the evil dragon! WE HIT THIS GOAL! Backers will receive a Dracolich d20 included with their reward shipment! As with the chromatic dragons, these will also be available for individual purchase in the pledge manager.
$11,500 Red Dragon Pin - UNLOCKED
Another cool pin to put on your dice bag and this one will bring the fire breathing goodness! WE HIT THIS GOAL! Backers will receive one with their reward shipment! As with the the other stretch goal items, these will be available for individual purchase in the pledge manager.
$15,000 Red Dragon Dice Bag - UNLOCKED
Fire breathing dice storage! WE HIT THIS GOAL! Backers will receive one with their reward shipment! 
You can count on the following features with these awesome dice bags:
Same materials and exceptional quality as our previous dice bags
Light, but tough exterior
Smooth red satin interior
Stay-Tight drawstrings
Fully embroidered Red Dragon design
Plenty of room for your dice hoard: 5"x 8"
$22,000 Dragon d6 - UNLOCKED
We will take the draconic theme to a d6! WE HIT THIS GOAL! Backers will receive one d6 with their reward shipment!  The dice will be scaled to match the size of our Dragon d20, so the d6 will be 19mm across! All of the base chromatic dragon colors will be unlocked in the d6 and each backer will be able to choose one d6 of their color choice to be included with their reward shipment. Additional d6s will be available in the pledge manager.
$26,000 Dragon d6 Color Options - LOCKED
The remaining color options (Faerie and Dracolich) are unlocked and available to be chosen by backers as their free d6.
$30,000 Full RPG Set - LOCKED
We can take the draconic theme to a full set of RPG dice! The dice will be scaled to match the size of our Dragon d20, so they will be a sight to behold! Backers will participate in a vote to choose which dragon will receive the expanded RPG set. Glorious Tiamat level backers (and higher) will receive a full 7 die set IN ADDITION to their rewards. All other backers (Dragons with Advantage and Tiamat) will be able to buy a set for $15.
Any unlocked stretch goals will be available in the pledge manager as well, so don't worry - if you want more they will be on hand! The cost per dice bag will be $10, additional Dragon d20s and d6s will be $5 and the RPG set will be $15.
Dice Maniacs!
For all you dice lovers out there, Black Oak Workshop encourages you to  visit and join the Dice Maniacs Club on Facebook. It is a great place to share your collection, view some great dice, ask questions and enjoy  all things dice related! 
Shipping
All shipments will be processed through the United States Postal Service. Domestic (USA) orders will ship utilizing First-Class Service and international orders will ship utilizing First-Class Package International Service. All rewards will be packed securely in an effort  to minimize risk of damage during shipping.
For our International backers, we are adding a note that the shipping costs are reflective of  what the USPS charges us. We do not have overseas distribution and likely will not for some time as we are a small shop. As we grow, we hope to be able to get those costs down for you as we know they are  painful.
Thank you for checking out our project!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
If funded, our priority will be to meet or exceed backer expectations. We structure our Kickstart projects with a goal of minimizing risks and challenges in an effort to help build confidence in our backers:

* Straightforward design
* Visual representation of the final product
* Partner with an established production vendor
* Research and capture all costs
* Provide regular project status updates
* Communicate any issues as they arise

Given the successful fulfillment and positive backer feedback from our earlier projects, we are confident that we can and will meet our stated goals.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
