campaign.story:
Meet the Canitaurs — new unique race of dog centaurs in the most popular roleplay game. This project made by Punga Miniatures and The Deck of Many based on original arts by Nikita Orlov.
Here you will find more than 20 high-quality resin miniatures going with the set of special character cards and a booklet with all the setting information that you need to start playing. Part of the figures was able to order since spring 2018 and many of our customers highly rated the quality and sculpt level of miniatures.
Each Set includes 4 miniatures. We have 4 Sets of Canitaurs and 1 of Felitaurs:
Green Set «The Rogues Gallery»:
Shiba Bard
Chow-chow Brewmaster
Chihuahua Merchant
Greyhound Ranger 
Red Set «Mercs for Hirey»:
Pitbull Gladiator
Husky Barbarian
Akita Samurai
Pug Arbalist
Violet Set «Mystical and Arcane»:
Great Dane Wizard  
Poodle Warlock
Dachshund Inquisitor
St. Bernard Monk
Blue Set «Royal Defenders»:

Corgi Guard
Doberman Knight
Spaniel Admiral
German Shepherd Oprichnik
Emerald Set «The Felitaurs» is unlocked!
Maine Coon Pirate
Sphynx Alchemist
Black Oriental Assassin
Orange Tabby Fencer
The composition of each Set cannot be changed. If you want to order Canitaurs from different Sets not ordering the complete Set, you should add miniatures as add-ons.
If you backed a pledge of level 4 "EARLY BIRD — CANITAUR KINGDOM" or level 5 "EARLY BIRD CANITAUR KINGDOM", then you do not have to pay for delivery. In to add felitaurs set just increase your pledge on 35 euros.
In this project, we have done a lot of work and made more than 20 great miniatures of Canitaurs, so that each player can choose a character for himself.
Each Canitaur has its own pre-generated class, cards with parameters, special skills, and a short background.
You can choose Corgi, a brave and honest guard, or Pitbull, a brutal and strong warrior, a Greyhound, nimble and fast ranger or Chihuahua, an intelligent and little merchant. Choose your heroes!
Our miniatures are cast by hand using silicone molds and pressure chambers. The material of the miniatures is the high-quality resin. Manual work and expensive materials allow us to make miniatures more detailed and qualitative in comparison with usual miniatures from PVC.
Miniatures are divided on average into 3 parts, all miniatures are sent not assembled, you need to use glue for assembly (except the painted models). But we use to convenience connections, so miniatures are easy to assemble.
Canitaurs like different breeds of dogs have different sizes, from 28 mm to 58 mm. Exact dimensions can be found in the FAQ. 
 Feeling odd about creatures with six paws? That's OK, we have a solution for you! These miniatures are sculpted also in four-paws versions — just detach the backside and get the adorable humanoid dog of your favorite breed:
Corgi Guard
Pitbull Gladiator
Chihuahua Merchant
Greyhound Ranger
Pug Arbalist
Shiba Bard
Akita Samurai
Husky Barbarian
Canitaur Samoed
Canitaur Witcher
Maine Coon Pirate
Canitaur Hyena
Bulldog Butch
So the Red Set backers will get the full human-like "Mercs for Hirey" team!
The Deck of Many: Canitaurs has everything you need to start playing DnD in the world of the Canitaurs, whether you want to explore their world or introduce them into yours! A booklet contains all the setting information and mechanics you need to create Canitaur player characters! It also contains a set of reference cards that include many new Canitaur and Felitaur NPCs and Monsters, including full stat blocks and beautiful illustrations.  
Here's what you can expect from one of our cards:  
Tarot Card Sized (70mm x 120mm)  
330 GSM
White Core Linen Stock Paper 
UV Coated 
Water Resistant 
Deck includes: 
Booklet with setting information and mechanics 
25+ Reference cards
All sorts of adventures might await you when you travel amongst the Canitaurs - will you go on a high seas adventure? Hunt in the woods with the greyhound rangers? The Deck of Many: Canitaurs has all these options - and more!
Want some more cool stuff? You can customize your support with additional miniatures, holders and other.
The Legendary Sword of Sir Good Boy
According to the legend of the Canitaurs. When the kingdom of Canitaurs will be in danger, will come warrior who pulls out from the rock "The legendary sword of the Good Boy" and he will be called the "Sir Good Boy". This add-on is obtained free of charge by anyone who has bought any set before the start of the campaign. 
Painting of miniature
You can get miniature painted by Ruslan Nigmatullin, talented artist painting miniatures for 3 years, participated in various exhibitions, took prizes. Loves walking with his dog and to revise the Lord of the Rings.
In this case, the miniature will be sent assembled.
Whale Troll
Big Guy was the most popular miniature in our previous campaign, so we decided to make him as an add-on with the Canitaurs!
Snowy
During the pre-sale of Canitaurs we received mail with a very sentimental story:
This story touched our hearts so hard so we decided to create another Canitaur for Snowy. Now Snowy is passed away. Many of us have lost our little friends, so her miniature will help to memorialize it. 
 Canitaur Witcher
Bipedal option is available
 Canitaur Samoyed
Sharp harpoon but the kind heart and warm smile…Adorable breed! We made this character with reference to the history of this breed. Samoyeds were originally used for hunting, herding reindeer, and hauling sleds for the Samoyede people in Siberia. Thanks for the art to Pavel Lyapustin! Soon we create this good boy miniature!
Canitaur Samoyed
 Bulldog Butch
Bulldog Butch
Kickstarter is the world's largest funding platform for creative projects. A person who supports a project is called a "backer". The process of giving money to this project is called a "pledge". Here you can find 6 levels of pledge. 
In return for your pledge, we (the creators of the campaign) are able to offer "rewards", depending on the amount you pledge.  
You can become a backer in just three easy steps:
 Got questions? Join our Discord and chat with us!
Somewhere in the great multiverse, you may find a world, quite different from our own. This is a world where animals have become sentient and established great civilizations and amazing cultures. There is a place for religion, economy, art, politics and even war. In this world, we find the Kingdom of Hundalia.  
Hundalia is unlike any place you have ever seen. At first, you might notice the cozy small villages, the lush forests or the wide-spread farmlands. Some aspects of this kingdom may seem familiar at first, however, you won't find many humans amongst the Hunds. 
As you traverse the more populated areas, you will meet many canine-like creatures walking upright amongst the streets and fields. These are the Canitaur. Canitaurs are friendly, hard-working and down-to-earth folk. They enjoy little more than spending time with friends and family and meeting new people. If you are friendly and trustworthy to them, you could easily make a friend for life.
Hundalians are a proud people. They value loyalty and honesty very highly and this translates to their normal lives as well. A Canitaur would not lie (unless in a life-threatening situation) and takes it as a given that others would not lie to them. Because of this, trust is high amongst the Canitaur and people speak openly and know what to expect from each other.
 After the first Canitaurs arts posted, many pet owners have written that they want to see their little friends as Canitaurs heroes. And we understand them! We conducted an honest poll about what breeds are added to Canitaurs, more than 100 people voted, and the most 5 popular options we added to Canitaur world.
 At the moment we already have this list of breeds: Corgi, Pitbull, Chihuahua, Doberman, Greyhound, Husky, Chow-chow, Shiba-Inu, Poodle, Spaniel, Pug, Great Dane, Dachshund, German Shepherd, Saint Bernard, Akita-Inu.  
Unfortunately, we can not create Canitaurs of all breeds. But for who want to create their own Canitaur or Felitaur, we give this opportunity and make the limited reward "The Creator".    
We will create a Canitaur with your choice for the breed/class and character name.
Note! The miniature will be made in a SINGLE copy, all rights to the artworks and miniatures belong to backer. 
In addition, we will start another survey, in which the most popular breed will be added to the campaign as an addon and is available to all backers.
The first poll will end on November 16th. Choose a new Canitaur hero! Poll link.
This project could never exist without artist Nikita Orlov who created the set of Battledoge characters last autumn. The conception of half dogs-half centaurs literally blew up the Internet and got sight by our studio (Punga Miniatures) and then The Deck of Many. We suggested to sculpt Canitaurs (because we love awesome concepts) and Nikita couldn't refuse. After that, The Deck of Many (who loves awesome concepts too) came up with the idea of turning our doges to DnD race.  
Workflow
 But what about Cats? We have them! Meet the chaotic Felitaurs — not necessarily cruel or evil, but very cunning feline creatures with all kinds of plots of their own. Also we plan to create miniatures of Monsters and Gods.
Once all 4 Felitaur Strech Goals are unlocked, they will be available to order as 5th Set — Emerald.
 Social Stretch Goal
To unlock The Chaos Cat — Felitaur God — you need only to Share and Like this post. When we'll reach 300 Share & Likes this stretch goal will be unlocked and be available to order. Also, it will be added for free to rewards level 4 and 5!
We ship to all the world. Shipping costs vary depending on your location and pledge levels/add-ons. Please calculate your shipping value according to the table below: 
We plan to start sending packages in February 2019. The last estimated delivery date for the project is June 2019. Depending on the number of orders received for the project, delivery dates might vary, but we plan to send packages according to the order of backers, We ship packages using Russian Post. 
Punga Miniatures
Punga Miniatures was created by several friends from Russia and Germany. From the very beginning, we really liked unusual concepts, so we created our first big project by our original concept Savage orcs inspired Polynesian culture. After the successful launch of this project, we have greatly improved our production, and also started working in 3D and increased the team.
Now the studio has many talented people, sculptors, artists, animators, and mold casters. We continue to look for interesting concepts and realize them.

This campaign has a low level of risk since its work is Punga Miniatures in collaboration with The Deck of Many. As you can see on the campaign page, almost all models are ready. Both we and our partners have previous successful Kickstarter projects. 

We made conclusions from our previous Kickstarter and pre-sale of Canitaurs miniatures, so we will resculpt problem details of some models which were too fragile, and improve box quality. 

We estimated end of shipping in June 2019, but please understand, this is only an estimate. Due to global logistics, cargo delivery ideas, some regions may receive their commitments ahead of others.

campaign.story:
In 2015, after a long spell of unemployment, my wife and I hit on the idea of a dedicated RPG online shop selling our wooden wares—including dice boxes, DM screens, and much more. As an avid player myself, I knew how difficult it was to find different products. And with a carpentry background I guess it was inevitable my two passions would combine.
Painted by Rising Sun Painting Studios
The enthusiasm and love that people had for my products only acted as an incentive to source or manufacture more ideas. My wife’s educational background is in animal science and welfare, so in the same way that gaming and carpentry had collided for me…her loves collided to inspire the launch of our original Critit ‘Spirit Of’ dice line, the Kickstarter campaign that started us on this path.
Painted by Rising Sun Painting Studios
But we couldn’t stop there…wanting to bring more of our creativity to all the awesome gamers out there, we hit upon the idea of the animal companion miniatures line when a good friend asked for help making a specialized cheetah miniature for a gaming session. We decided we needed to produce a whole line of miniatures which were totally dedicated to our beloved companions and familiars, and to make them purposefully for use in RPG gaming.
Ok…..so we had this idea over 2 years ago. “What took you so long?” I hear you cry….well…………
Putting together a range of miniatures is a WHOLE different ball game to dice, and as novices in this field, we don’t mind admitting we made a lot of mistakes!
Painted by Rising Sun Painting Studios
In our head it seemed pretty simple….. Hire a sculptor, get the files, get prototypes made and painted, get pricing, and voila. Yeah, that didn’t happen quite so easily!
Our first mistake was using a sculptor which didn’t specialize in miniatures. It’s a minefield and very specialist and requires an amazing talent. Our second mistake was using a prototyping company which didn’t have any experience in miniatures. I don’t even want to tell you how many times we adjusted the files and re-printed the rhino - big ones, little ones, ones with wonky legs……
Our animals along side 28mm Hero Forge models
We were close to putting a lid on the whole project. It is only due to the kindness and support of Daniel Melendez of Questron (they have produced a whole range of amazing miniatures for lots of well-known games) ( https://www.facebook.com/Questron-441242259255914/ ) that the project is going ahead now. He and his team did an amazing job of working with us and bringing to life what we had first envisioned. We now no longer have a horse with a cone on is head, but instead an amazing unicorn 😊
Our previous cone headed mule along with the amazing unicorn!
On the plus side, this means we can now confidently bring you a range that we know will be fantastic, as a company we never launch a project with just digital renders, only physical prototypes we can hold in our hand so we know we are ready to go, without the worries that any adjustments or major redesign may cause 😊
Just the right scale for your Pathfinder & Dungeons and Dragons 5e Campaigns
All Unlocked!
Your Core Box will Initially include a set of 10 companions with the possibility of adding 14 more if we can unlock them along the way!
When we started this journey making miniatures one of the main things we were most stunned about was the cost of moulds. To be able to unlock all the animals so we can offer you the whole set of 24 animals at this amazing price we need to cover the cost of the mould and buy bulk. By sharing and helping us let others know about this project, the more animals we can offer in your core box. Help us shout it from the rooftops :-)
Sculpt may be subject to slight change
We currently have 24 companions ready to go, all based on real life animals and the mythical companions I see in my dreams, The team did a great job of adding lots of detail to the models and making them as realistic as possible.
These Miniatures all come unpainted and are made from grey quality PVC plastic. They will be injection molded to ensure the highest possible detail.
The models are all based on actual DND 5e and Pathfinder size categories so no more quibbles about your companions reach and space requirements :-)
In order to make sure production runs as planned and all molds can viably be made this is an Add-On option only and must be purchased in conjunction with the core box pledge.
Add on this amazing t-rex to your existing pledge!
You have all already come up with some amazing suggestions and ideas. We want to do them all! For us to produce a line of animal companion and familiars which not only vary in size but also in style and stance would be amazing. This is just the start of our miniatures journey, and we are so looking forward to the next steps with you all
Shipping will be charged later in the pledge manager.
NO MORE THAN £6 FOR UK BACKERS
NO MORE THAN £12 FOR EU BACKERS
NO MORE THAN £16 FOR OTHER INTERNATIONAL BACKERS
We can promise we are going to investigate alternative shipping options and will make sure we get you the lowest most reliable service available.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have successfully fulfilled many other Kickstarters a few of which were actually early! As a company we always try to pre-empt any possible delays and plan in time buffers as a contingency. We always work with physical prototypes to ensure we have removed the risk of any large scale delays and so can get your miniatures to you as soon as possible for fun and games on the table. 

Here at Critit we always want to involve our backers in our project and consider your input and ideas invaluable to helping us develop a range which works well for your needs. We promise to always have great communication with you all and always here via message should you have any concerns :-)
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
N3 Art has teamed up with Deep Water Games to expand our catalog of original art gaming accessories to official game licenses. We're proud to bring you the first piece in this line: The Official Hanamikoji Playmat.
This is a prototype, art is not final and mat can be improved via stretch goals.
N3 Art is an art and design studio founded by Nolan Nasser, the CEO of Deep Water Games. The "Hanamikoji Playmat" is the first in a line of officially licensed gaming accessories from games and artists you love.  This art is original work by Maisherly Chan, of EmperorS4 Games and the design is done by Nolan Nasser.
More than Just a playmat
"Hanamikoji is one of my all time favorite games to introduce new gamers to. It's not just brilliantly tense decisions you have to make, it's those fantastic mechanisms all working together in a shell and covered in gorgeous artwork. That's why it makes a great Playmat" 
-Nolan
Hanamikoji is a brilliant game from EmperorS4, published in North America by Deep Water Games. If you're unfamiliar with Hanamikoji it's Strategic card game that's a battle of wits for 2 players. 
It takes two minutes to learn and ten minutes to play
More depth than any other game in its category
Hours of entertainment because of ease of play
Players compete for the favor of the Master Geishas by playing the item cards they require. However the game sports a unique mechanic for playing cards where you take actions to create sets of cards that your opponent then gets to choose who plays what cards in that set.
Playthrough:
Shipping
We're keeping shipping simple. We mainly serve the North American Market, so we're offering free domestic shipping!
International shipping will be calculated after the campaign in BackerKit!
Thank you so much for your support!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've been producing playmats and gaming accessories for years so I've got the main logistics down to a science however there's always unforseen circumstances. The biggest risk we face is a minor delay in delivery due to demand being really high or materials for printing being out of stock. Otherwise everything will be coming from inside the US which helps accelerate timelines.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Drinks & Daggers is a cooperative drinking card game set in the world of the podcast Drunks and Dragons. Step into the shoes of Aludra, Harper, Jaela, Thom (and hopefully some other heroes), as they take on some of Drunkeros' biggest villains. 
The game is for 2-4 players, and takes 20 - 30 minutes to play. It is very easy to learn, even if you have had a few. The combination of heroes and bosses will make every game play differently, and give the game a lot of replayability. There is also a surprising amount of depth in the strategies you can use to take on the bosses. 
At the core, we wanted to make a game that would be fun for anyone - you don't need to drink or listen to Drunks and Dragons to enjoy Drinks & Daggers!
 We've been Funded! In a scant 3.5 hours, we've made enough to fund the project!  There are still a ton of amazing stretch goals to hit, so we're not stopping this train until we unlock the next possible playable characters and bosses. Help us get there by spreading word to your friends and family about Drinks & Daggers!
Here is what a typical round of Drinks & Daggers looks like:
1) Draw a card from the boss deck, it might be an attack that directly damages the active player like Tail Sweep, or a minion that will hang around and protect the boss until you defeat him, like a Kobold.
*card text not final
2) Depending on what happens, all players can now play reaction cards like Drink in the Face or Battle Lust. Some cards will be able to combo off of each other, leading to even more reactions!   
*card text not final
3) The active player can now play an Action card like Lightning Bolt to directly attack the enemies or help in some other way, or play an Item card like Blooddrinker that will stay in play, and boost their abilities until it is canceled out.  
*card text not final
4) The active player then draw cards until you have a full hand, and it is on to the next player!
Once you have gotten the Villain's hit points to zero, you win! Be careful though, if your hit points go too low, your character will become "smashed" - you get a fresh set of hit points and new powers to reflect your smashed state of being. If you drop to zero hit points when smashed, you are down, and one of your team mates will need to heal you to get back in the game. Think of it as a revivify that actually works. If everyone is down, then the villain wins! The heroes end up in a tavern putting themselves back together, and the players might need to pull themselves together as well, depending on how many drinks they dealt* over the course of the game. 
*drinking is not required to enjoy this game, and if you do, please drink responsibly
Characters
Aludra Wyrmsbane
Aludra is the heart and soul of the team. Her strength and toughness are a great anchor, and thanks to her dwarven armor, she is the hardest hero to kill.   
*card text not final
Titus Harper
Harper is the team's hot blooded leader. His magic and Haste scroll will have him cycling through cards and dealing a shocking amount of damage. 
*card text not final
Thom Vidalis
Thom is wild and unpredictable. Sometimes he gets a little over zealous and hurts everyone on the battlefield - including his friends. His sword Blooddrinker is the most coveted item in the realm.  
*card text not final
Jaela
Jaela is a warrior-angel sent from the Gods to save the world. In Jaela's hands, her mighty halberd can do more damage in a single stroke than any other weapon in the game. 
*card text not final
Bosses
Pyre
Pyre, the iconic, ruby-devouring red dragon of Drunkeros is your main adversary. He is a well-rounded boss with plenty attacks to keep you on your toes. Players will need to maintain a balance between healing and dealing out damage to his many kobold minions that shield him against damage. 
*card text not final
Bercy Hamhands
Take on a new challenger with the ham-fisted, orcish knuckle-puncher, Bercy Hamhands. Bercy is ring-worn which means players will need to pass a certain threshold of damage output before dropping Bercy's hit points. 
*card text not final
Rewards
Name read in the thank you video
Marvel as Michael tries to pronounce your name in this thank you video posted to the GeeklyInc YouTube page. He will read each name - all with no edits - so you can really watch him struggle.
Drinks & Daggers - The actual game!
A physical copy of the game! All four hero decks, both villain decks, and up to six additional stretch goal decks! Plus, we will include an instruction manual (very kind of us), and tokens to track hit points and drinks (in case you don't want to actually imbibe). Stretch goal upgrades include a molded insert and hit point dials instead of tokens.
Pint Glass
Have a nice frosty drink in your very own pint glass. 
*this is a mock up, design may change
Coaster/Bottle Opener
Not since the spork has something been both so versatile and so useful.
*this is a mock up, design may change
Custom Playmat
These playmats will make gaming even easier, and they look cool!
*this is a mock up, design may change
Koozie
The GeeklyInc charter clearly states that whenever we make stuff, we have to make a koozie. Tim won't budge on this one.
*this is a mock up, design may change
T-shirt
Available in unisex, women’s, unisex tank top, and women’s tank top. Perfect for job interviews, first dates, and weddings. 
*this is a mock up, design may change
Premium Edition of Drinks & Daggers
An upgraded version of Drinks & Daggers in a custom, hardwood box created by Dryad Gaming (we will also send you the regular box as well). The box is made using half inch Birch in Dryad Gaming's Northwest Arkansas workshop. The Birch is sustainably grown and harvested in the Northeastern United States. The game's keyart will be engraved on the lid via frickin' laser.  The interior will be roomier than the standard box. If we get a chance to make even more cards, you will have room for them! In addition, you'll also get exclusive foil cards of all playable characters! This premium edition is currently only planned to be available through the Kickstarter campaign, so there is a chance that this will be your only chance to get this version.
A session of D&D online with Michael & Carly
Supporters at this tier will get to play a session of Dungeons & Dragons with Carly and Michael! We will write a new one-off scenario set in the universe of Drunks and Dragons and play over Google Hangouts with the option to broadcast live on Twitch if all players are comfortable with it. You can be sure you will be running into plenty of beloved NPCs! 
Your Likeness in the Game
Our amazing artist Bridgit Connell will put your likeness on a card in the game - be immortalized by having Jaela throw a drink in your face or Thom choke you out with a dog sausage! It will be a background character of Bridgit's choosing in one of the various character decks. 
Play DnD with Drunks & Dragons 
Michael will run a special one-off session of D&D with some of the cast members of Drunks and Dragons…and you! The game will be set in Drunkeros and be full of both PCs and NPCs you know and love.
Original Line Art
You can be the proud owner of some of Bridgit Connell's original line art from the game. There are 3 sets of original artwork available, each set containing hand-drawn pieces from all decks including: Aludra/Jaela, Harper/Toby, or Thom/Roz. This tier also includes having your likeness in the game, and you will get that art as well!
Drink Steins 
We are going to commission a set of custom drinking steins if you and a friend want to go full viking for a round of gaming. We are still working on this one, but you can be sure it will be rad as cuss!
DM Creative Consultation 
Sit down with Michael and Carly and pick their brains about any dang thing you like! Would you like us to help you do some world building? How about fleshing out a character or some NPCs? We’d also be happy to give you the low down on how to start your own podcast, or promote your show! 
Reward Tiers
Now that you have seen the rewards close up, let's break them down into which go into which tier!
Stretch goals:
UNLOCKED - 30k - New Character Addition - Roz
If we meet this level we will have the budget to include a new playable character to the base game - Everyone's favorite backstabbing, French Canadian pirate! As the captain of the merchant ship, The Chum Guzzler, Roz is adept at navigating the high seas as well as sewing chaos with her sneaky deck. With the ability to put her own cards into the boss deck, she can negate boss abilities and deal damage at the same time.  
*card text not final
UNLOCKED - 35k - New Playable Character - Toby Treacletart
If we meet this level we will have the budget to include a new playable character to the base game - Everyone's favorite hyper-intelligent gnome! Toby's deck has a powerful minion in the form of his trusty raven, Arlington which allows him to rearrange the boss deck to player's advantage.  
*card text not final
UNLOCKED - 40k - Hard mode for Pyre and Bercy
For those looking for an extra challenge, at this level we will be able to spend the time balancing and testing the game to include an optional, additional ruleset, and a second set of boss stats that will make all bosses pack a harder punch to give you a run for your money!
UNLOCKED - 50k - Upgraded Pieces
Removable inserts to keep pieces organized. Dials to track hit points instead of number tokens. This will help players, who may or may not be feeling a bit tipsy, keep track of their HP without worrying about smaller pieces to keep track of. 
UNLOCKED - 60k - Art Prints
Full-color art prints of the four main characters will be added to each order! Hurrah!
UNLOCKED - 70k - New Villain - Trant Thumble
If we meet this level we will have the budget to include an additional boss character as a bonus for all backers who have purchased the base game - Trant is a maniacal dictator from the early days of Drunks & Dragons, and if we reach this stretch goal you'll have a chance to meet him and his many "children"! Trant's deck is full of powerful minions, so you'll need to mix-up tactics in order to take him down! This bonus deck will be available in a separate pack after the kickstarter.
80k - New Playable Character - Lahni Caplan
Take a swig of ferret wine, because if we meet this level we will have the budget to include a new playable character as a bonus for all backers who have purchased the base game - Everyone's favorite speedy monk! Though her fists don't hit as hard as the others, the speed in which she throws them knocks bosses on their rumps. Lahni is built as a combo-breaking machine who's cards can be played back-to-back for a flurry of damage. This bonus deck will be available in a separate pack after the kickstarter.
90k - New Playable Character - Luccan
If we meet this level we will have the budget to include a new playable character as a bonus for all backers who have purchased  the base game - Everyone's favorite cuss-mouthed Elf! While Luccan is an elven ranger, his true power lies with the string of expletives he can deliver to lower Boss-morale! Luccan's sailor's mouth will see him de-buff boss powers and help protect his teammates. This bonus deck will be available in a separate pack after the kickstarter.
100k - New Playable Character - Bananas Foster, because good god we hope we never get to this point... (Prove us wrong!)
If we meet this level we will have the budget to include a new character (whether he is a boss or a playable character is yet to be determined, as you may have guessed by the mercurial and sometimes adversarial nature of this character) as a bonus for all backers who have purchased  the base game - Alright, fine. We get to this level and you can have Bananas Foster. ARE YOU HAPPY FOR WHAT YOU'VE REDUCED US TO?! This bonus deck will be available in a separate pack after the kickstarter.
Shipping and Fullfillment
Shipping for the base game is $5 in the US, and we are happy to ship internationally, but it costs a bit more. Domestic shipping for the "Brew-Ha-Ha" and above tiers is free. We believe we can have everything shipped out by August of 2019, but unforeseen delays can always happen. If it looks like there will be any delays, we will let you know. We will be shipping breakable materials in some packages, and we will do our best to replace anything that gets damaged in transit.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While this is our first game, we are working closely with industry veterans to make sure we don't run into any major roadblocks. We are also working with a manufacturer that specializes in creating board and card games, so you can assume the production will be top notch. Our greatest concern is the schedule. We have a huge amount of art to produce, and then the whole process of manufacturing and shipping the game. We have built in several months of extra room, so hopefully we won't deliver the game later than expected.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Whether you’ve been role-playing for years or you're just now learning about this amazing hobby, Cardography is certain to enhance your adventures.
We have created 3 new unique Cardography dungeon decks, along with our first two initial decks, set in the original world of Revilo. Contained in each of the themed decks are 52 dungeon cards that can be configured in countless ways.
Each deck has downloadable pdfs of full adventure modules for both 5e and Fate with new, never before seen monsters, magic items, and NPCs to help add more flavor to your game. 
Best of all, each of the pdfs is converted for these major RPG systems: Fate and D&D 5th Edition.
The modules can be played in their entirety or as a choose-your-own-adventure style dungeon crawl.
We have already successfully created and produced the first two decks Enter the Fiery Pits and Break Through the Icy Divide. We know what it takes to make them awesome and we are doing the same to the three new decks.
 Playing Break Through the Icy Divide
Want more than one item? Pledge for the highest level you want, then add on the cost of the additional items to your pledge. Once this is all wrapped up you will receive a survey to let us know which items you want mailed to your door.
The physical decks are waiting on final art files and will be finished before the campaign ends. Once funded we will send over the final files to the printer to get a physical proof made. Once approved the full production will begin! The modules are currently being worked on and pdfs will be released as soon as they are ready. These may take up to the delivery of the decks. Creating these modules takes some serious work, luckily the first two in the series are done and the following three are coming along well. 
Cardography is the brainchild of a great relationship that forged between Norse Foundry and Creature Curation. When we met over dinner at DragonCon many years ago, we quickly realized that with our combined talents we could create amazing experiences for our friends and for roleplayers everywhere. Cardography is not our first collaboration, and it will definitely not be our last! Our partnership utilizes the best aspects of each company’s resources to produce a superior product. We’ve brought together Creature Curations’ ability to design and create unique content, creatures, and quests with Norse Foundry’s many years of industry and manufacturing experience, and a combined art team to develop a unique product and design.
All shipping will be calculated and charged separately through the pledge manager option after the campaign is over. All products will ship at the same time. If you should have any question about products and locations please private message us for more information.
Survey and shipping collected through BackerKit
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As always, manufacturing and unforeseen delays, tariffs, zombie apocalypses, orc raids and acts of god can occur. We promise to be upfront about any issues that we face. We have produced two sets of Cardography on a deadline for distribution, and we were able to hit these deadlines on time. We used these timelines to help establish our Kickstarter timelines, adding a bit of padding for delays, large quantity of shipping, etc. All of these modules are being written and developed by Norse Foundry and Creature Curation. Unlike past Kickstarters Norse Foundry is more than just the publisher. We have completed and playtested the module, rules, items, etc. before launching to prevent any potential art delays or module issues. Since these modules are “living” documents (not bound books) we can release the originals and make unforeseen changes if needed, which will allow instant updates. All of the resources from Norse Foundry and Creature Curation will be focused on this Kickstarter before we start any other campaigns. You can view our previous collaborative, as well as our individual Kickstarter campaigns. We provide useful updates, and feel the comments have built a community from the experience. We would love for you to join our community through Cardography, and become a part of this journey with us!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hello trusty backers!
SHIPPING UPDATE
Canada – Products have arrived and will begin shipping this week, they should finish shipping next week.

Hello trusty backers!
If you have any issues with your order please email info@norsefoundry.com and we will make sure to get it taken care of.
We wanted to give you a quick status update:
UK & EU – Shipment is still in transit to Spiral Galaxy for Fulfillment (supposed to arrive to port on the 25th)

Missing US Shipments
As many of you know, we ran into a complication with shipping the first wave to US backers of the initial decks. After working with BackerKit and Shipstation we know what happened. It was something that we just wouldn't know to look for until we experienced it. Apparently Shipstation doesn't automatically show orders that are older than 180 days. A bunch of the orders were completed in Backerkit just a few days before that. So when we went to print out all the orders we didn't see a bunch of them. Luckily it was an easy fix and all of the orders that were supposed to ship originally should be in the mail by the end of the week!

Hello trusty backers!
We sent out a bunch of shipments to US-based backers, but apparently it wasn't all of the orders that should have gone out. 
Something went wrong when porting orders from Backerkit to Shipstation (our shipping software). We are working with both of those companies to try and resolve what happened and then ship out the orders that did not make it out of the warehouse.

Hey everyone!
Team lead here. First off we’d like to apologize for the radio silence from HeartBeat Dice in the last couple of weeks. While focusing on getting the remaining dice packed and shipped, we received some hurtful backlash and remarks from some folks who were not LGBTQA friendly and and also had employees take a leave to the nature of these comments.
We at HeartBeat Dice strive to support any and all LGBTQA organizations and charities, now and in the future and have taken the correct steps to ensure we deal with these negative comments accordingly, however this is no excuse for our late shipping and we apologize profusely for the delay.

Hey folks! We started shipping last week and I’m sure you’ve seen a few people getting their dice already WITHOUT getting tracking numbers and we’re having a little trouble with the stamps shipping software we use integrating with the Kickstarter file.
While we try and fix it we’re still shipping out dice day after day!
We are shipping domestic and international orders together and once we receive the last of the Dog Might Diceboxes we’ll immediately ship those too.

Our first wave of HeartBeat Dice are leaving our warehouse and heading to your mailbox! We apologize again for the delay caused by Chinese New Year and our small warehouse team but Mocha here is sure you’ll love your dice!
For those of you who missed our Kickstarter we plan to have our Pride Dice available at the end of the month for purchase. If you have any questions comments or concerns please do not hesitate to message us!

Hello all your night owls! The last of our quality control JUST finished a few hours ago and tomorrow morning we start to pack orders for shipping!
Between getting these State-side before Chinese New Year and moving into a warehouse for shipping we got put a smidge behind schedule but we’re all positive you’ll love the finished product! ❤️🧡💛💚💙💜

Huzzah!
Our HeartBeat Dice have officially been picked up from port and are on their way to our warehouse to be checked and sent to their new homes!
Between customs and overseas travel on freighters our hopes for the Christmas delivery date was unfortunately missed but we’re still on schedule to get these out before the end of January!

Hello folks!
We just received an update from our parent company HD Dice that our dice have nearly arrived to the ports in Los Angeles! Most out of team are out there in full force to transport the dice back to our warehouse and begin our quality control phase.
Our good friends from Dog Might Games have also updated us on our HeartBeat dice boxes and those should be arriving in the coming week so expect orders to start shipping near the end of January if not sooner.

We just received a message from the parent factory we work with (HD Dice) that the first run of Pride Dice are now completed and ready to ship to us in the States! campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks and challenges

The main risk for this project, is the potential for the campaign to go well beyond our expectations. We are hoping for a great response, but demand beyond our expectations could lead to delays. There is a point where production levels could influence the time of delivery. 
This is our smallest Kickstarter yet and we hope for a speedy turnaround!

From the experience of 3 kickstarters under our belt, we have ironed out our pipeline and improved the production process. We aim to cater our kickstarters accordingly, to be a comfortable size to ensure we hit our goals.

We have allowed a 11 month period for production, which we believe to be more than what we need. We'd rather be early as opposed to late. Our biggest goal is to break the Kickstarter trend and be early on this campaign. We hope we can achieve this goal, but we'd be happy to fulfil the orders on time.

Each campaign, comes with it's own challenges and it's own risks. We always have to take into account unforeseen circumstances. We feel very prepared, but are not capable of foreseeing any future hurdles. From our experience, they tend to be small ones and we are ready to get our teeth stuck into this project!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone!
We can now confirm that all orders have shipped! The last 3 packages were shipped today!
IMPORTANT NOTE: Please note that there is a section of orders on backerkit that the status has not been updated yet. This means your package is on its way/ has shipped but we will be updating the system to say it has shipped shortly.

Hi Everyone!
We are almost finished!!! Our sincerest thank you for your patience, especially if you have been towards the latter end of the shipping process. In a matter of days, we will be able to call this project complete. For some of you, your packages will be on their way and for a very small percentage of you your order will leave asap. The shipping notification emails have been a little bit of an issue. Something we will look to edit and improve on the next project. But if you have completed the checkout process and have not received the minis. You should safely assume they are on their way or will be, in a matter of days.

Hi Everyone.
We would just like to post an overdue update as we have now crept up towards September. We had initiated the shipping process towards the end of July but we have faced a few hurdles along the way. For that I hope you can accept my sincerest apologies. At this stage we are now close to half way through shipping. 
We have gone past our intended shipping schedule due to a few small set backs. We have used the fantastic platform backerkit, but it has taken a little getting used to. It took a little back and forth for us to get the orders out of the system in a format that was efficient for our set up. We are also juggling the shipping features for marking them as shipped. The team are very helpful and have been teaching us the best way to get what we want from the product.

Hi Everyone!

Just a quick update! We had a brief delay last week. This is the first time we've used backer kit as our pledge manager and its awesome. However we found it a little difficult getting the orders out in a format we like to work with.  After a little back and forth we have got the orders in a format we can work with more efficiently and quickly.

Hi Everyone,

We are over the moon with how the miniatures have come out!. Here are some more teasers before we handle our official Lightbox photography. These photos are taken with an iPhone and the minis will show up better under better lighting conditions. More images coming.

Hi Everyone!
Here is a teaser image of our Ogre War Boss miniatures. We will be assembling the rest and getting them into our light box shortly, for a series of updates prior to shipping!

Hi Everyone,

I didn't get the best photos of these. They really don't do them justice. I may be able to get some better ones soon. But for now I hope you like them!

These aren't as blurry as some of the others!

Hi Everyone!

With great joy, we get to show off some of the Ogre Prints! Next week, we will show the renders followed by another update towards the end of the week with some of the female ogre prints.

Hi Everyone!
This project has gone off to a great start in terms of production, but we have dropped the ball on updates. We should have provided at least 5 by now, showing off monthly progress and where we are at. I do hope you can forgive the radio silence with our sincerest apologies. This does however,  mean that we are now going to hammer through the same information in a more condensed time frame.

campaign.story:
From the team that brought you Two Rooms and a Boom...
In this super easy to learn press-your-luck game, there’s only one question you have to ask yourself: to drink or not to drink? Drink the most lemonade and you win... but watch out! Some people have seen Little Johnny, the neighborhood rascal, sneakin’ about, and you might end up drinking something... That's Not Lemonade!
Open Table Game: Join late, leave early, the game still works! 
Easy to Learn, Fast to Play: Takes one turn to learn and only ten minutes to play! 
Maximum Tension, Minimum Rules: Press-your-luck distilled down to its purest form. A card counter’s delight!
Designed by the incredible Matt Fantastic with beautiful art by Kelsey Cretcher, That's Not Lemonade! is a great addition to your table. It's fast, light, and fun and we really think you'll enjoy it. The first time we ever played - we started at midnight and didn't leave the table until six in the morning. That's a lot of playing for a 10 minute game!
The goal of That's Not Lemonade! is to be the first player to earn three lemons. You earn a lemon by collecting the most lemonade cards in a round, but watch out! Some of the cards are That's Not Lemonade cards and if you draw one, you're out for the round. 
Overall, the gameplay is simple. All you have to do is decide whether to hit or pass. To keep it simple, there's only four kinds of cards:
Lemonade Cards: You want these. Collect the most of these and win your round.
DOUBLE Lemonade Cards: You want these even more. They're worth two lemonades (duh).
Ice Cards: These are junk cards that help break ties, they don't do much for you, but they're way better than...
That's Not Lemonade! Cards: Draw one of these cards and you're out for the round!
Sounds simple, right? Well, it is simple! But don't be fooled, this game is tough! Whoever gets the most Lemonade in the round gets to keep a lemonade card (putting them one closer to winning). This means there are even fewer lemonade cards in the deck, and you're now more likely to draw a That's Not Lemonade! card. The odds have changed! Trying to keep all the cards straight in your head keeps the game challenging, while the overall rules of the game are so easy, a four year old can play (trust us, we have nieces and nephews)!
We worked really hard to make this little game just perfect. It fits in a tiny box (about half the size of Two Rooms and a Boom or World Championship Russian Roulette) with a nice plastic insert tray to hold the six mini-cups, the character reference tiles, and the cards. It really is gorgeous and we can't wait for you to see it.
We've got two easy pledge levels to make things convenient for you.
That's Not Lemonade! ($10): For only $10 you get the game and everything that comes with it! If you want additional copies, you'll have a chance to add those on with our pledge manager after the kickstarter has ended.
TKG Bundle ($45): For only $45 you get one of each of our games! You'll get Two Rooms and a Boom, World Championship Russian Roulette, and That's Not Lemonade! That's $15 in savings (not to mention the shipping!).
Stay tuned! We've got a couple more pledge levels coming your way shortly.
Nope! Not this time. That's Not Lemonade! is perfect as is and we don't want to clutter it up with a bunch of useless junk. The game is light and tight and the product is too. We promise when we make a heavier minis game (Two Armies and a Boom?) we'll have *like* a bajillion stretch goals.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every Kickstarter is not without it's own risks and challenges. This is our fifth Kickstarter and we've seen our fare share of roadblocks, stumbles, and pitfalls. However, we always do right by our backers no matter what. Usually, our biggest issues come during fulfillment, and we're switching things up by picking our fulfillment partners better and keeping a closer eye on them. However, our art and design have all been finished and we've looked at digital proofs from our manufacturer. No matter what, we will get you the best product we possibly can (even if Sean has to go to China. Again.).
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Funded in 12 hours! Back with confidence that you'll get your copy!
Welcome to Knot Dice Squared - 26 more knot dice in three new designs to combine with the original for more inspiration. Create larger and more intricate Celtic knots while playing with these amazing dice!
Add some new twists to your knot dice games...Include more friends...Design larger beautiful patterns...Play through an entirely new set of puzzles...Have more fun with Knot Dice Squared.
Shipping is free in the US, and low worldwide. This project is EU, Canada, Australia, and China Friendly.
If you're already familiar with Knot Dice, you can skip ahead to the next section. 
Knot Dice are big, beautiful dice, a forest green pearlized acrylic with indented silver lines. The designs are continuous around the entire die. They don't have numbers on the sides, but placing them side-by-side forms amazing Celtic knot patterns.
Some enjoy just making designs with them, or leaving them out on tables and counters to play with. But they also can be used to play a large number of games and puzzles. The original Knot Dice set includes 18 awesome dice and rules to 12 games and 7 types of puzzles, with dozens of individual puzzles. There are cooperative games, competitive games, speed games, puzzle games, storytelling games... Individual descriptions of each of the games and puzzles can be found on the original Knot Dice Kickstarter page, and full rules and video instructions are on the Black Oak Games Knot Dice page.
the original Knot Dice, some of the new Knot Dice, and a design using both
The original is available separately right now on the Black Oak Games web site, or in the $29 reward level here.
Knot Dice 2? No, this expands Knot Dice to four dice total, so it's Knot Dice Squared!
These new dice allow you to create a huge variety of beautiful new designs, they come with an entirely new book of puzzles, and they add some new twists to the games.
The four dice are: crossed (the original), squared, rounded, and bridge. Crossed dice have all paths crossing when they go over an edge; squared and rounded dice have all paths parallel when they go over an edge; and bridge dice have both parallel and crossed paths going over the edges, to connect the original knot dice to the new knot dice. (There is much more detail about this in the first update.)
The dice are still 20mm, much larger than normal 16mm dice:
They still have that great hefty weight to them. And yes, the lines are still continuous around the dice. 
One box of Knot Dice Squared contains:  
26 Knot Dice (20mm dice): 9 squared, 9 rounded, and 8 bridge. These combine with one set of the original (crossed) Knot Dice in the right proportions for the included puzzles and games, and many many designs.
Game Rules on how to modify eight Knot Dice games (described below under Games) to include the new dice, plus all new games from the stretch goals.
Puzzle Rules to five Knot Dice puzzle types (described below under Puzzles), with a large number of puzzles of each type using the new dice.
4 Wooden Discs with silkscreened designs (two each in orange and purple for two more players). These tokens are sometimes used to track scores, sometimes used as playing pieces.
  Knot Dice Squared includes new games from the stretch goals:
4 Get Me Knots
1 player, solo game
Create as many complete knots as you can of different sizes. It sounds easy enough, but a perfect game is incredibly difficult to achieve. There's plenty of strategy here in how you go about choosing your dice, and which knots you add to and how.
Hedgerow
2 player, turn-based competitive
Create as many complete knots as you can on your side of a wall, but your side can only be at most one die further in any direction than your opponent's. Instead of using the top face of the dice, you use the sides of the dice while the hedgerow grows.
Also included are rules changes incorporating the new dice in these games from the original Knot Dice:
Kells, Kells: The Book, and Kells: The Abbey
1-5 players, turn-based cooperative
The new dice add a bit more complexity to these cooperative games. Now you have the added choice of which type of die to add to your pool before you roll it.
Knot So Fast
2-5 players, real-time competitive
Knot Dice Squared really ramps up the challenge in Knot So Fast, where you're trying to complete your knots more quickly than your opponents. You have to pull the right die out of the middle to be able to complete your designs, all while racing your opponents. Fortunately, if you really get stuck, you can swap out one of your dice for one in the middle.
Knot So Fast Too
2-6 players, real-time competitive
With this many dice, you can play two head-to-head matches of this fast-paced game at the same time. One pair uses the crossed dice, while the other pair uses the squared and rounded dice. A 5- or 6-player game pairs up each player against each other player once.
Distance
2-4 players, turn-based competitive
This very puzzly game gets quite a complexity boost from the new dice. A new setup enables up to four players to play, using all 44 dice.
Knot the Whole Story
1-6 players, turn-based storytelling
The focus of the storytelling game is now on two: choose two characters, two settings, two themes for the overall arc of the story. Playing a crossed die means advancing the story along one path; playing a rounded or squared die means advancing the story along the other; playing a bridge die brings the two parts of the story together in some way.
Minarets
3-6 players, turn-based competitive
Minarets really shines with the additional dice. The vertical buildings created by the player partners can be larger, and the new connections make them more complex, adding to the architectural puzzle. 
An entirely new puzzle book is included in Knot Dice Squared. The types of puzzles will be familiar to owners of Knot Dice, but they are changed with the addition of different dice types.
The completion and transformation puzzles start you out with dice in a certain arrangement, and you have to rearrange them in as few turns as possible to form a completed design. The creation puzzles present you with some dice and challenge you to create a symmetrical design out of them. The building puzzles show you a three-dimensional shape, and your task is to build it with completed knots on all of the visible faces of the building. I'll include a more detailed introduction to some of the puzzles in an update soon.
The expansion book includes Completion Puzzles 1, Completion Puzzles 2, Transformation Puzzles, Creation Puzzles, and Building Puzzles. With the first four types of puzzles, the number of dice of each type are provided in the setup instructions for each puzzle. The complexity of most of these puzzles is similar to the originals once you are familiar with the new dice. 
With building puzzles, much larger shapes are possible with the expansion, leading to more difficult puzzles. And part of the puzzle is now figuring out which dice to use.
I need your help to get these new dice made. The money raised on Kickstarter will go toward the three new molds we need, manufacturing the dice, printing and manufacturing the box and rules and tokens, graphic design, putting it all together, and shipping. If we raise enough I can print some extras and also reprint more of the original Knot Dice boxes. 
Make it happen - Without your help, these dice won't get made.
Get your set - I don't have any distribution deals, so other than those few retail stores that work with me directly, the only way to get Knot Dice is directly from me. That will probably be even more true with this expansion.
Please participate with both your pledges and your voices. Social media and personal shares are greatly appreciated. Do you have a friend who loves dice games, puzzles, art, or Celtic culture? Please let them know about Knot Dice!

Wooden Boxes:
The Dog Might Knot Dice Chest: Hand crafted out of premium American Black Walnut, these dice chests beautifully hold all of your Knot Dice and double as a rolling tray for your games. Each is hand built in their wood shop in Ann Arbor, MI, and comes with Knot Dice engraved lid, black felt, a removable wooden insert for separating tokens and dice, and nickel pedestal feet. As with every Dog Might product, the Knot Dice Chests come with a lifetime guarantee.

We achieved every stretch goal! There weren't too many this time around, because I want to make the highest quality product possible, and we achieved so many stretches in the first campaign and I wasn't going to produce anything less than that.
These stretch goals have more detailed descriptions in the updates. 
Shipping is free in the United States. I'm not able to provide free shipping worldwide this time, but I think I've been able to provide some great worldwide shipping costs. 
The new expansion box is going to be heavier than the original Knot Dice box (with 8 more dice in it), so it isn't cost-effective to ship them directly from China. This time, I'm using a shipping company based in the US but with regional warehouses in other countries. The US rewards will be freighted to the US to be shipped directly to backers, but there will be:
Customs-Friendly Shipping in the EU, Canada, Australia and China.
I do want to support game stores by offering the items available on Kickstarter to retailers. If you're a retailer, please message me directly through Kickstarter for pricing information, and then you can make your pledge in full through Kickstarter during the campaign. 
Celtic knots are part of a rich tradition of Celtic art and culture. The looping design patterns commonly known as Celtic knots are found in art from nearly 1,400 years ago, though repeating interlacing patterns can be found even earlier. 
The most famous examples of Celtic knotwork are the Book of Kells (ca. 800), the Lindisfarne Gospels (ca. 700), and the Book of Durrow (ca. 650). These illuminated (decorated) manuscripts were made by monks in Ireland or Britain. Many are available for viewing on the Trinity College Dublin web site in their digital collections. Other examples of Celtic knotwork can be found in manuscripts and carved stone monuments across Europe, primarily in the northwest.
from a page in the Book of Kells
The design elements on the faces of knot dice are based on the Celtic Knot Font, created by Daniel Isdell. If you're interested in creating more Celtic knotwork, check out his font!

A huge thanks goes to all of the game and puzzle designers who contributed to Knot Dice: Cameron Browne, Jay Treat, Bonnie Neubauer, Doug Levandowski, Cardboard Edison, Ian Reed, Elizabeth Hargrave, and Josh Tempkin! 
Thanks also go to the Dice Maniac's Club for all of the support from its members for this project and the original Knot Dice, and to all of the game and puzzle reviewers who shared their love of Knot Dice.
Finally, a very special thanks goes to Margaux, Anna Grace, and Peter O'Malley for all of your help and support.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I delivered on a similar project with the original Knot Dice and will be using the same manufacturers again. All of the games and puzzles are ready to go. I've read up on Jamey Stegmaier's Kickstarter Lessons. There are two primary risks associated with this campaign:

1. Delivery dates might change slightly. I am doing everything in my power to keep on schedule: the dice manufacturer is now a known quantity (so we won't have to change mid-production like last campaign), the rules are mostly finished, and most of the graphic design is done as well. However, the dice factory is a small shop (so they might have trouble meeting the timetable if the campaign does extremely well), and international freight shipping is one of the great mysteries of the universe (hopefully we won't get stopped in customs anywhere or have to deal with any strikes).

2. US-China trade issues. I don't foresee them impacting board game imports, but it is possible that something will come up that I have no control over. Let's cross our fingers.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The great Black Death has come to you in the Middle Ages, ravaging everyone you know. A Plague Doctor visited, promising help, but what did he truly bring?
The Carrier is an expansion to the original game, and introduces new characters, new abilities, and chain reactions.
The Carrier can play 5 to 6 people with one copy, and scales up to 7 to 12 players with 2 game copies. It takes just 10 minutes to play.
 You’ve heard rumors that the Plague Doctor's path now leads to your village. Wherever he goes, his Ravens follow. And now, they carry the infection as well.
The Carrier is a quick, strategic, secret role, semi-cooperative social game. One of the party is a Plague Doctor, spreading the Bubonic Plague. The Villagers need to find and rid themselves of the evil doctor before they succumb to the greatest plague in history.
You can now grab the original game along with this expansion. It will come with all cards and components as the original (even stretch goal cards).
 The Plague Doctor's ravens inspired the name of the expansion: The Carrier.
 Now, one or more Villagers can begin with one of the Plague Doctor’s ravens in their hand. The malevolent Raven carries with it an Infection. As a Villager, if you receive an Infection card of any kind from the Plague Doctor, you MUST pass your Raven card on your next turn. (The Raven now infects a villager, unless that Villager receives a vaccination).
Let’s hope your fellow Villagers are prepared.
 Check out the new characters in the The Carrier expansion:
The Plague Doctor's powerful new double infection.
The Plague Doctor's experience has made him more powerful. He carries a new infection card which infects a villager for two consecutive rounds, should the player be lucky enough to be vaccinated in the first instance.
This Carrier Raven carries an immediate infection.
His Ravens, the Carriers, also carry infections. As a Villager, if you've been passed an infection card from the Plague Doctor, you MUST now pass a Carrier card the next round! These cards infect your fellow Villagers, and have varying immediate or delayed infections.
This Raven carries a 1 round delayed infection to the next victim.
 There are 3 new Raven cards which can be held by Villagers, each infecting other Villagers either immediately, with a 1-round delay, or a 2-round delay. A Villager will typically hold just one Raven card in their hand.
This Carrier gives a delayed 2-Round infection.
This Raven is happy to spread the Bubonic Plague to a new victim. New raven art by the one and only Lindsey Kustusch.
The Huntress
We wouldn't leave you defenseless, however. The stealthy Huntress is exceptional, so she should be able to strike down the Plague Doctor's ravenous ravens. (If you hold this card, you are immune to the Ravens).
The Tough Villager
Your Blacksmith has proven to be resilient to infection. He'll be able to live through one infection, even without a vaccination.
The Sinister Villager
One of your citizens, quite spiteful however, has turned on you and is joining forces with the traveling Plague Doctor. He wins if the Plague Doctor wins.
A couple of villagers have also promised help with a chance of healing. They give a chance not only of infection, but also vaccination.This card introduces an additional dice into the game, giving vaccinations.
Sanctuary. Your option to roll the dice.
And there remains one other who will provide sanctuary from the ravishes ahead. One way to escape: hide. (If you hold this card, you don't have to roll the dice if you don't want to).
The Weak Villager
One of the town elders is weak, so a vaccination won't help him at all.
The Healer. She gives a vaccination to a villager for 2 consecutive rounds.
Finally, you've also heard rumors of a powerful new apothecary from the forest, and of her ability to vaccinate others on multiple occasions with just one visit. Will she be able to help? Only time will tell.
You’ll also receive the new Silent Villager miniature, which moves to a new player each round. Whichever player the Silent Villager sits in front of, that player is unable to make a guess as to whom the Plague Doctor is in that round.
When the miniature moves to a new player for the following round, you would finally be free to make a guess, should you so choose, and if the cards allow it.
You’ll also have the new dice to roll. The previous die included only “safe” and “infected” results. The new die has 3 of its 6 sides as vaccinations. So should you think a fellow villager is becoming infected from a Plague Doctor, and you are unable to save them with a vaccination, you now can give them a chance…but it carries the chance of an infection as well.
Are you new to The Carrier, or a veteran? Either way, you can grab the full game plus the expansion, or just the expansion. The full game will come with all of the original Stretch Goal cards, as you are now backing the game as well. Thank you!
With these new Carrier expansion cards, you’ll be able to create your own decks and change players’ abilities as desired. If you want only a few players to carry a Raven card, you can do that. If you want to add another Silent Villager, the Blacksmith, a Healer, an Apothecary, the Huntress, a Weak Villager, a Sinister Villager, the Priest, or any combination of any of the cards, you have the freedom to do so.
Add these cards to your existing Contagious Villagers, Double Dice, and other cards to make some fun new starting decks.
Having the freedom and ability to change the game will be exciting, and we’ve created a new Facebook group just for that purpose: Share your favorite creations with others and talk about The Carrier game, including the expansion: https://www.facebook.com/groups/281524039004410/
Have you come up with some amazing starting hands for Villagers? Are the Villagers in your game having a tough time? Manage your hands so that you can give each side a chance at winning. And see what others are doing too. It’s never been this fun being Infected.
Ever seen a Plague Doctor dice rolling tray?  We're happy to announce we are partnering with Dog Might on an exclusive rolling tray, made especially for fans of Infected.
The rolling tray is made of Flaming Birch with Dog Might's amazing "Demon Blood" finish, and black felt. It's a luxurious rolling tray that you can use for any game where you need to roll the bones! - Just add on the appropriate amount shown below to your pledge, which includes shipping to your part of the world.
This Plague Doctor rolling tray is only available through this Kickstarter, and you won't be able to get it at Dog Might or anywhere else after that. Dog Might will personally craft and ship each of these.
The Carrier is a quick playing social deduction game set during the times of the Bubonic Plague.
Players will try to vaccinate their fellow villagers in their quest to gather information and protect each other, while finding the Plague Doctor. If you are the Plague Doctor, you’ll try to spread the disease as quickly as possible so that you are the lone victor.
Here’s the catch: no one knows who anyone else is.
Do you have what it takes to survive the worst of the Bubonic Plague, or will you become The Carrier?
CREDITS: Game designed by Bryan Sloan. Published by Black Forest Studio. Card face illustrations by Artur Jag. Raven art by Lindsey Kustusch. Miniature crafting by Slawek Kosciukiewicz. Card icons by Josh McDowell. Video by Josh McDowell. Card back illustration by DeviantArt's Snook-8. Additional art by Vladimir Manyukhin. Rules layout by Chris Doughman. Played in the very near future by you.
Why do we need you to pledge on Kickstarter?
1. Without your pledge, the game won't exist! (That's big).
2. When you buy the game now, we can manufacture the game in a higher print run and add more cool stuff into the game.
3. This may be your only chance to buy the game!
4. You can infect your friends, in a good way.
Is this game exclusive to Kickstarter backers?
- Yes, probably. The expansion probably won't go into retail, aside from any stores who buy the game now on Kickstarter. So this is essentially the only place where you'll be able to guarantee yourself the expansion or the base game. If there are a few copies left over when printing, there might be a few available at conventions or via Amazon USA, but I wouldn't count on it! :)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've produced many other projects on Kickstarter, the social game Emotional IQ, and critically acclaimed playing card decks like AVES, British Monarchy, and Romeo and Juliet. The art and sculpture for the game are already complete, and we already have approval to manufacture the game! Shipping is also good to go, and there are no extra taxes due to the game being under the VAT pricing threshold. There is always the risk of another Bubonic Plague breaking out, which could affect the timeliness of the game being produced, but in all likelihood, everything will be on time. I'm always here to answer questions! - Bryan Sloan, Black Forest Studio

Hey everyone! A couple of quick and exciting things in this Update!
We will have a booth at BGGcon in Dallas in a few days, so come say hi!
The Carrier is just about finished manufacturing. As you know, we shipped out the base Infected game to you early so that you can be playing while The Carrier finished manufacturing. Hey everyone!  Everything is going great and production of The Carrier is as planned. The base Infected game is ready to ship, so we are going to go ahead with that! Why wait, right!?! - You'll be receiving shipping notices of the base game coming out ahead of time, and you'll still receive your Carrier expansion once production is complete.

Hey everyone! I've received the samples from the manufacturer! Everything is going as planned, and we are still on track for delivering the game this year. The samples look fantastic, and it will be a great addition to your game. Below are some images I snapped that I'll share with you now!

Thanks to all of you, The Carrier will be flying to you soon! It's a great addition to your base game, and customizing the starting hands will be lots of fun. If you end up painting any miniatures, please share them online!
Hey everyone! The Carrier is a gorgeous game, and it will be flying to you very soon. It’s one that you’ll want to display, as the art is so stunning.

campaign.story:
In roleplaying games, immersion is everything, so we've been champing at the bit to use augmented reality to basically make a holodeck for tabletop RPGs. When we shared a demo of our early work (well, hobby) on Imgur and Reddit, the community response was so positive and energizing that we decided we should commit full-time. The footage you see in the video above is the result of our preliminary work, and we're dying to dig in and upgrade literally every feature you see. This Kickstarter, we're asking you to join us to help make truly fine and fun augmented reality & dragons.
Fresh and warm, straight from the egg
To bring augmented monsters and heroes to life, we’re using token-based augmented reality. Each token you place and move around your table is transformed into beautifully animated creatures and cravens (or heroes, if you're the sort). In the final version, the QR-coded cards from the demo will be replaced with polished, professional tokens that add to your tabletop roleplaying experience.
Your one-inch tokens will come in four varieties: print-and-cut, grayboard, ceramic, and engraved wood. To move your characters and beasties through space, you simply move the tokens through a scalable grid that AR&D will generate for you.
Prototype ceramic tokens
Prototype wooden inlay tokens
Hero breeding and cultivation is perhaps the best part of tabletop RPGs. Our first core feature is a comprehensive character creator. From within AR&D you'll be able to summon and customize exactly the right hero for your adventure, stick him on a token, and bring him to animated, living-and-breathing augmented life. Want an Elven archer, an Orc cleric, or a Half-demon barbarian? Pick what speaks to you, gear them up, and make them kiss we mean take them on adventures.
A mockup of the character creator
AR&D will let you choose from the classic mythological races like Human*, Orc, Elf, Demon-touched, Dwarf, Lizardman, Halfling, Half-giant, and Gnome. Regardless of which you choose, you can customize their natural variations, put them in clown makeup, and select from epic sets of armor and gear to complete the ensemble. (*mythical human, naturally).
Your new character, ready to murder hobo his way into infamy
Within AR&D will be your very own monster farm. Summon up mesmerizing art and captivatingly sculpted monsters that can breathe fire, fly, burrow, and generally end your player characters' dreams. Most of our next months will be dedicated to building up armies of Very Bad Dudes for all of us to play with. On first pass, there will be 25 unique, animated, resizable monsters ready at launch, with more if we hit our stretch goals or find ways to extend out the day/night cycle.
To make the library of baddies truly endless, other stretch goals will make it possible for you to upload 3D files you create or find on your own. You could 3D scan yourself and be your own character class! One of us already turned himself into a playable lvl 13 Coward, complete with wooden cart, cabbages, and despair. It’s a prestige class for Peasant, in case you'd like to roll one yourself.
To build the best version of AR&D that we can, we'll need you. While we've already had a ton of fun playing around with early versions, we want your help in making a lasting, rich, and robust play experience. As we finish up testable chunks of design, we'll be counting on you to play with us. Long before the final version is issued, your job will be to tell us all the ways in which it breaks, or better yet all the ways in which we can make it shine.
Our stretch goals will help define how far you all want us to push AR&D. The more bells we ring, the better AR&D will be on release. Also the louder the bells will be.
We'll add the ability for you to upload any 3D file you create or download for use in your games. You can share models with friends, scan yourself, or we'll point you in the direction of some open-source libraries to dive into. By making it possible to use your own files, you'll have limitless flexibility in bringing your campaigns to life.
With the shared tabletop feature, you can remotely see and interact with the same table your friends are using. You could move your character behind cover in Vermont and your friends in Texas would see it happen right in front of them. You'll have to trust your DM that the Gorgon really was staring your escort in the face the whole time.
We'll create a fully integrated character sheet for you to use in-game. Update your stats live as you play and save your sheet session-to-session, character-to-character.
Combat Assistant lets you toggle displays to track hit points and initiative for each character on the map. He won't *actually* assist you in combat, but at least he'll helpfully tell you how badly you're doing (or, if your DM is a pushover, that you're still alive and fully en-limbed).
We'll double our library of animated monsters and beasts. Rampaging LG Unicorns, here we come!
Our milestones for this Kickstarter are already quite ambitious, so we'll only unlock further stretch goals if we hit all of our first targets.
We love Kickstarter, and we love the enthusiasm Kickstarter backers bring to a project. We need a big community of vocal RPG fans to help propel this project forward.
Some of you may wonder why the funding threshold is set so high. Well, we have huge plans for AR&D, and we're setting ourselves on a course for the next year and a half. We want to make something enduring and worthy of your support. To complete a project that lives up to our hopes and dreams will take everything we've got; half-way simply won't do.
Elder Labs was started by Dan, one of the cofounders of Elderwood Academy. We've always been passionate about fantasy tabletop gaming, and when we first saw augmented reality in action our hearts stopped. Elder Labs' mission is to use the awesome promise of augmented reality to bring tabletop RPGs to life. If you ever want to reach out and say "hello" or an awkwardly friendly "HELLO!" please hit us up at info@AugmentedDungeons.com.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Any Kickstarter, big or small, is at its heart a labor of love, collaboration, and madness. We're no different from any other creators in that regard; we depend on your help and shared love to bring something new to life. There are universal challenges to all Kickstarters and Dan, via Elderwood Academy, has been integral in five successful campaigns.

The biggest challenges of this project are twofold. First, we need to build a product that is seamlessly fun to use while playing tabletop RPGs. While we love playing with the demo, we're certain there are extensive opportunities to make it more fun for everyone.

Second, we're basically trying to create an MMORPG's worth of digital assets from the ground up, to be optimized for iOS and Android and serve you the most attractive digital garden of animated monsters and heroes ever. We've lined up everything we need to get it done, but it's no mean feat, and half done will probably mean undone. To help insure against that, we've set the funding level high to cover the absolute costs we expect to incur over the next year.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
