updates.update_content: Hi gang! Exciting times at Elder High. We’ve spend this month figuring out what it would take to get a sleek version 1 out there, and after a ton of testing and prototyping we think we’re on track. If things continue to go well, we'll release a version 1 in the next few months. Because of the support and enthusiasm of you all (and seriously, there are a lot of you; thanks guys!) we’ve had some great conversations with different partners, artists, and developers and we’re really hyped about the next steps :D For one thing, it’s let us get oodles of art and assets lined up. From the conversations we’ve had with all of you, version 1 will include the remote multiplayer from the get-go ^_^

updates.update_userinfo: When you reach and touch a star
updates.update_content:
...sometimes you burn your fingers and develop star-phobia. As some (many?) of you have probably been sensing, we are in the classic "Kickstarter doldrums" where a project leaps off the starting block with a sprint, then falls over like a soccer player fishing for a penalty shot. That is how sports work.
What we're saying is, it seems unlikely that five times as many people are going to send us their good vibes before our three weeks are up; our chances of getting funded for this campaign this month are low. Everyone who has been a part of this campaign is a true believer and really wants this to be a thing. It's always a little heartbreaking when things don't go the way we want them to the first time.

Hello guys and gals! Thank you all for being a part of AR&D and for helping bring our dreams one step closer to reality. Everyone's encouragement and positive energy have made first few days fly by.
Physical miniatures and set pieces are an awesome way to share and build on the imagination inherent in D&D, and we think using augmented reality will make that experience even more engrossing. In this update we’ll do our best to answer a few questions and low-key promote a new Imgur post ^_^

campaign.story:
Good Society is a collaborative roleplaying game that seeks to capture the heart, and the countenance, of Jane Austen's work. It is a game of balls, estates, sly glances, and turns about the garden. At least on the surface. Underneath this, just as in Austen's own novels, it is a game of social ambition, family obligation and breathtaking, heart-stopping longing.
In this game, you play the type of characters that captured your imagination in Austen's books - from a wealthy heir who falls in love with the aloof new arrival, to a charming socialite bent on ruining the reputation of their rivals. Exploit your advantages, connections, and family influence to achieve your secret desire - all while jealously guarding your good name.
Not only that, players in Good Society hold the power to control the story itself, and change it in their favour. Take control of influential connections, create rumour and scandal, and spend tokens to orchestrate balls, carriage accidents, and even marriages.
It is the elegance of Austen's world, the sharpness of her wit, and the beauty of her passion that inspired us to create this system. But it is the deep and complex struggle between desire, expectation, and position that has guided its development - and we hope you will enjoy both elements.
Desire to see Good Society in action? Watch an actual play of the game on Geek Space TV!
Click to go the Backer's only update
In Good Society, you will play a character that could very well have stepped out of the pages of Austen's work.
You will build you character from four components: your character role, your family background, your relationship and of course your secret desire.
You could for instance, play a socialite in the militia, with the secret desire to come into substantial wealth - while also being childhood rivals with another player (Wickham perhaps?)
Or, you could play a wealthy heiress from old money, with a secret desire to marry off two of your closest acquaintances - while also dealing with a long-term uncertain romance of your own (um, Emma?)
Whatever you choose, drama, romance, and tense ballroom scenes are sure to follow.
Good Society comes with nine character roles to chose from, as well as seven different family backgrounds, to capture the full range of regency gentry.
Good Society will be a full colour hardcover book, packed with over 150 pages of thematic material and beautiful art. Our aim is to create a beautiful book worthy of even Pemberley's library.
The game comes with 20 Secret Desire and Relationship cards to keep Good Society replayable and customisable. It also includes all the rules you need to create original desires and relationships of your own.
Plus, 16 additional cards have already been unlocked from stretch goals.
On top of all this, thanks to stretch goal unlocks, backers at All the PDFs and above will also receive a PDF LARP VERSION of the game, perfect for play on a single occasion - and of course, in regency dress.
And, if you were thinking to yourself that the regency era would be better if it was just a little magical, backers have also unlocked a PDF re-theme of the game, Pride, Prejudice, and Practical Magics, that is included in every tier containing the stretch goals. You can read more about this expansion in our update here.
In Good Society, supporting characters hold tremendous influence over the lives, situations, and hearts of the protagonists. Not only that, but players actually take on the role of such characters during the game, to inject more drama (and romance!) into the story.
To help you create vivid supporting characters quickly and easily, we've created the Deck of Non-Player Gentry. Each (double-sided) card contains two different intriguing regency characters, along with vital information such as their wealth, marital status, and less importantly, their personality. 
There are now 30 cards in the deck, which will be fully illustrated by Aviv Or (avivor.com). Thanks to a stretch goal unlock we were able to add 10 more cards!
There is now also an additional Expansion Deck of Re-theme cards, containing20 unique NPGs, 10 Secret Desire Cards, and 10 Relationship Cards, created especially for Pride, Prejudice, and Practical Magics and Sense, Sensibility and Swordsmanship. You can add a physical version of this deck to your pledge for $25aud.
Want your regency character immortalised in the deck? Back at the Gentry of Note, or Gentry of Consequence level and work with us to create a member of the regency gentry for inclusion in all copies of the deck of NPGs. 
Your character will be illustrated in full colour by Aviv. This illustration can be based on a written description, or inspired by your likeness, or the likeness of someone you love (with permission!)
We don't make any extra profit on the Gentry of Note tier - all additional funds go directly to the artist. We just want to fill our game with beautiful art.
Please note, these pledges do not include a physical version of the Expansion Deck of Re-theme Cards. If you would like a physical copy of the deck, simply add $25aud to your pledge (physical tiers only).
Good Society is a collaborative tabletop roleplaying game, where you and your friends take on the role of regency characters, AND the forces that complicate their lives, to create a truly Austen story. One person takes on the role of the Facilitator, who helps the players to create the game's fiction, and plays supporting characters as needed.
The game is quick to teach and easy to learn, whether or not you've played a roleplaying game before.
New to roleplaying? Not a problem. The New To Roleplaying Guide has already been unlocked in our stretch goals, so if you want to give roleplaying a go for the first time, now is your chance!
To create a game that plays like an Austen novel, we've created a completely original system, with game mechanics that mirror the actual mechanics of Austen's world.
Reputation, family background, rumour and scandal, and of course, the writing of letters, are all important rules of the game. These mechanics are all geared towards narrative and collaborative play, allowing players to work together to shape the story they want to tell.
At the core of Good Society is the trade of resolve tokens that grant story shaping powers to players and the Facilitator alike. These tokens let players take actions as diverse as:
Causing an event, conversation, or circumstance to occur
Manipulating or changing a character's feelings
Procuring favours or discovering secrets
Creating details about the past, or even flashbacks 
To mirror the ebb and flow of an Austen novel, Good Society is played in five phases.
To learn more about how the game works, back the game and grab the Quickstart, or view one of the actual plays below.
GeekSpace TV - recommended!
Us!
A minor caution - the end of this Actual Play reveals some of the Secret Desires which appear in the Quickstart (spoilers!)
As part of this campaign, backers unlocked and voted for a re-theme of Good Society. The winner was Pride, Prejudice and Practical Magics, inspired by fiction such as Jonathon Strange and Mr Norrell, Shades of Milk and Honey, and Sorcery and Cecelia.
This re-theme will be included as a PDF for backers of "All the PDFs" and above. In it, characters will take on new roles, desires, and relationships as they struggle with prophecies, glamour and incantations, all while maintaining an impeccable reputation, and finding a suitable match.
We've now unlocked a second re-theme of Good Society, Sense, Sensibility and Swordsmanship, inspired by the high number of votes we received for the Scarlet Pimpernel. This re-theme also pays homage to works such as Zorro, and Sovay.
The key focus of the theme is on double lives – with each character having their regular Good Society play materials and concerns, as well as additional play materials that represent their secret bad-ass persona.
Materials from Good Society and both re-themes are completely compatible, which means, if you want sword fighting AND magic AND advantageous marriages now you can!
We are NOT using a pledge manager for this campaign. Should you be after the Expansion Deck of Re-theme Cards, or additional copies of one of the fine products below, please adjust your Kickstarter pledge by the appropriate amount.
Add-ons are only available for physical reward tiers. If you have pledged at All the PDFs and you would like the physical cards, there is now a tier for that, All the PDFs + Physical Cards.
Storybrewers Roleplaying is made up of Hayley Gordon (twitter: @storybrewers), and Vee Hendro (twitter: @rocketeer_vee). We are two Australians with a passion for roleplaying and also tea (preferably together).  
Our previous game Alas for the Awful Sea was successfully Kickstarted, and fulfilled in August last year.
We have been working on Good Society since 2016, and are so excited to finally be able to share it with you! You can check out some of our other work on the Storybrewers' website.
For this project we are extremely lucky to be joined by two fantastic artists, Raven Warner (ravenwarner.com), and Aviv Or (avivor.com) and our guest contributor, Alex Robinson (@pronerdalex).
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This isn't our first time delivering a roleplaying game through Kickstarter. Our previous game Alas for the Awful Sea successfully fulfilled by the Kickstarter estimated delivery date.

Much of Good Society has already been written, and the game has been extensively playtested over two years. However, now you have the Quickstart in your hands, we are planning to improve and expand the game based on your feedback - that's one of the most exciting opportunities a Kickstarter can offer! We'll involve you in the process every step of the way.

Our team includes a professional copywriter, two professional artists and a lawyer, so we’re all experienced in meeting deadlines and working late nights! We’ll keep you updated and informed throughout, from stretch goals to fulfilment.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Dearest backers,
It has been almost two years since Good Society was released, and we are still ever so glad of the amazing support you gave us in making the game and beyond.

campaign.story:
Return of the Lazy Dungeon Master is a book designed to help all of us GMs get more out of our RPGs by preparing less. The Return of the Lazy Dungeon Master uses the experiences of thousands of GMs to help us focus on how we prepare our games, how we run our games, and how we think about our games. It includes practical steps for focusing our preparation activities on those things that will bring the biggest impact to our game.
Five years ago, the Lazy Dungeon Master offered a simplifed approach for preparing fantasy RPGs with one clear directive: prepare only what most benefits our games. This focus on lightweight preparation and improvisational preparation resonated with many GMs over the past five years.
But during that time and with the release of the fifth edition of Dungeons & Dragons, the world of fantasy roleplaying has changed and expanded. With five years of new systems and new ideas, all GMs have a wealth of experiences to share and explore to help us prepare and run great RPGs. Return of the Lazy Dungeon Master builds off of the concepts of the well-received GM's guidebook Lazy Dungeon Master, updating that book with five years of new experiences, new approaches, and new observations of the way people prepare and run RPGs. This new book is a completely self-contained work, which does not require anyone to have previously read The Lazy Dungeon Master.
Return of the Lazy Dungeon Master offers a new focused approach for preparing and running our roleplaying games. The book includes an eight-step guide for lightweight game preparation and is focused on how we prepare for our games, how we run our games, and how we think about our games.
You can check out the PDF preview of Return of the Lazy Dungeon Master or check out the table of contents below to see if it's the right book for you.
   Based on research involving hundreds of books, videos, articles, and interviews with top Gamemasters, as well as thousands of results from Gamemaster surveys, Return of the Lazy Dungeon Master helps us understand the best tips and tricks used by GMs all over the world to bring the most fun to our games.
Prepare what benefits your game.
About This Kickstarter
The full text of Return of the Lazy Dungeon Master is complete. Your funding towards this Kickstarter will go towards the editing of the book by veteran RPG editor Scott Fitzgerald Gray, and the layout and art direction of the book by veteran RPG art director Marc Radle. The book will also include internal art by Pedro Potier. Here's an example of the art.
The Lazy Dungeon Master Workbook
As this Kickstarter grows, we will put together a Lazy Dungeon Master Workbook. This workbook will include a wide range of tools, maps, and reference sheets to help you run your 5e roleplaying game. It will have a brand-new cover by Jack Kaiser and is intended to be used right at the table. All backers will get the PDF of this workbook and digital versions of the maps. Backers at the $13 level will be able to order print copies of the workbook for the cost of printing (about $6) and shipping (about $6 in US and UK).
Here are some example worksheets we will include:
Lazy DM Reference Sheet 
Session Preparation Worksheet 
Character Tracker Campaign Worksheet 
5e Cheat Sheet 
Random NPC Names 
Random Traps 
Random Single-Use Magic Items 
Random Dungeon Encounters 
Random Fantastic Features
Below you'll see some example draft reference sheets. Note that these sheets have not yet gone through formatting or design.
5e Quick Reference
 Trap Generator
Lazy Lairs
The Lazy Dungeon Master Workbook will also now include ten "Lazy Lairs" including full-color maps of commonly-used dungeons and one-page write-ups with descriptions, read-aloud text, and area aspects. They're designed so you can easily use them in your game with little to no preparation needed. These Lazy Lairs will be included in the Lazy Dungeon Master Workbook and all backers will receive digital versions of these maps with fully-annotated DM versions and unannotated versions for use in virtual tabletops like Roll20 and Fantasy Grounds.
Here are two example maps by Derek Ruiz and Daniel Walthall.
  Stretch Goals
Lazy Dungeon Master Workbook PDF ($5000 - Unlocked!). All backers will receive the Lazy Dungeon Master Workbook PDF. 
Internal Artwork ($6,000—UNLOCKED). We'll commission internal artwork to make the book even more beautiful.
EPUB E-book Version ($8,000—UNLOCKED) Every backer will now receive Return of the Lazy Dungeon Master as an EPUB e-book as well. This format is perfect for reading the book on a phone, tablet, or e-reader.
Hardback Version At Cost for $13 Pledges ($10,000—UNLOCKED). Those who back at the $13 level will be able to buy the book in a deluxe hardback edition. This collector's edition will be available from RPG Now for the cost of printing, about $15, and is perfect or sitting in a comfortable chair, drinking a favorite beverage, and pondering how to make your next game awesome. You do not need to increase your pledge above $13 to have this option. You will receive a link to order the book at the cost of printing and shipping when the book is ready.
Five Lazy Lairs ($15,000—UNLOCKED). The Lazy Dungeon Master Workbook will contain five full color maps of common locations we use in our D&D games including Caves, Temple, Castle, Sewers, and Dungeon. These maps will be done by Daniel Walthall, Derek, Ruiz, and Miska Fredman.
Five More Lazy Lairs and a Print Version of the Lazy Dungeon Master Workbook ($20,000—UNLOCKED). We'll add five more Lazy Lairs to the Lazy Dungeon Master Workbook including the Cellars, Tower, Docks, Mines, and Catacombs. We will also commission a new cover for the workbook by Jack Kaiser and create a print-on-demand version of the workbook for those at the $13 tier. We expect the cost of printing to be roughly $6.
High Resolution Cover Artwork (2,000 backers—UNLOCKED). Every backer will receive high-resolution JPEGs of Jack Kaiser's covers for each of the books suitable for printing or using as a background for a phone or tablet.
Lazy Lair Descriptions ($30,000—UNLOCKED). All ten Lazy Lairs will include a one-page lair description with general notes about the lair and read-aloud text for each of the lair's rooms or chambers. These lair descriptions will make it easy to use these lairs right at the table with very little preparation ahead of time.
Discounted Original Lazy Dungeon Master ($50,000—UNLOCKED). For those who don't have the original Lazy Dungeon Master, all backers will be able to buy the original Lazy Dungeon Master PDF for half price ($3) and $13 backers will also be able to buy the softcover version of the book for three bucks off ($7) from Lulu.com.
A Note on Print Delivery
As we have with Fantastic Locations and Fantastic Adventures, we will be fulfilling print copies of Return of the Lazy Dungeon Master for the Print Option tier through RPGNow. This means you will be able to purchase a copy of Return of the Lazy Dungeon Master directly from RPGNow at the cost of printing and shipping. We expect this cost to come to roughly $6 for the softcover book and $15 for the hardcover book plus $6 for shipping in Europe and the US. updates.update_content:
Hello backers of Return of the Lazy Dungeon Master! I want to thank you again for your outstanding support and I hope Return of the Lazy Dungeon Master helped you build the perfect system to prepare and run your best RPGs. I also hope you’ll help put together another wonderful book by backing the Kickstarter for Fantastic Lairs: Boss Battles and Climactic Encounters for 5e.
Fantastic Lairs is a book of boss battles and climactic encounters for your 5e D&D games. Each lair is a well-tuned boss battle designed so that you can easily drop it into your own D&D adventure or campaign. Each lair includes evocative art, a full-color map, hooks to connect it to your own adventures, optional lair expansions, customization options, and, of course, a big boss battle. Our goal is to give you a book of fantastic villains and dungeons that helps you do the heavy lifting involved in dropping a boss showdown into your own game.

campaign.story:
The keys to everything you love bundled together.
  Howdy! We’re Quentin and Dan from Elderwood Academy, and this Kickstarter we’re inviting you to live our dream together: staying home with tiny dice in tiny wood-carved boxes. Never again need you be the fool at the party without an emergency set of dice contained within a vanity dice holder. Also, free advice: don’t go to parties. Wear PJs and make your friends come to you.
Like their prodigious progenitors, Hex Chest Minis are crafted in a spectacular array of wood options, delicately appointed with engraved art, and finished by hand. They offer a pleasing permutation of personalization, precision, and polish packed into a precious parcel, prepared to portably protect your playthings.
This Kickstarter we’re partnering up with Norse Foundry to make Pebble dice exclusively available along with your Mini Hex Chest. Pebble dice are brand-new miniature zinc-alloy cast masterpieces you could (but absolutely should not) eat like jellybeans and come in a wide range of finishes and themes. If micro precision machined aluminum is more your speed, that's an option, too.
Does it *seriously* have to get this cold? Stay inside, people. Also, it's Purpleheart with Gnomish Copper dice.
  Start off by selecting a wood choice that speaks to you. Choose between the Classic line, which includes Walnut, Cherry, or Mahogany, and the Exotic line which expands your options to include Purpleheart, Lacewood, or Padauk. All Minis are hand-sanded until they're river-stone smooth, tasted for vintage, then brushed with oil for a lasting finish.
Classic wood options
The Classic selection lets you choose between Walnut, Mahogany, and Cherry options. Open and Beehive interiors available with all rewards.
Exotic wood options
The Exotic selection lets you choose between Padauk, Purpleheart, and Lacewood. Open and Beehive interiors available with all rewards.
  Upon an un-warmed rock we espied Padauk with Nightmare Black and Purpleheart with Gnomish Copper. Then we wised up and went home. #Indoors4Life
  All Hex Chest Minis come with engraved art. The Classic line have the Elderwood phoenix etched upon them while the Exotic line opens up your choice of Signature art.
  When pledging for an Exotic Hex Chest Mini, get your choice of Signature art. Classic line all include complementary Elder Phoenix art
  Oh, is it still cold outside? Get wrecked, mother nature. PS Mahogany with Nightmare Black dice.
    The best kind of dice tower
A dice box with dice is a harp playing Crazy Train (hauntingly gratifying). Since we’re partied with Norse Foundry’s minstrels we’re thrilled to be able to offer Pebbles, their new mini metal dice, to accompany you on your quests. Pebbles are forged using zinc-alloy and cast with your choice of six different finishes.
Pebble Dice
Psst. Wanna get low after class?
Miniature Aluminum Dice
If Pebbles aren't getting your rocks off, may we suggest these solid machined aluminum minis? Each set is precision cut to give you the truest rolling in the smallest package possible.
They come in purple, green, black, red, and blue anodized finishes
Miniature Plastic Dice
If you've already got yourself a chunk of randomized metal, you'll also have the option of our Rare Earth Superplastic dice in blue, red, and black. We should note for legal and also common sense reasons that "Rare Earth Superplastic" is remarkably similar to "regular plastic" in that it is regular plastic.
  We had to lean out a window to take this shot. #Courageous. Mahogany and Purpleheart with blue plastic mini polys.
When the campaign closes you’ll be able to further customize your Hex Chest Mini so it can serve you best. Determine your interior design with either Beehive or Open styles. Beehive captures each mini die in its own micro-tomb while Open is more emotionally approachable.
Next, you’ll want to choose whether you want a loop adapter on your Mini Hex Chest (never open your front door diceless ever again) or if you’d rather go with the symmetric all-smooth-sided style. The loop lets you mount your Mini on a keyring, a pocket chain, or a necklace while the all-smooth-sided style slides blindly into a pocket without a hitch.
Open to the left of me, Beehive to the right, here I am, stuck in the middle with you
  This time around we changed things up. Because we hit our stretch goal for the campaign we'll be planting 500 trees! That's enough to cover approximately half a million small wooden projects! Planting will begin near the end of the campaign :D
  Well let’s just say that Minis are 2.1 inches by 2.8 inches whereas other objects can be as large as 11 by 83 inches. Notable! Pebbles are 8.5mm to 13mm (10mm standard scale).
  Quentindo Switch and Danton Abbey are two nerdy boys with big eyes for tiny wood projects. When Q isn’t lounging in the tropics, he spends his time immersed in historical fanfiction and fanfiction reenactments. D likes turtles. You can reach out to and bop either of us any time at info@elderwoodacademy.com, @elderwoodboxes on Twitter, at our Facebook page, or on our waterwheel-powered website.
Norse Foundry is a precision dice and RPG accessory forge founded (...foundried?) on the belief that tabletop gaming can be more fun with the addition of quality gaming gear. Their expert smiths have been fashioning metal dice and coins for adventurers for years. You can digitally stick your hands in their fires here.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We’re Kickstarting Minis and Pebbles because they’re brand new to us and we want the opportunity to create a refined, lasting process around crafting them. We'd like Minis and Pebbles to grow old together and we hope you'll be a part of their origin story. If you join us on our Mini journey you’ll get a first-row seat as together we make micro history.

Hex Chest Minis are our smallest project to date by an order of magnitude. This experience will challenge us to adjust our crafting processes, and offers us the unique opportunity to simultaneously grow our skills while shrinking them.

updates.update_userinfo: Possum Apocalypse, Minis fulfillment, and new Kickstarter
updates.update_content: Hiiiii lads, ladies, and lorebeasts! Today's update will include a simply staggering slew of syntax and scansion. Assuming you're staggered by misleading descriptions. Bonus for today's update: black bugs blood and backflip on the blacktop are difficult to say quickly.

Goooood morning Elderfans! We realised today that we're very close to completing our new game, Rock 'em Sock 'em Possum. Expect a narrow release some time in 2019: The Possum Uprising. All years should have subtitles, no?

updates.update_userinfo: Minis and dices and loops, oh my!
updates.update_content:
Tiniest greetings and most excellent July salutations, microbackers! In spite of their low size, we're in high gear furiously blasting bits of wood into hexagonal and hexagon-adjacent shapes (but not sizes. Sizes are all small).
Behold! The sacred art of photographs becoming stories!

updates.update_userinfo: Looping in your pledge manager (until June 4th)
updates.update_content:
Apparently Loopin' Louie is a real game from the 90s, and it involves Germans playing it hammered. The past is the future and the future is druuunk! Today we're talking about metal loops that relate marginally more to Hex Chest Minis than niche kids games, and also some deets about pledge manager.
Manage your pledges, son!

updates.update_userinfo: Surveys Out for Minambe. Er, Minis
updates.update_content:
Hiiiii backerinos! And... backerinoids? First the best and gooiest news: pledge manager surveys are ready to accept your clicks and types! Head over to the surveys and mash on your keyboard until we know exactly what you pledged for :) You should have received an email from Pledge Manager giving you special login info and such.
As an extra "thank you" for supporting our latest wood-and-dice dalliance, we've made discounted bundle pricing on add-ons available exclusively to our Kickstarter backers (in other words, you :p).

Awww snaps! Once again you've all done an incredible Kickstarter rumba and bowled us over with your generosity. We were expecting this to be a fairly petite Kickstarter but you all decided to make a big thing out of our small things, and we couldn't be more full of gratitude over it :D Seriously, you guys are incredible and we'll never get over the warmth and support of the community. It's surreal, though; we woke up this morning just shaking our heads going "WTF?? How!? Whuh...what?" Then we jumped a few times. It was a great start to the day.
Surveys

Dice interest survey and a bunch of updatelets!

updates.update_content: Wooo!! Thank you all so much for making our first 24 hours ridiculously voluminous. The response so far has been way beyond what we were expecting. campaign.story:
Revilo is a fantasy world that I created to inspire my son to explore his creativity and imagination. I tell stories of the creatures through my sculptures, many of which were his original idea.
I named the world Revilo because it is Wyatt's middle name backwards, and Ttayw just didn't have a nice ring to it. As a kid I constantly found myself drifting from reality by immersing myself in someone else's world. The settings felt like a realm that I could explore when I didn't feel like I fit in with other kids. By creating Revilo, I wanted to build a place where the creatures would know Wyatt as a champion of their world, and where he would always be protected.
I have sculpted over 50 different species that inhabit the 12 major regions of Revilo. Each has a backstory to explain how they all intertwine within the world.
      Click the image to see bigger images
             Sample Pages
       A short documentary about me:
  PLEDGE LEVEL DETAILS
Coins of Revilo – Each Coin set will contain ten coins, two of each, so that you can display the front and back at the same time. The four coins with the "C" icon on them represent different values of Cree and each have a unique texture behind the icon. The Murk's Hollow coin is the newest currency introduced to Revilo. These are 35mm wide, 3mm thick, and have a nickel finish.
Creature Collection – The book will be 120 pages, hardcover, and 8.5" x 11". It will have a short history of Revilo, the pantheon of gods, a map of Revilo inside the covers, and then the species will be broken down by regions. Each species will have a photo, illustration, and story about them.
Collector Combo – This collects the Creature Collection book, the Coins of Revilo, and a unique sketch card of a creature from Revilo.
Explorer Level – At this level you want to help discover a new species. You truly want to travel to Revilo! 

We will collaborate on an idea for a creature together. Once the concept is finalized I will sculpt, paint, and create the narrative for the critter. It will be added to the Creature Collection Volume 1, and the final sculpture will be delivered to you! You’ll also receive all of the items from the Collector Combo pledge level.
Mix & Match
Want more than one item? Pledge for the highest level you want, then add on the cost of the additional items to your pledge. Once this is all wrapped up you will receive a survey to let me know which items you want mailed to your door.
Kickstarter Live
I will be streaming live:
Thursday 1/18 at 8:00 pm EST 
Thursday 1/25 at 8:30 pm EST
What's the Plan
The book is 90% designed with press-ready files. The last 10% will be finished with new creatures from the Explorer pledge level and if we will meet a stretch goal include additional pages. Once funded I will send over the existing file to the printer to get a physical proof made of the majority of the book. I want to have these books in hand for a bunch of conventions this year, so I launched the Kickstarter with this as close to finished as I could.
Shipping
All shipping will be calculated and charged separately through the pledge manager option after the campaign is over. All products will ship at the same time. If you should have any question about products and locations please private message us for more information.
Partnerships
I have partnered with Norse Publishing, a division of Norse Foundry®, to publish and manufacture all of the components of this campaign. If you know their work, you know the craftsmanship is fantastic.

I have been doing print design and partnering with printers since 1997. The overall manufacturing process should go very smoothly, and Norse Publishing (a division of Norse Foundry) is handling all of the production.

This is being manufactured overseas. That is the only hiccup I can see happening with delivering on time, but I padded the delivery time to account for any unknowns.

campaign.story:
The Apocalypse. Götterdämmerung. Ragnarök. It goes by many names, but in the end there are only ashes. The heavens have fallen and in their wake a void beckons to be filled. Mythic Arcana is an epic card and dice game about the creation of a new pantheon from the remains of shattered ones. Choose your gods wisely and use them to battle the opposition. Only one pantheon can reign supreme.
In Mythic Arcana 2-4 players will take turns summoning gods through the roll of dice. Recruit gods to do your bidding: alter dice results, destroy enemy gods, and unite the ultimate pantheon.  
The first player to obtain a god in each domain: Heavens, Life, Wisdom, War, and Death, will reign over the heavens victorious.
    prototype pictures
 Mythic Arcana was designed way back in 2014, however, due to the sheer volume of artwork required for the game to resonate, it ended up on the backlog. In it's current iteration, we've brought the artwork and visuals to the forefront by printing them on large tarot-sized cards. We think this adds to the premium feel and gives the artwork the resplendent space it needs. But we didn't stop there; the whole game is wrapped in tightly competitive yet approachable gameplay mechanics that anyone can pick up and enjoy. A typical game of Mythic Arcana lasts between 15 and 25 minutes depending on the number of players. 
What's in the Box?
Each box contains more than 70 individually illustrated tarot-sized cards (70mm x 120mm) and a set of twelve (16mm) dice in 4 different player colors. 
example of dice
  Gameplay is deceptively simple. Deity cards are displayed on the table, you summon them based on what you roll, and collect one of each type to win. The challenge comes from choosing the right gods and goddesses to not only prevent your opponent from completing the set, but also protecting your own pantheon and manipulating your dice rolls. 
Athena & Fujin
Deities have various abilities that will influence the game. Arrival abilities occur as soon as a god is summoned. Presence abilities are constantly in-effect and can do anything from increasing your dice total, to protecting your gods from destruction. Feats are unique abilities that require a god to be exhausted in order to use. Finally, Destruction abilities take place when a god is destroyed- they'll make you think twice before attacking!
For Mythic Arcana we drew from famous classical mythologies to populate the world. You'll discover gods and goddesses from Greek, Norse, Hindu, Egypt, and Shinto mythologies and folklore. 
Check out some gameplay videos to see more!
How To Play
You can also find a video of a playthrough in our developer update.
Curious for more? Open up the draft rulebook or try the Print & Play for more info!

Tau Leader Games is a small independent game studio based out of New York. Our games focus on fun ideas and clear playability - any approach that ensures our games hit your table. We still believe Kickstarter is a place for innovative ideas and works in progress, not a place to pre-order already made things. We still need your help and support.
Tony is a visual designer and UX specialist currently residing in New York. He owns and operates Tau Leader Games as the main game designer and is responsible for art direction, shipping logistics, and publishing. This is his 4th published game, following Hunters of Arcfall, Dragon's Ransom, and Deep Space D-6.
Tim is a freelance concept designer, illustrator and author based in Australia, whose works can be found in places such as Editions Delcourt, Gunfire Games, Ankama, Blur studios, Blizzard Entertainment, and Wizards of the Coast. Tim brings a unique style to the world of mythology. He is doing all the artwork to ensure the game has a consistent look and feel.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Mythic Arcana represents a large body of work! Though the game is already designed and playtested, we're continuing to illustrate each deity as their own unique piece of art. Meanwhile, playtesting and balancing will continue as the cards are being finalized. 

This is my 5th Kickstarter game project. What I've learned from each of them is that every project is different with manufacturing, shipping, and fulfillment changing as often as every month. I have done what I can to minimize risks and shorten time frames. Nevertheless, even my projects suffer from dreaded Kickstarter delays of a few months. 

TauLeaderGames has a 100% delivery rate, however, in the interest of transparency our most recent project (Deep Space D-6 Reprint) is still waiting to be fulfilled with an expected delivery of early 2018 (a few months behind schedule).

June 2018 is our best estimate for a project of this scope and I'm confident we'll be able to hit it based on everything we've learned.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks and challenges

The one main risk that we have to acknowledge is the potential for this campaign to go well beyond our expectations in terms of demand. We are hoping for a great response, but demand beyond our expectations could be the main risk for delays. Our last Kickstarter was very manageable in terms of scale and we have the ability to cater to a larger response. There is of course a point where production levels could influence the time of delivery.
This is our smallest Kickstarter yet. Our previous campaign is well into production and comfortable for our outlined shipping date.

From the experience of 2 kickstarters under our belt, we have ironed out our pipeline and improved the production process. We aim to cater our kickstarters accordingly, to be a comfortable size to ensure we hit our goals.

We have allowed a 11 month period for production which is potentially more than we need if the project is inline with our previous project, but we'd rather be early as opposed to late. Our previous campaign was over twice the size in terms of mini quantity and is on track for the same time period. Our biggest goal is to break the Kickstarter trend and be early on this campaign. We hope we can achieve that but we'd be happy to fulfil the orders on time.

Each campaign comes with it's own challenges and it's own risks. We always have to take into account unforeseen circumstances. We feel very prepared but are not capable of foreseeing any future hurdles. From our experience they tend to be small ones.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone,

After what ended up to be a rather stressful delay due to improvements, we can finally announce we have now shipped all orders! This kickstarter is complete! We hope you are happy with the final products! With our sincerest thank you, you have all made this project possible and we now have a wide range of Mythology miniatures in our collection of products!

Hi Everyone!

A large batch of Colossus boxes are leaving the building this week and another batch next week! They've been passed through Quality Control, Bagged with bases and are being put into pre-packed colossus boxes to leave the building. This means that a lot of you will have your order shipping notification come through any day now!

Hi Everyone!

Today we finally reveal the Hydra!
Shipping Info: We have hit full numbers on the Chimera and the Manticore. The Hydras are coming off the line. This means the remaining KS orders will have these items slotted into the already packed packages and they will be leaving the building as they come off the line maintaining the queue. Thank you all for your patience, and again our sincerest apologies for the delay. I hope the last 3 models to some degree make up for the wait.

Hi Everyone!
At this stage, the larger proportion of kickstarter backers have now received their orders or received shipping notices. The segmented group of backers who have ordered the Colossus box or have an order that contains any of the Chimera, Manticore and Hydra are still waiting on shipping confirmation.
For this you have our sincerest apologies. We ambitiously aimed to be complete in January, following the outlined delays. But regarding the lack of information and updates, there is no excuse and it is unacceptable. We do like to pride ourselves on our customer service and communication. But this is not the first time we have lapsed as the pressure and work load builds. An update should have been posted to inform you that it has pushed into February shipping.
Hi Everyone!

Hi Everyone!

We are very proud to announce that we started shipping on Thursday 29th November, and the first orders are starting to arrive in the UK. We expect some of our Europe orders to land this week and then ROW (aka based on shipping times)

We have a lot of Kickstarter orders to battle through and we will be trying to get through them as quickly as possible.

We truly hope you love them as much as we do. They have been a pleasure to work on and hopefully we've done them justice. I know that images can be helpful but also an issue on a campaign this long. We do like to spend that extra time pushing the models to be the best they can be. We are looking at smaller projects in the future so we release less but our hope is to have casts and final renders ready on release.

We would like to thank you for all of your constructive feedback and hope you've felt we listened. Pulling the werewolves, resculpting and reprinting them has given us a much better product and for that..... thank you.

To those of you who won't add them to a box on top of another box full of miniatures, we'd love to see some of them painted and will be doing a painting competition with them, once all orders have landed in their new homes!

We have a new photography session booked in where we'll show more of the range. Hopefully it will generate some further excitement while people are waiting for the post man :)

updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone!

Thank you all for your patience. Things have been a little hectic with throwing the werewolves back through sculpting changes, printing and production.

We have had a photography session and I've prepared today a quick teaser while I work through the rest of the images!


To update you on progress. We had a little set back with the werewolves and agreed with the criticism we received on the initials edits we made. So we pulled them from production and went back to square one. That being said I can now announce that shipping will start late November :)!! This will take weeks to battle through all of the orders but rest assured they'll be on their way soon and I hope you love them as much as we do...

Please note that we require to be notified on any address changes via email so that it can be handled manually. So please email me directly with any changes in your address, or even if you want to reconfirm that your address has been changed if you have already done so :)

Hi Everyone!

Today, we would like to show the significant improvements we made to the werewolf models. They're in production and we can't wait to see the results!

We really tried to push the anatomy and fur as realistic yet miniature appropriate as possible! 

We hope you like them :)! 

Minotaurs progress coming shortly!

campaign.story:
Dungeon In A Box is a subscription box that delivers everything you need for your next RPG adventure! It's your monthly dungeon crawl - in a box!
  Dungeon in a Box gives you everything you need to run an epic  adventure compatible with the Dungeons & Dragons (5th Edition) RPG. 
As a monthly subscription service, we deliver a brand new adventure right to your doorstep, complete with campaign book, minis, maps and more!
Whether you want to take a group of characters from level 1 to 20 - or just run a few exciting one-shots, you get everything you need.
It's time for your adventure to start!
      You are guaranteed TWO premium, sculpted miniatures in every Dungeon in a Box - everything from dashing adventurers to grotesque abominations!
  32mm-scale (compatible with all major RPGs), and sourced from industry-leaders like CMON and Reaper - our minis are resilient, highly-detailed, and great for painting.  
All premium minis are blind-boxed and drawn from a wide assortment of beautiful sculpts. It's the perfect way to expand your collection - whether you own just a few well-won favorites, or have a wall of hundreds.
      Cover from "Caravan of Peril"
20-pages of jam-packed adventure, brought to life with full-color illustrations from the best artists in the industry!   
Each month's box includes a brand-new, all-original adventure. Exciting encounters and rich story propels your party toward climactic set-piece battles that play out on the included battle map.
Everything you need to know to run the adventure is in the book, making the game accessible for everyone from first-time DM's to seasoned grognards looking for something new.
Download an excerpt for "Caravan of Peril" here!
  Adventures build on each other from month to month - forming a year long campaign arc that raises your party from lowly adventurers to heroes of the realm! However, campaign play is strictly optional. Each adventure book provides rules to adapt it for characters of any level or game world. Take just the bits you like, or play the whole epic quest - the choice is yours!
Dungeon in a Box adventures are compatible with 5th Edition Dungeons & Dragons, and work in conjunction with the three core rule books - Players Handbook, Dungeon Master's Guide & Monster Manual
What to see more? Download an excerpt for "Caravan of Peril" here!
    Tavern Map
These huge 24" x 18", fold-out battle maps bring your encounters to stunning life - and are designed exclusively for that month's Dungeon in a Box.
Printed in gorgeous color, and overlaid with a 1" grid, each map is hand-made to accompany that month's adventure. They fit in just was well with your existing stockpile of battle maps to help you run future skirmishes. 
From castle roofs to volcanic craters - these maps bring your adventure to life! 
Our maps are printed on satin-finish, 80# paper to ensure they look great and are long-lasting.
    Flat Plastic Minis - infesting the sewers
Whether it's packs of wolves or mobs of goblins - there are some situations that monster tokens just work better for.
We include a set of "Flat Plastic Minis" in every box - the gorgeous self-standing monster tokens by ArcKnight Games. These tokens are vividly colored, phenomenally detailed, and feature distinct front and reverse sides. They're so striking, they might just steal the spotlight from your conventional minis!  
Each Flat Plastic Mini comes with a clear acrylic base that lets them stand up to dominate the battlefield - and then lay flat for easy storage.
  Flat Plastic Minis - close up
    2D and 3D Dungeon Terrain
Whether it's a surprise pit trap, or a secret door swinging open, placing a single dungeon tile can change an entire game. That's why we include a full set of dungeon terrain in every box!   
Each Dungeon in a Box holds a variety of dungeon terrain - including detailed terrain tiles and dynamic, 3D dungeon features. From wagons and campfires, to magical walls and portals, these accessories let you change the flow of battle and bring a scene to life.
All dungeon terrain is sized for standard 32mm scale mins, and hand-picked to help the DM run the adventure. Universally compatible, you can drop these battle field features into any RPG.
    The Civilized and Uncivilized Lands of the Greenwold
Every month, Dungeon in a Box takes you through a complete adventure - but why stop there? Each box is also part of an ongoing Campaign Arc that takes your characters from humble heroes to saviors of the realm! 
Go on legendary quests in the Greenwold, the world of adventure popularized by Crit Juice podcast, and written by DM David Crennen.
Each adventure arc is made of 12 parts - telling a complete story over the course of a year! All Kickstarter subscribers receive the first adventure in the arc when they sign up, and receive the next adventure each month after. Need to put your subscription on hold? No worries - we make pausing your subscription painless. 
Want even more? Dungeon in a Box subscribers are sent monthly digital dispatches that contain pages of supplemental content that reveal realm lore and hidden NPC secrets to truly bring the world to life.
Prefer not to join the campaign? Not a problem! Each box works on it's own as a self contained adventure. Quest through the campaign world, or simply dabble in one-off adventures - the choice is yours!
Back us for 1 month or 1 year - the choice is yours!
Dungeon in a Box tells a year long campaign arc - told across 12 interlinked quests. Pledge at the yearly level to experience the whole adventure!
For this Kickstarter only, yearly backers will also recieve a bonus 13th adventure for free, complete with minis, maps and everything else! 
  Pictures not representative of final product. All minis, maps and other components are unique every month.

    Pictures not representative of final product. All minis, maps and other components are unique every month.
  Back  at the 12 month level and get a bonus 13th Adventure for FREE!
The bonus adventure includes everything you'd get in regular monthly adventure - including minis, maps, adventure book, and more!
This exclusive offer is only available for Kickstarter backers at this level - and will not be available anywhere else!
Pictures not representative of final product. All minis, maps and other components are unique every month.
   MORE TO COME...
Dungeon in a Box is a monthly subscription service. Sign up to have a complete quest delivered to your doorstep every month. Subscriptions can be as as short as one month, or as long as one year. 
Rates beginning at $17.50/month for an annual subscription, plus shipping and handling. You'll be charged up front for the whole subscription period, and receive boxes regularly every month after.
Because life is uncertain, we make it easy for you to pause or cancel your subscription at any time, for any reason. Simply get in touch with our customer service team, and we'll help you out. When you're ready to start again, you can resume your adventure right where you left off.
We stand by the quality of all our products. Every box is guaranteed to contain brand-new, untouched products straight from the factory. If anything arrives dented, damaged or dirty we'll ship you a replacement immediately!
Each box is hand-curated by us, and includes exclusive content not available anywhere else. 
What are you waiting for - Join the Party!
     Currently, Dungeon In A Box is only available in Canada & the US.
The shipping and handling for each month's box in charged as part of your pledge when you back. The longer the length of your subscription, the cheaper the cost of your shipping and handling!

Risks and challenges
There are a number of risks with any Kickstarter project, and we'll be doing everything in our power to keep things running as smoothly as possible. 

Production, shipping and communication all present unique challenges. However, we are dedicated to being open and honest with all our backers. If we ever roll a natural one on any of these skill checks, we'll be sure to let you know right away and keep you up to date on everything we're doing to get back on track.

Thank you so much for checking out the Dungeon in a Box Kickstarter. Don't be afraid to leave a comment or ask a question!

REFUND POLICY

All pledges can be refunded up to 14 days after the end of the Kickstarter campaign - fees included.

campaign.story:
Chosen as a BackerKit Staff Favorite!
The Mimic Chest
At first glance, it looks like a normal treasure chest. Roll high enough in perception, and you can see that it's actually a precision-crafted, compact, durable, magnetic transforming caddy for all your tabletop game gear.
Ready to play? Take off the straps, dice vaults, and pen cases from the top of the chest. Snap the two halves of the coaster together, then turn the sides of the Mimic Chest into a dice tower. Turn over the dice vaults and pen cases to use them as card stands, then unload all the tablets, hero vaults, hundreds of dice, and whatever else you carried in there, and you're ready to play!
Hero Vaults are available, plus free dice!
Now you've done it. Hero Vaults are available as add-ons to any pledge! They will fit up into the space under the dome of a Mimic Chest and they'll fit snugly inside a Tankard.
To add a Hero Vault (or two or three), simply increase your pledge amount! You'll be able to choose Hero Vaults as an add-on in our post-campaign survey. Three Hero Vaults will fit stacked inside a Tankard or nestled in the top of a Mimic Chest. Basic/Standard Hero Vaults are $15, and Premium Hero Vaults are $25. There is no shipping charge for Hero Vaults, when they are added on to a Mimic Chest or Tankard pledge.
Now every Mimic Chest comes with three sets of dice to fill your dice vaults! Keep telling your friends, family, foes and FLGSs about us, and we could easily reach the LASER ENGRAVING goal at $80,000.
The Mimic Chest is easy to take apart and re-assemble, and it carries all your tabletop gaming gear!
  Stretch Goals!
First Look At Hero Vaults
How We Started
Polymorph Crafts began in December 2016 when Matt put his engineering and woodworking skills to work to create a portable, affordable, simple wooden chest that would hold everything he needed to play Dungeons & Dragons. But that wasn’t enough. What if he could figure out a way to turn it into a dice tower and rolling tray, too?
We even bought a tiny treasure chest to make sure the scale was correct.
Matt went right to work on the computer, and soon we were looking at a 3D model of a Mimic Chest and all its components. He took measurements out to the shop, and made our original prototype by hand. It wasn't perfect, but it was functional, and we knew we had something special. In order to share Mimic Chests with you, we knew that we would need to be more efficient and precise. 
With our very first prototype, we could tell we were onto something, but it needed to be perfect!
We purchased a CNC router, and Matt created prototypes two and three. He made custom jigs and toolpaths, and we found local magnet, leather and wood suppliers, and we decided the time was right to launch our Kickstarter.
Precision tools like CNC routers help us make sure that every magnet lines up perfectly!
How Your Mimic Chest Is Created
After every piece is cut to size and the holes are drilled, we carefully glue in the magnets, apply stain and clear-coat, and glue down the felt or suede rolling tray surface.
Every magnet is placed by hand to make sure its polarity is correct.
Over two hundred magnets keep the Mimic Chest sturdy while allowing for quick and simple transformation. Then we add rivets and clasps to the leather straps, sew the nylon straps together, do one last quality check, and send the Mimic Chests out the door!
Basic, Standard, and Premium
Basic Mimic Chest
Our Basic tier was designed for the budget-conscious gamer. We kept costs down by using high-grade plywood, nylon straps, and wool felt.
Standard Mimic Chest
The Standard tier is a bit fancier, made from the same wood but upgraded to leather straps and suede. 
Premium Mimic Chest
If you really want to make a statement, choose a Premium tier reward; they're made from solid wood and include leather straps and a suede-lined rolling tray.
Choose Your Own Mimic Chest
When our campaign ends, we will send a survey to all backers so you can choose your rewards. This includes choosing the color for your wood and rolling tray lining, and the colors for your free dice sets! You can also choose a vegan-friendly option: a $0 add-on at checkout to change Premium leather straps and suede lining to nylon and felt.
Dice Tray Linings
Basic Mimic Chests have wool felt color options:
Purple, Blue, Red, Black
Unlocked Felt Colors!
Pink, Green, Orange, Brown
 Standard and Premium Mimic Chests are available in four suede colors:
Purple, Blue, Red, Black
Unlocked Suede Colors!
Orange, pink, teal, and brown suede unlocked!
Note: we are on the lookout for a more foresty-green suede to add as well. More info to come soon.
Stains and Woods
Basic and Standard Mimic Chests are available in five stains:  
Red, Oak, Natural, Purple, Espresso
Premium Mimic Chests are available in four woods:
Walnut, Maple, Padauk, Purpleheart
Dice Vaults and Tankards
Tankard
If you don't need a dice tower and rolling tray, consider backing us for a Dice Vault or Tankard reward level! We have taken the Dice Vaults from the Mimic Chest and are offering them separately or as a set of ten, combined into a Tankard. Tankards are made from seven dice vaults, three pen cases, and two coasters, and include straps for easy carrying.
Tankards do not include a dice tower or rolling tray.
From Our Friends
Did you back the Deck of Many? We are proud to have partnered with them in creating a special card for those who backed their campaign at $49+ and ours at $99+! 
Do you live outside of North America? You'll get a coupon code good for 25% off a set of dice from DnDice, a wonderful dice vendor in the UK.
If you pledge for a Basic Mimic Chest, you'll get a 15% off coupon for a set of dice from the guys at Settling Geek!
Did you pledge for our Standard Mimic Chest? You're going to get a coupon for 50% off a set of dice from our friends at Tabletop Loot!
If you pledge for a Premium Mimic Chest or Tankard, you'll get a set of 7 polyhedral dice free with your reward, courtesy of Critical Hit Collectibles!
Relevant coupon codes will be sent out after our campaign is closed.
Already Backed Us? Tell Your Friends!
Tweet: "I just backed @polymorphcrafts on @kickstarter because I'm an awesome person! http://bit.ly/MimicChest"
Share on Facebook
How Will We Use Your Funds?
One set of dice and pen vaults takes about three hours in the CNC, so our wish list starts with a few more CNC routers to make everything more efficient. Our goal will also allow Matt to work for Polymorph Crafts full time until the rewards are completed.
Less Interesting, But Still Important
After the end of our Kickstarter, we will email you a survey where you can finalize your reward options. This includes stain, felt and suede colors, and wood type. It is also your chance to make sure that we have the correct mailing address for you.
A note on shipping: If you want us to ship to you but your country isn't listed, please let us know! Also, Premium rewards weigh more than Basic and Standard ones, so that's why they have higher shipping costs. And of course, if anything arrives damaged, please let us know and we will do our best to make it right!
For our backers outside of North America: please note, we are not liable for customs fees or taxes. This is why we are happy to provide Standard and Premium backers with a 25% off coupon code at UK dice vendor, DnDice. Hopefully that helps soften the blow when your rewards arrive.
Also, we now have a distributor in Germany, which should cut down on any customs fees or taxes you'd have to pay when your reward arrives. We are also adding countries to our ship-to list as requested, so if you don't see your country listed, send us a message!
When will my rewards arrive?
If we reach our funding goal, the first products will likely ship in Spring of 2018 (other than the December rewards). This will give us a chance to get the funds from Kickstarter, purchase material and machines, and create all your rewards! We will be shipping rewards as soon as they're ready to go, so not everyone will have the same shipping date. We plan on letting you know when your reward begins production and when it ships, but volume may make this tricky.
Please contact us with any questions or concerns throughout the campaign and fulfillment - we know how exciting and nerve-wracking it can be to have to wait for your rewards!
Important Note About Magnets
Your Mimic Chest, Tankard, and Dice Vaults are held together by 1/8" x 1/8" neodymium magnets. Each magnet has almost a pound of strength. We have done everything we can to make sure that the magnets do not come out of your Mimic Chest, Tankard, or Dice Vault. If any do come loose, please keep them away from children and animals!
Guarantee
We take pride in the things we create, but we also understand that wood is sometimes imperfect. If your rewards arrive damaged or if they break through regular use, please let us know! We are happy to replace or repair damaged pieces. You can always find us on Facebook or Twitter, or at info@polymorphcrafts.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are always hurdles during the transition from small-batch to full-scale, high-end production, many of which can be overcome with better tooling and more time. In order to address any issues with our tools, we will purchase carbide saw blades and router bits for precision cuts, a miter saw for improved consistency, and a small-gauge pneumatic nail gun to eliminate the risk of splitting wood during assembly. We need better tools to work with the leather straps and rivets, too. 

Other improvements will be realized via improved processes. Your pledge will enable us to dip stain instead of brushing, which provides deeper, more uniform color. We will also have a spray booth for clear-coat application, which provides uniformity and efficiency. Perhaps most importantly, we will manufacture better jigs to ensure that cuts and holes are precise to within thousandths of an inch.

Polymorph Crafts is committed to producing the best product possible, and we will continue to share updates in the shop and during assembly, showcasing these improved tools and processes and their results.

We have a working prototype; we have relationships with vendors for wood, magnets and leather; design and production processes are set; shipping has been calculated. We are confident that the boost we will get from your pledges is all we need to make Polymorph Crafts a grand success.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Thank you everyone for your patience during these last few months. Together Dice Bard and Polymorph Crafts have decided on a path forward.

updates.update_content:
18 walnut Mimic Chests are shipping today! Another big roll of packing paper should arrive today (I think this will be our fourth roll), which means we can pack up and ship out another 14 walnuts.
Purpleheart is underway and, of course, posing its own set of challenges. When you cut or sand the wood, it's brown. Over time it turns purple, and with much more time it turns brown again. The internet doesn't really agree on how to make it turn purple faster than "time, UV, heat, or prayers" ... so we're figuring it out.

updates.update_userinfo: Purple is a nice spooky color for Halloween, right?
updates.update_content: I don't want to take too much time away from your last-minute Halloween costume creation, so today's update is short. Let's be honest, most of you just want to know where we're at on purpleheart ...

Hello everybody! This week you’re hearing from Ducke, the otherwise-silent partner of Polymorph Crafts. Matt and Elsa are taking a break from social media and emails this week so that they can focus 100% of their efforts on completing the remaining rewards and add-ons.

First and foremost I want to say that we have all been listening to and feeling your frustrations. Specifically, we know some of you ordered basic or standard chests with premium add-ons and have been patiently waiting for the premium add-ons to be completed. We appreciate your patience; as a stark reality of falling behind our original schedule we don’t have additional funds to split the rewards into multiple shipments. We’ve been working 7 days a week for the last year trying our best to complete your backer rewards as timely as we can.

I’ve also been quietly working on the website and product photography so that we have a chance at a life after Kickstarter. It’s been a slow, difficult process rife with complications but it should be live in the next week or two! The biggest change being that our product pages will be substantially more informative and photogenic.

Phew. We machined and magneted 53 chests in 8 days. It took quite a few 12+ hour days and both of us all weekend, but walnut mimics are off of the CNC.
Half of them are done with poly - here they are drying on Sunday night. Blame the picture quality on the time of night it was taken.

I don't know if y'all like these time-lapse videos of Matt scurrying around the shop as much as I do ... but here's some more. He's been working lots of extra hours to get the padauk finished up and the walnut into the CNC.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Assuming we successfully fund, Andrew will need to complete the artwork for the components he has not yet done. This is likely to be the longest stage of the post-campaign production, and the most prone to any delays, since he is a freelance agent.

Beyond that, this is our third Kickstarter project, and we've learned much from the first two. I cannot say for sure what new challenges might come up, but I can say with confidence that I have addressed the issues that led to customer complaints in the past--primarily having to do with damages during shipping and manufacturing delays. I will be working with Panda Games manufacturing, who make great quality components. As for fulfillment, we will either go with ShipNaked or handle it directly in-house. This should eliminate the customer service issues that arose with Sans Alliés.

My fans are my most important priority. If you have any concerns at all, contact me right away at geoff@pastgo.net, and I will see that you are treated well. Thank you. Have fun, be happy.

Come Join the Fun at LexiCon 2018  April 20th noon to 22nd at 6:00pm, Lexington, KY.
It's LexiCon's Fifth Anniversary. Hooray! LexiCon Tabletop Boardgaming Convention is one of the best regional convention in the country because:
 Great Attendees Like You
 Our Ginormous Library, 1,500 + games and growing
 Learn to Play events, of which there are many

 West Sixth Brewing featured Adult Social Gaming Night Parties

Some highlights from last year: 
Over 1,100 turnstile attendees last year. 
Over 160 Scheduled Events including tournaments, board games, RPGs, LARPs, Cosplay and so much more. 
National Qualifying Tournament for Settlers of Catan.
The Unsurpassed Nighttime Adult Parties, sponsored by West 6th Brewing and The Barrel House.

Lexicon gives away a ton of prizes throughout the weekend, including prizes for just showing up in any kind of costume. 
Find up to date information here on our Facebook page.

Fifth Anniversary Surprise!
One of many surprises for our the LexiCon Fifth Anniveray is to have not one, not two, but three artists!  In addition, we will have two dice types this year in celebration of LexiCon 2018.  Here are the images for this years dice!
Dice Face for LexiCon 2018
Our Mission
LexiCon will be held annually and will be the most entertaining tabletop boardgaming weekend event that can be imaged by its creators. These events will focus on tabletop boardgaming and RPG activities in a Fun atmosphere that will include Cosplay, LARPing, a huge Gaming Library, and adult Game Parties. LexiCon will have lots of family gaming events during the day and specific gaming events focusing on adults in the evening. Finally, LexiCon will focus on diversity of people and games and expanding the joys of boardgaming to the community.
Venue
LexiCon will be held for the fourth year at the Clarion Hotel Conference Center at 1950 Newtown Pike, Lexington, KY 40511. The Clarion Hotel has had major update for all of their hotel rooms and conference center! Our rooms are significantly discounted over their regular rates and you can get this discount by stating you want the "LexiCon" rate.
Clarion Hotel
 Our Thanks to Everyone That Has Supported the LexiCon Kickstarter in 2015, 2016, and 2017  
LexiCon 2017, as our previous conventions, was a big success.  Thank You to everyone that has supported us, volunteered and participated.  We appreciate you making this the best board gaming event available in the region.  Thank You!
  Stretch Goals
Wow, we are putting up stretch goals on our first day!  Inconceivable.  Well lets start with an old favortie. 
$6.000:  Lets make Emery, our MC, wear the funniest (non crude please) costume we can.  We usually find the best costumes on Amazon, if you want to look for one.  :)  Pix below, last years costume for Emery.  Nice hat Emery!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have now had three successful conventions. Short of a major catastrophe, we expect a very successful Lexicon 2018. The real question is how big will it be? 
Among the things we have learned is to get the contracts in place as soon as possible to make sure individual events and convention enhancements happen successfully. Of course we have no control over the hotel if they make an error and there is a problem with the space; we apologize if a GM or a special guest does not show up for an event, we will do our best to find someone to take their place. Some events will become full, since we focus so much on having a large variety of events, rather than multiple versions of the same event, if this happens early, we will try to schedule additional sessions, but can not guarantee entry into any events.

We would like to sincerely thank our backers (Soldiers, Captains and Generals) for your passion and support for TRENCH!!!
If you missed the campaign, you will be able to pre-order the game and TRENCH merchandise for a limited time via our online store.
Designed by Rui Alípio Monteiro, TRENCH debuted in Portugal in 2013 where it's made a splash in the strategic board game scene. It's not only been recognized by NATO generals for its take on trench warfare, it's also been featured in the Mind Sports Olympiad and is taught at Universities, and now, you can own it too!
The 8x8 grid board is diamond-shaped; each player sets up his army on opposing sides of the "trench", which divides the board into two. As hostilities between the armies commanded by the players grow, each attempts to seize control over the trench in order to take full advantage of its strategic potential, hoping thus to breach the opponent's defenses and capture the most valuable and important pieces.
From the Soldiers to the General, each piece being subject to specific maneuvers all will have to cooperate in order to occupy the trench, invade the enemy's territory, and vanquish the foe. The army that manages to survive after two battles wins the game!
TRENCH Rules
The TRENCH rules are available to download in English, Spanish, French, German, Portuguese, Russian and we'll soon be adding Italian!
Download the rules here.
  Why TRENCH?
With its innovative algorithm, TRENCH realistically reproduces the movements of each military rank, making the game scalable in its degree of difficulty and making it almost impossible for the game to end in a draw.
With the synchronicity between the game rules and the war theme, the game is intuitive and easy to grasp, making it a useful and valuable tool in education and training environments.
The TRENCH (Premium) pieces are innovative. There is no other board game anywhere in the world with plastic injection in 2 colors and bi-matter, making its components exclusive from any other game.
The game itself is 100% language independent.
TRENCH Premium is made in Portugal with the highest quality and attention to detail.
The black and white represent the dichotomy between light and darkness, good and evil, sound and silence, life and death.
  TRENCH has managed to link beautiful design, a rigorous mechanism, the evocation of history, and the challenge of strategy to the addictive pleasure of creative leisure!
    TRENCH is more than just a game, it is also a timeless piece of art as well as a tribute to an important moment in human history, all of which are a representation of the TRENCH brand. To compliment the brand, we want to offer you an exclusive selection of TRENCH merchandise.
To add-on additional copies of the game or any of the following items, simply add the amount to your pledge. You'll be able to select the items you want in the pledge manager after the campaign ends. Please note: there will be a small shipping charge per item if ordered without a game. Items ordered without a game will be delivered April 2018.
This hardcover Strategy Guide features over 100 pages and provides the road map for the best strategies in the opening, middle, and end of the game, contains a history of the game, and more. The preface was written by General Loureiro dos Santos - full Professor and recognized Specialist in Strategy.
Be one of the first to own it, and learn the secrets of TRENCH!
A game of TRENCH goes best with a glass of Port wine - though if you prefer another type of drink we won't hold it against you! The TRENCH coasters come as a set of 2, to utilize for you and your opponent's gaming drink of choice. Choose between glossy acrylic and black acrylic.
The TRENCH dice (which is included in the General pledge level) is used to decide who starts the game by playing the black pieces, however it also makes a great add-on for dice collectors with its unique design.
  We want to support game stores around the world by offering the Kickstarter versions of TRENCH to retailers during the campaign. We treat retailer backers just like other backers in that they receive their rewards before we release regular retail games into distribution.
If you're a retailer, please contact Mike at info@outerlimitgames.com during the campaign for pricing information.
  The basics of TRENCH
1. Each player takes his turn moving 1 piece.
2. Each piece has a rank, which has restrictions on its movements, and on the number of squares it can advance each move (as highlighted in the animation below).
The trench adds another layer of strategy and depth, where each piece that occupies the trench has two advantages and two restrictions.
3. The player ends his turn after moving a piece, or when that piece captures an opposing piece. When capturing an enemy piece, place that piece in the square the enemy occupied.
4. The first player to capture opponent's pieces worth 25 points wins.
  The next two videos are in Portuguese, with English subtitles.
  TRENCH is available on Google Play and Tabletop Simulator/Steam. We encourage you to try it out in digital form! 
  Each edition of TRENCH is already fully upgraded using the highest quality materials and includes everything you need for the full game, which is why we do not have stretch goals.
Click here to visit the BGG page and become a TRENCH fan!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have experience running Kickstarters, and through that experience we have gained a better understanding of the complexities involved in this process, and all the unexpected road bumps along the way that can cause delays.

Most of our manufacturing will be done in Portugal, and the factories there have already proven their ability to deliver high quality games on time. They already have experience producing TRENCH, and the molds and tooling are ready to go. Our production manager, José Dias, understands the complex design of TRENCH better than anyone, and will oversee the production and QA.

We have established partnerships with freight and fulfillment companies around the world that we trust. Through our past experience, we have had the opportunity to learn and understand their processes, and they understand our expectations, both of which are paramount for navigating the complexity of international logistics.

It is our highest priority to deliver your reward to you on time and in perfect condition, and if we run into any issues during production or shipment, will we let you know right away. Most of all, you can expect free-flowing transparency and communication from us, and of course, lots of positive energy!
