updates.update_content:
Hello to everyone,

I hope everyone is doing wonderful and staying safe and well.  I ended up with Covid double pneumonia in January.  It has been a very tough last few months as my wife, daughter and mother-in-law all ended up getting Covid too. Fortunately, they recovered quickly.  Me on the other hand, with Covid double pneumonia, my heart became enlarged too.  I am slowly but surely recovering.  With that said, I am still moving right along with Trench and Tradeworlds.

Good afternoon everyone,

I hope everyone is doing well and staying safe.  We are all doing well here and trying to stay as safe as possible.  Happy Thanksgiving all of your in the United States.  

I wanted to give you another update on the progress as I want to stay as candid and transparent with you as possible.  As I mentioned in my last update in October, the Strategy Guide is in the printers hands.  Because of the significant cost increase due to doubling the number of pages, I checked with a few other printers so that I could see if I could reduce my costs.  Needless to say, I wasn't able to reduce the price much.  On Kickstarter, the book was projected to be around 100 pages but by the time Rui finished, it is now 208 pages.  Like everything else, doubling the pages and weight will be costly but for those that ordered it, it will be a bonus.  I realize it is my responsibility to make it happen, therefore I will cover the extra costs.

Good evening everyone,

First, I want to wish everyone well and hope you are all safe and in good health.  We are all doing well and beginning to heal.  I want to apologize for the delay in sending out an update.   You all have been very patient and understanding and I really appreciate that.

Hello everyone,
I hope everyone is doing well and staying safe during this Pandemic.  I want to give a quick update.  I am working on logistics with shipping and fulfillment.  Due to the Pandemic, our shipping and fulfillment company has made changes that will require a need for tweaking on our end.  I am trying to navigate that now and will keep you all informed.  Everything else is the same from the last update.

Hi everyone,
I hope all of you and family are healthy and staying safe. I know all  of us around the world are affected in some way by this Pandemic.   Please know that all of you are in my prayers, as I realize just how fragile life is.  I apologize for the delay in sending out updates, but  as most of you know, we lost our son, Mike to a heart attack in  December.  It has been a very tough few months and we greatly miss him  so much.  My wife, daughter and I struggle everyday with the reality that we no longer have Mike around.  It is without a doubt the toughest  thing a parent could ever deal with.  And of course, our daughter Heather,  and Mike were very close so it's been really hard on her.  On the bright  side, we know we will see Mike again one day in Heaven. It is that  assurance and our faith that has gotten us through this tough time.  My  wife, daughter and I are together in Upstate NY taking much needed time  together in order that we might heal, reflect and deal with the loss of  Mike.

I just wanted to give everyone a quick update.  I have very sad news.  Mike, my son and co-partner on this project passed away December 2, 2019 due to heart failure.  As most of you know, Mike was an large part of Outer Limit Games.  He was the brain behind most of the projects.  We will miss him more than words could ever say.  Mike was a Christian and loved Jesus and we know he is in Heather celebrating Christmas with our Lord and Savior.  My wife, daughter and I know we will see him again.  We have that blessed assurance as Christians.

This is just a quick update to share some photos of the completed manufacturing of the games, as "a select few" backers seemed to question whether or not we completed manufacturing (even though we already posted updates previously confirming completion of manufacturing and shared many pictures in those updates too). Mike is having to leave the business

Hi!  We're about a week or so late with this one, so my apologies!  The past several weeks have been hectic on our end, but we wanted to keep you in the loop and let you know things are still moving, albeit a bit slower than we'd all like. 
Since the last update, we did have a small road bump, but that has since been settled and we're moving right along. The photo we received of the first Strategy Guide looked a bit off, and upon taking a closer look we could see that it was not a "hard cover" like we had requested.  There was a communication issue on the printer's end, but we take responsibility for that and should have been clearer on what we wanted. We thought we were clear with our communication, but it goes to show you can never be too precise and it's a good idea to verify things more than once.

I've been playing this game for a while now, and I consider it to be at home among the deepest strategic games in the world. Not only has it a depth similar to chess, it has perhaps even more tension, which builds as the game goes on, because of the continual sense that you might be overlooking a move from your opponent. This comes in part because of the way the pieces are camouflaged against the board - you find yourself constantly verifying what's where. The battle for possession of the trench in the middle of the board is a recurring theme in the midgame and endgame, but even if you can command the trench, you are never secure from attack from behind. A truly great game, and one which we shall certainly see more and more in tournaments.

Our sincerest thanks to everyone for your support!  We are restructuring a few things and will relaunch with a more streamlined campaign on September 26th at 10:00am EDT.  The link to the new TRENCH campaign is below. We look forward to seeing you there!
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/outerlimitgames/140869766?ref=355302&token=37e11539
TRENCH is an abstract strategy board game based on the trench wars of WWI. Unlike most games, in TRENCH the 8x8 grid board is diamond-shaped; each player sets up his army on opposing sides of the "trench", which divides the board into two. As hostilities between the armies commanded by the players grow, each attempts to seize control over the trench in order to take full advantage of its strategic potential, hoping thus to breach the opponent's defenses and capture the most valuable and important pieces.
From the Soldiers to the General, each piece being subject to specific maneuvers all will have to cooperate in order to occupy the trench, invade the enemy's territory, and vanquish the foe. The army that manages to survive after two battles wins the game!
Versailles 1919 Edition
Why TRENCH?
With its innovative algorithm, TRENCH realistically reproduces the movements of each military rank, making the game scalable in its degree of difficulty and making it almost impossible for the game to end in a draw.
With the synchronicity between the game rules and the war theme, the game is intuitive and easy to grasp, making it a useful and valuable tool in education and training environments.
The TRENCH (Premium) pieces are innovative. There is no other board game anywhere in the world with plastic injection in 2 colors and bi-matter, making its components exclusive from any other game.
The game itself is 100% language independent.
TRENCH Premium and Minimalista Edition are made in Portugal with the highest quality and attention to detail.
  TRENCH has managed to link beautiful design, a rigorous mechanism, the evocation of history, and the challenge of strategy to the addictive pleasure of creative leisure!
TRENCH Rules
The TRENCH rules are available to download in English, Spanish, French, German, Portuguese and Russian. However, the game itself is 100% language independent.
Download the rules here.
    Premium TRENCH is an upgrade from the standard version that will be distributed to retail, schools and tournaments. The upgrades are highlighted below:
Made in Portugal
Features the exclusive and innovative bi-color/bi-matter injection ABS plastic pieces with arrows on the bottom.

The Premium edition box is made with 1st quality compact cardboard for a sturdy and solid feel. It is also recyclable and biodegradable, making it environmentally friendly.
*The limited 1st Edition (ADVANCE) copies ($89 pledge level) features a black box instead of a white box, the board does not include the algebraic notation, and there are some minor rules differences. Includes FREE SHIPPING but does not include unlocked Stretch Goals.

This luxury heirloom-quality box set of TRENCH is hand-made with exotic selections of wood, by skilled artisans. Its design is inspired by the Hall of Mirrors at the Palace of Versailles, and is a reminder of The Treaty of Versailles (signed in the Hall of Mirrors, Palace of Versailles, 28 June, 1919), which was the most important of the peace treaties that brought World War I to an end.
Made from exotic woods, including: Peruvian Walnut, Wenge, and Masseur Birch.

  Designed by Rui Alípio Monteiro, TRENCH first made its debut in Portugal in 2013, and has since been marketed throughout the country. That same year it was nominated for the Golden Geek Award for Best Abstract Strategy Game.  Over the past few years, TRENCH has been taught in schools and Universities, played in National Tournaments including the Mind Sports Olympiad in London, and has been recognized by the military Generals, including members of NATO.
  TRENCH in Military School
Synopsis of the Creation of TRENCH, by designer Rui Alípio Monteiro:
"The First World War always interested me because it was a defining moment in humanity’s history, the first global conflict and the most decisive event in the modern era up to that date. It was the war that changed the world and it continues to be one of the biggest nightmares in the history of humanity.
Designer Rui Alípio Monteiro and his wife Maria.
It was in the trenches that the direction of events was decided, in a drama lived out by millions of men who literally dug their own graves. A tribute to the solders of the trenches of the Great War is a hymn to strength and humanity, as well as to the capacity to adapt to inhospitable and challenging environments. This is the mission that TRENCH seeks to accomplish, at the same time as it condemns this humbling moment in human history, attempting to inform and alert people to the tragedies that occurred.
TRENCH Memorial dedicated to those of the Great War, along Portuguese sidewalk
However, TRENCH itself is a purely abstract strategy game, and although its theme is linked to these events, the trench battles are used only in the naming of the pieces, and, of course, in the Trench at the center of play. It is worth underlining the fact that victory is not a lottery, that luck is not a factor, because the life of the game comes from knowing how to exploit each mistake that is provoked due to the distraction of the opponent.
The rules of the moves are integral to the game’s algorithm, and allude to the march of battle units in the theater of operations. Their mechanism evokes the war of movement and trenches dug in World War I, with their dynamics very evident in the strategies marked out and duly implemented on the ground as the battle wears on.
Basing the rules of play, in part, on “The Art of War of Sun Tzu”, in addition to making a fusion of the cultures of West and East, situates TRENCH, as a body of work, in its appropriate ideological and philosophical landscape.
"TRENCH MEMORIAL", by Rui Alípio Monteiro, at “Sala S.Mamede, in Museum, Lisbon
Below is a Spanish overview of the history of TRENCH by Wargame Reviewer.
The Origins of the Design of TRENCH
The board is rich in geometric abstraction, simulating a battlefield, divided into two opposing territories and separated by two lines along the diagonal of the lozenge that symbolize the trenches and mark out the so-called “no-man’s land”.
The pieces, made in the purest cubist style, represent in a figurative way the ranks of an infantry or cavalry of an army, with its well-defined hierarchy, from the soldier to the general at the top of the pyramid of power.
The geometric design, in black and white – “Op Art” – is a humble homage to the classic Portuguese pavement, called “Calçada”, and it is also an integral part of the game concept.
• The optical illusion is intentional, creating a deliberate camouflage for the pieces on the board, simulating the camouflaged soldiers in their battlefield. Interestingly, the strategy of visual dissimulation was developed during World War I.
• The black and white represent the dichotomy between light and darkness, good and evil, sound and silence, life and death.
Well beyond its historic inspiration, the attractive, innovative and bold designs have sparked curiosity by being conspicuously different –nobody can remain indifferent to it.
"TRENCH has a different, clean and yet impactful design. The quality of the pieces and their design grabs attention. It is a game of light and shadow, black and white, revealing a symmetry and chaos, producing optical illusions, capturing the despair and the unsettling calm between the battles, while the generals study their best movements.” - Clube de Tabuleiro de Campinas (the Campinas Board Game Club, Brazil)

Shipping is VAT-free, as we absorb those costs for you. Backers in the US, Canada, EU, and Australia will receive games shipped from fulfillment centers within those regions.
How is Shipping Calculated?
Soon after the campaign is over, you will receive an email from Backerkit that directs you to a pledge manager where you can confirm or upgrade your pledge, and add games, or other “add-ons.”  Your shipping will automatically be calculated at that time based on the total weight of your order. Backerkit turns overpledges into a credit that you may use in the pledge manager.
Shipping Estimates
The rates below are good faith estimates of 2018 carrier rates plus freight. 
Purchase up to three copies of the same game edition and only pay shipping once. For example, if you live in Brazil and order three copies of the Premium edition, you would only pay a total of $22 for shipping.
Shipping is FREE for the Minimalista and Versailles 1919 editions.

  Though TRENCH has already been well received by many, its first production run was limited, and it was primarily marketed in its country of origin, Portugal, by Rui and Maria Monteiro. They have done an amazing job for the past few years, but they took it as far as they could. So we acquired the license, in an effort to make TRENCH more accessible to the world and give it the global exposure it deserves.
Manufacturing is expensive, and we need Kickstarter in order to produce the new editions of TRENCH and make them accessible to you. We also want to raise more awareness for TRENCH, in an effort to organize and run TRENCH tournaments in the future, and eventually develop a full tournament-style website similar to Chess.com.  We have very high expectations and faith in TRENCH, and your support will allow us to take it to the next level. 
Kids love TRENCH too!

Risks and challenges
We have experience running Kickstarters, and through that experience we have gained a better understanding of the complexities involved in this process, and all the unexpected road bumps along the way that can cause delays. 

Most of our manufacturing will be done in Portugal, and the factories there have already proven their ability to deliver high quality games on time. They already have experience producing TRENCH, and the molds and tooling are ready to go. Our production manager, José Dias, understands the complex design of TRENCH better than anyone, and will oversee the production and QA.

We have established partnerships with freight and fulfillment companies around the world that we trust. Through our past experience, we have had the opportunity to learn and understand their processes, and they understand our expectations, both of which are paramount for navigating the complexity of international logistics.

It is our highest priority to deliver your reward to you on time and in perfect condition, and if we run into any issues during production or shipment, will we let you know right away. Most of all, you can expect free-flowing transparency and communication from us, and of course, lots of positive energy!
